Really had fun of the game, played using the Radious of course, as the game without this mod is very messy but still fun.  BUT! there we are again; same old CA sh**t with DLCs tempting you with something 'awesome', adding a mechanic that should have already existed (yes, that's AMBUSHING, a pretty much COMMON strategic play) but no, you have to pay 15 euros to have that And even if i buy that, what will it give me? 30 hours at max, then i will realise that i bought just one more faction. :( Well now, when I was on rome 2 and Attila, i ignored such stupidity and i bought the DLCs. this time i will pass (finally realising that i was stupid all that time)  So unlike prevous titles this is a trilogy, because this time they're like 'If we can have 100 bucks for 1 game, why not make three of them!!!!!!!!!'  So, I'm sorry i liked the game, pretty awesome but i think that finally, after so many years of playing, that Total War is finally dead to me. Still though, if you want to, there are many other warhammer-themed games out there so try these.  PS. Oh I bet this review will be deleted very soon, hahahahaha , in this case you're pathetic guys   Sincerely,  A dissapointed fan :(

This is probably the worst game on steam. It's just cookie clicker or adventure capitalist but worse. Just imagine a game where you have to wait hours to do anything and has no actual action at all. Does that game seem good? And to add to that trainwreck of a game I just described, there are microtransactions! Who needs to wait for some monster to die when you can just use real money to speed things up? So when you play the game (should I even refer to it as a game?) you have two options: Wait incredibly long amounts of time for no reason, or pay real money to not wait incredibly long amounts of time. Or you can do the third option: Don't play it.

I definately recommend the game its alot of fun. However best players in game tend to go to the defending side everytime because you can more easily kill people that are pushing a wagon etc. In the end objectives get completed last minute because everyone is acting like its a tdm until they realize times almost up. Stay with your team most of all is my advice don't wander off like your Chuck Norris.  Just one complaint is the stamina bar. The stamina bar for knights or vanguards carrying these very heavy weapons seems like it was intended. For example knights with a sledge (that looks like it weighs 50lb!) can whip that thing around for a lonnnnnngggg time. For Christs sake they can even drag with it (dragging means to make weapon swing faster or slower). It seems like these big weapons should swing a little slower or drain more stamina. Bascially a player thats good with a sledge is like superman on the battlefield swinging a 3 times bigger hammer than thor probly with the same weight around lol. The swordsmen instead have the same stamina and weigh 3 times less. Swordsmen are supposed to be at least 2 or 3 times quicker but not in this game. All that armor and being able to function like a swordsman is like twilight zone weird to me.  For the non believers Go to your local knight apparell store and purchase some knight armor that could weigh anywhere from 60-100lbs. Ok now try to run wearing that and see if you can beat your friend who has no armor in a race!  Second test Go back to the store and grab the biggest sledge you can find, maybe the biggest 20lbs at menards or some ♥♥♥♥. Keep in mind the games hammer weighs a ♥♥♥♥ ton more! Now give your friend a standard medevial sword doesn't have to be special, new, clean, or whatever. Go outside and start swinging to the death! Notice that your friend sees you pick up sledge an swing from 10 miles away because? you guessed it, its heavy as ♥♥♥♥! One swing your friend backs up and swings left to right and your liver and other important organs seep down your legs. This is what any normal person with a hammer would do. Drop the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ weapon and run for the mother ♥♥♥♥ing hills!!!!!!

I've been playing total war since Rome: Total War. I've really enjoyed the different time periods and locations throughout the years that I've had the experience of playing. The addition of Total War is absolutely brilliant. I could not be more in love with this game. The fantasy element added to this game really compliments it in a way that I previously thought might destroy it. I've clocked some 57 hours into the game so far and I'm mostly only played as the empire. I've played a touch of the vampire counts and the dwarves and I have to say I'm extremely excited to play through with them.  The one thing old total war users may want to take into account is that this game is intentionally streamlined in some ways. For instance the settlement management is much easier to use. You don't have to balance food and sanitation (thank God) public order still exists but it is very easy to maintain. There aren't tons of units for each race. Some races have more units, some have less. However there is still strong rosters for each. Personally I really enjoy this feature of the game because I can focus on experimenting with the different combinations (all hail griffin calv).  If you've played either warhammer or total war I really suggest you try this game out. It is a really nice segway into either franchise.

In light of CA's DLC policy of charging rediculous amounts of money to add features that should already be in place when the game launches, I have changed my review from positie to negative. Paying $18.99 for a SINGLE RACE DLC is pathetic. What a greedy bunch of losers. This game was far from complete when it released and now I'm being asked to buy the remaining peices of the puzzle in $18.99 increments? Forget it! Luckily I didn't have to pay $7.99 to unlock the chaos faction (which is already a part of the game) because I pre-ordered the game, but it's stupid that others did have to pay for it. I did buy the gore pack because playing a total war game without blood just doesn't make sense. But that was only $3.00. I can understand paying $3.00 for a DLC, not $18.99. No freakin way. This crap has GOT to stop. There are tons of DLCs left to come and if this is what they are going to be charging then I'm done with this game, I'm done with Creative Assembly, and I'm done with Total War.

Dota 2 is very addicting, to the point that I purposely stopped myself once I started consistently playing. The first ten hours of course were a terrible experience of learning basics and then eventually trying to apply them in an online match only to be yelled at and insulted continuously. However eventually you'll get a little better and then you will become that person screaming and yelling at all the 'scrubs' instead of helping them learn. The game itself is amazing, the strategy and gameplay are fantastic and you can choose from over one hundred characters. The UI is very streamlined and the controls prove clean and responsive. Overall I stopped because I could tell the game was about to take over my life in a very bad way, but if you have the time and some friends it's a rewarding if not toxic experience.  Pros:  Gameplay Strategy Rewarding teamwork Audio/visual design UI Controls  Addicting  Cons: Toxic community Learning curve  Shallow tutorials  Addicting  7/10

I made a review before and only 20% of the people found it to be helpful. I looked at it and saw points for improvement and I wanted to write a helpful review so this is my second attempt.  I start to say again that the game and all it's DLC's if you bought them are pretty awesome. I only know the DLC's from youtube and frankly I don't see myself investing 120 euro's in a game to buy the DLC's and the main game (at least not these DLC's). For example the option gore as in blood effects is a DLC priced at 2,5 euro's. Most of the other DLC's are also overpriced in my opinion.  If you are like my and don't want to buy every DLC (this) premium price I would advise you not to buy this game. There are no discounts in this game for DLC or the main game so far in its existence. Total war used to have discounts but for this game they seemed to have scrapped that to only pre-order 10% discount for DLC's. Also members of total war can give 20% discounts for the major game. However and here comes my main point if you buy the main game the AI will get access to all DLC and this will destroy the balance in the game between the races.   For example the King and Warlord DLC creates new units, buildings and legendary lords for Greenskins and Dwarfes. It also creates for all races regiments of renown. These regiments of renown will be your main problem. Below the review is the explanation of Total War themselves about regiments of renown. If you do not buy these DLC even if you only bought the main game these units will feature in it. The AI will use these units and while you can only upgrade your units to a certain point the AI will recruit regminets of renown which are far superior to your troops. Making it so that on very hard mode or legendary mode the victories become phyrric even if you field 4 armies against 3 (in my experience) or you will start losing and you need to build off on your early game blitzkrieg to have an extra army or 2 that is razing their lands while you slow down their armies while they advance upon you. It certainly adds a new part of strategy but mainly you as the underdog and the AI as the more advanced nation with the bigger stick all the while you are frustrated at Total War because you bought the main game and were perfectly happy with it without them wrecking that experience with their DLC's. I would advise if you still buy the game without DLC's to not play the lategame after you collected the achievements. Just make a calculation if I had the DLC's I would have ended turn 150-200 without DLC's it can become a furious struggle till 300 turns without much pleasure from it (at least that's my experience). You can ofcourse lower the difficulty setting but I have played total war since shogun original and I don't want to lower the setting, I just want a fair game.  REGIMENTS OF RENOWN  These are elite units – legendary within the annals of the Old World – whose statistics are much-improved over those of their standard counterparts. They can be unlocked for recruitment when the Lord under your command has attained the sufficient skill level, and are instantly recruited from the special Regiments of Renown recruitment menu into his army. In this respect they differ from standard units, which spend at least one turn in the recruitment queue.  Alongside enhanced stats and top-tier (level 9) veterancy, each Regiment of Renown also has one or more special abilities its standard-roster counterpart does not.  Missing these regiments of renown is very hard but the fact that the AI in the single player campaign also has access units that complement his roster better than your faction roster gives rise to frustration. I play a game for fun. I don't pay 60 euro's on a main game so later on the people of Total War can ruin my single player campaign with DLC's you can't opt out off. Plx Total War give me an option to start the game without the influence of DLC's I don't have. I payed good money for this game..    Other flaws in my opinion:  The serious flaw of the game if you buy the DLC is the hero and lord skills. It is copy past and some order changes but it's almost all the same. Very unimaginative and also most skills are useless. Sometimes you have to select 6 times something you don't want to get the thing you do want and with only 30 skill points 6 is a heavy investment. It seriously needs a revamp with each hero having some individual magics and skills. So you actually have a choice what to make of your hero. Now most of the skills are not very usefull and so you always select the ones that are (with the obligated ones to get there) and that's it. It's not the choice of making a strong magic user lord, battle lord, general who drives his troops to new heights or administrative lord.  The amount of mana available during a battle is dissapointing. I get that they wanted to preserve the total war experience which i value very highly but now we know it's a great game. Make it great with magics. If you want to preserve what you have it can simply be a button at the start of the campaign that you can click on if you want some heavy magic damage (although i think the enemy needs to be able to counter some magic two at that point).

This game is a joke....but that's the point. This is what makes Goat Simulator so brilliant.  Complexity out of simplicity is the name of the game, and its a formula that has worked for other popular games in the past. Goat Simulator doesn't try to take itself too seriously. Its meant for quick mindless fun offering contrtols that aren't complicated. Possibly the best thing the developers did is integrate Steam Workshop support. Virtually anyone can create mods and new levels for the game. All you need is the Unreal Development Kit, and a few video tutorials on how to use it and write in Unreal Script. The UDK is available for free downlaod via the Tools page of your Steam Library.  If you need to blow off steam or want just a couple hours of mindless fun then Goat Simulator is your game.

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: One of the BEST of GAMES I have EVER PLAYED In my LIFE 100/100, yet DON'T BUY IT ON STEAM. DON'T get on my bad side, or dislike the review. Cause this happend to one of my friends too. app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: Fallout 3 is a game full of surprises and suspense, backed up with an interesting story and addictive gameplay, it's a no brainer for anyone who is a fan of open world, story driven RPGs. I've put thousands of hours into this game on my Xbox (before I stopped being a filthy console peasant), and a few hundred on my PC (Using a custom launcher that for some reason didn't add play time to steam), and not a single minute was wasted.   The game follows the main protagonist, a vault dweller, whose father had committed the cardinal sin of leaving the vault to venture into the irradiated nuclear wasteland for an unknown purpose. The vault dweller, shunned by the other members of the vault and at risk of being killed as punishment for his/her father's crime, is forced to flee after their father into the harsh and unforgiving 'Capital Wasteland' to search for answers. The player is free to adventure across the vast wasteland surrounding post apocalyptic Washington DC, meeting slavers, bandits, mutated creatures and other survivors. There are countless settlements, derelict buildings, caves, underground train networks etc to explore, each containing their own piece of back story and perils, ranging from a renovated tower full of 'privileged' people who live above a network of ghouls who want nothing more than to get in, to the withered remains of the white house or the DC monument.  Following the main questline is recommended but not essential, and there are hundreds of side quests to follow, unique items to collect and moral dilemmas at every turn (such as whether to detonate a nuclear bomb killing an entire town of people for cash or not). If you've seen the recent announcement of Fallout 4 and wasn't sure if spending £49.99 on the pre order is a good idea, buy this game and put some time into it. It's made by Bethesda, a company renowned for the Elder Scrolls series of games, so if you are a fan of those, chances are, you'll be a fan of this!

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: After buying this game over three years ago on a steam sale, I finally installed the game this week and downloaded several mods for stability and graphical improvement... sadly I just can't get myself to like this game. The game started off pretty strong, I really liked the part where you grow up and escape the vault, however, the fun pretty much stopped after that point. Exploring must be the most boring part of the game: you move at a snail's pace towards newer locations and once you found them, you'll be doing nothing but quick travelling back and forth between a big city and your current location, because I found myself over encumbered and low on ammo all the time... It's a shame, since I really like the setting of the post apocalyptic world. Furthermore, quests appeared to be very dull, item management is a nightmare (yet there's tons of stuff to loot) and ammo can be scarce at the start.  I'm going to keep this game installed for a while longer, and give it another try in a few weeks... maybe I'll find it more entertaining, but for now, this is one of the very few games in a long time that I didn't completed...

Yeah, it's fun to watch other people play the game on Youtube. They know how to entertain people though. It gets boring quickly if you've seen gameplay already. After idling for the trading cards, I'm not going to be playing anymore of this game.

Thoroughly enjoyed Goat Simulator 2014. Goat/10. Goat Simulator 2014 gives an in-depth experience that uses a wide range of engaging stimulus and challenges to educate us humans of the agricultural environment that a goat must endure through it's life. The inspiring story of Goat overcoming his/her oppressors (the humans) creates an amazing storyline, with numerous plot twists that will have you on the edge of your seat. I know what you're thinking, 'but its just a goat!' Shut the hell up you fool, although this may be 'just a goat', this is 'just a goat' that broke through its goat expectations and stereotypes to face the world with nothing but its hyper-elastic tongue and it's oddly unnatural ability to not die. Ever. Goat Simulator 2014 expertly demonstrates how political views and actions can affect not only mankind, but also goats. It confronts the player with many terrifying situations (and can at times cause great offense). One example of this is the many rules and regulations imposed by the goverment, like what the hell? You want to keep me in this goat pen? Do you think this tower will keep me happy? This game allows you to fight the power, and essentially '♥♥♥♥ the police'. The most controversial aspect of this game is most definitely the goat fight scene, where you must turn against your fellow goats for the pleasure of the humans. Who really wants to participate in a competitive blood bath of goats for someone else's entertainment? In my honest opinion, I would much rather prefer that to not be a part of the game. Although I may not be condoning goat on goat violence, I find mowing down the many so called 'innocent' civilians and sacrificing them to the Lord Satan gives me an enjoyable rush. This game has the potential to inspire many, whether they want to become a goat scientist, goat gymnast, goat astronaut, goat ball pitcher or whale, they will find this game absolutely enthralling. The Good Goat VS Bad Goat dynamic of Goat Simulator gives the player the ability to influence the goat's decisions, and essentially determine to be Good Goat, or Bad Goat. (I also have the sneaking suspicions that recent games such as Infamous: SECOND SUN (what does that even mean?) have copied this genius game mechanic from Goat Simulator 2014.)    I recommend this game as it accurately depicts the various aspects of survival that a goat must face in it's day to life, and does so in a way that us humans can relate to and take advice from in both an entertaining and interesting way. This game forces you to think. I love it.

This is from the view of a console player, who uses a controller and not the keyboard. PlanetSide 2 is complicated. Quite complicated. I couldn't play the game very well using a controller, since there are so many buttons to bind. Maybe a Steam Controller, but not a DualShock or Xbox. Even after binding most of the important ones, it seems as though the turning speed of a character was far too fast. I couldn't find any setting to lower this.  Additionally, I even encountered bugs through the tutorial section that would not let me complete the tutorial without restarting the game. From menus not opening (even after pressing the corresponding button on the keyboard rather than a controller) to targets not registering the kills.  Overall, I truly had a terrible experience. I understand that others really enjoy this game - and since it is free, I'd probably have no problem telling others to at least give it a try and see if it works better on them - but I don't see myself returning to this game or quickly recommending that someone download it.

This product is nothing other than a waiting... software, can't call it a game. Here’s how it goes.   Click to do damage, to get money, to hire 'heroes' that do the damage for you. The hero you hire does damage up to a certain stage. All you have to do then, is wait till you... well basically it, has killed enough creatures, thus earning you money, for you to hire the next hero. You also face a boss fight every five stages (each stage has ten creatures).   Boss fights are nothing more than a magnified creature, you have seen before, that has tons of life and runs on a timer. Bosses might give you “Hero Souls” if they are “Primal Bosses” and only after stage 100. That’s it. Rinse and repeat. You will be doing the exact same thing from stages 1 to 10 to infinity. Of course the gap between the cost of heroes at some point increases to a point where you can’t reach it, so you “Ascend,” meaning you get to start all over again. Sure you get some “Hero Souls” that give you 10% increased damage per HS, or you can use them to 'summon' Ancients that buff every aspect of what you are, actually NOT doing. All in order to make that gap smaller, so you can hire the next hero. Only to find out that the next hero after the one you just hired requires even more money, proportionally. So you ascend again.   At some point all you have to do is let the software run by itself and you will achieve all there is to achieve. You do get some bonuses from the “Achievements”. It might take you… oh, about 174 hours to get the kill 1500K Achievement, if you leave the software running non stop. It might look like a nice game at first, where you can maybe achieve some goals with your skills, but it soon turns into a case study of “how can we make people do menial tasks with no gain whatsoever”. Also there is little clicking involved, especially if you don't care about the achievements.   Seriously, play something else if you need to fill the need of accomplishing things or the need to check on something. Better yet go outside and meet people.  P.S. There are auto clickers and save game editors out there, that nullify this softwares’ already meaningless existence.  Valar avoidis.

I found Far Cry's story really boring. It was just dull and the boss fight's were very anti-climatic. The only boss fight that wasn't a quick-time event that I recall is the one where you fight the giant with weird tentacle looking hair, but I found the even more boring because your just shooting arrows at its face. I even found the mission where you burn'd the crops annoying and boring. I can tell it was trying to be cool and fun by giving you a flame thrower with dubstep music in the background but whenever I tried burning stuff I was gunned down by ♥♥♥♥ing heavies with mini-guns. So I had to continually run behind cover and suck my thumb until my wounds went away, and I constantly ran out of ammo so I had to keep going into ♥♥♥♥ing buildings to search for ammo.   The main part that I found fun about Far Cry 3 was the fact that it was open worldish. I enjoyed going to the outposts and taking them over, I do wish however that the enemy's would counterattack after you have taken it over because once you take over a outpost it just becomes an eternal base which you just use occasionally to fast travel to. I found taking over outposts so much fun, once I lost some progress to a mission I was working on (it didn't save properly) so I just went taking over outposts one by one until I cleared the entire island. I then noticed a island which was untouched by me so I go to it and then game stops me and say's I'm out of bounds or something and teleported me back. This island later became unlocked when I finished the missions I needed to finish but I found it very annoying how I was constantly teleported back.  All in all I loved Far Cry 3 besides the boss fights being anti-climatic and the story being boring I found the free roaming fun and what really sold me on the game was being able to take over outposts anyway you want, either it being from a sniper, completely stealthing it and taking out the guards one by one, or just going it guns blazing. I also liked the upgrades and how they made you into a bad ♥♥♥ mofo and how each upgrade was a tatoo displayed on your arm which I found was a very nice touch. In the end, I would deffiantly reccommend this game.

I find this game design is too ornate. There are many systems in it which don't support the core of the game, which is 'I work with my team to assault the enemy base in order to destroy the Ancient'.  As this is based on the tower defence genre, last-hitting creeps is a source of income. The bit that's extraneous is last-hitting your own creeps to deny your opponents getting them.  The courier animal system feels extraneous to me.  Other issues include an announcer that makes me feel like I'm a third grader, map legibility issues, and balance issues. By balance I mean that when you die, you get penalized more than is necessary: not only do you lose the time you spend dead, but you lose some of your cash when you die.  I think in creating this game the designers shackled themselves too closely to the old Warcraft III mod, when they should have been finding ways to refine and streamline the game.  It's not that there isn't a game here to be played and learned and enjoyed. But there are far better MOBAs out there.

This could be a good game, but there are still a lot of issues that make it not enjoyable. With all the unresponsive controls, and bad mechanics this game is very frustrating. This is also a game that is impossible to play unless you have a really good connection, and lag is almost always an issue. I can almost never find a server with a ping under 100.   All in all, I can't recomend this game. I'm not gonna say I never have fun with this game, because I do sometimes, but most of the time its just annoying. It has potential, but thats not enough. Most of the time it just isn't fun at all, for me. I don't know of any other games quite like this one so I still play it, but I usually leave it in a bad mood. I don't know why I do this to myself.

Haloish mmofps. Massive world to get in to many different firefights of all kinds in is a BIG draw for me and has kept me interested even against the pay to win aspects of this game. Running 1000km to the next base to take, seeking cover under trees from enemy jets flying over while dodging sniper shots from who friggin knows where feels just as crazy as it sounds. Standing atop an outpost and spraying out mass quantities of lead at an organized assault bent on smearing your team all over the walls is a great feeling, even if you lose. Everything in between these examples is possible. The varying terrain is easily this games biggest draw for me, and all of it lumped together in one continuous world is terrific. Instant action and squad support keep you in the fight too, so you are never looking for the next battle for long. Problems: A little on the pay to win side. Looks like the most powerful equipment and weapons are strictly $$ purchases and even if the in game items are close, there still lies some favor in those paying the money. Looking past this i adopted an unorthodox style of deception and being in places im not expected to be to make up for the lack of firepower. Pay2win solved. Ill go 80/100 for this one. Mmo type grind to get the best stuff without paying cash, but with huge rewarding battles, fun gameplay and lots of vehicles to play with, i can forgive the devs making some $$ here and there. Good game thats worth a look for sure

I simply do not understand the premise of this game. Playing it, I just can't enjoy it. For me, Dota 2 is not a fun game. I feel like I'm jabbing buttons on a screen, and that is not a good feeling when playing a video game. This game is not even immersive; I could not possibly feel more detached from my own character.  Even when I'm winning and doing well, I am just not happy. It doesn't feel like a game. The only emotion Dota 2 can truly pull out of me is frustation.  If I could just enjoy other people's suffering a bit more, maybe it would be worth playing this salt machine.  Final conclusion: If you play to win, this game is for you. If you play for fun, please do not force yourself to play this game if you are not enjoying it.

Having played all the Total War games, I can safely say that, for me, this is the worst Total War game of all time. I'll admit that I am biased against non-historical titles, but I will make sure to focus this review only on the gameplay problems which I encountered.  In terms of battle experience, the battles happen extremely quickly, far too quickly for my liking. This means that the result of a battle is largely decided by unit volume and stats rather than by tactical maneuvers. The hero and general units make battles even worse. On one occasion, I had won a tactical victory, routing a superior enemy army. However, the enemy general, the only remaining enemy, defeated all of my remaining units, even when they were attacking him from all sides.  I found the campaign map to be too limited, with few expansion patterns available to the player. This is made even worse by the feature which prevents certain factions from capturing either cities or holds. Also, the lack of navies really limits the gameplay style options.  The rosters of many factions seem to be distinguished by the lack of a crucial unit type, which means most of your campaign strategy revolves around compensating for tactical inflexibilities. The dwarves lack cavalry, the vampires lack missile units. This really limits what army types you can field, meaning that building armies is largely about volume rather than quality.  Another thing to mention is the new seige mechanics, which further reduce the tactical options by forcing the player to deploy at the city walls and charge immediately, due to the arrow towers. The town battles have also been removed, for no apparent reason, reducing tactial variety even further.  To sum up this game - it is severely lacking in variety and flexibility, both in a strategic and tactical sense. It is a betrayal of the core fanbase of Total War, who were drawn to the title for the unrivaled tactical flexibility which the battles offered.

I really looked forward to this game, but now it's trash. 'skill-based' is not how i would describe this game. Lets look at the classes first, Archers. Archery is only based on a little on skill and alot by luck, the arrows move at a wopping 3 meters an hour, so aiming at a moving target is like throwing a rock at a bird, sure you can get better than some people at it but you're never really 'good'. Man-at-arms is a class of speed and the only class with the 'dodge' ability, also, the most over powered class. When playing as a man-at-arms your strategy is dodge forward, hit, the dodge backward, no skill really required. Vanguard is the best of both worlds class, except not. Vanguard is the only class without the sheild but with the longest weapons, balanced right? No, with vanguard after you run around for a bit you get and extra damage buff, walk up behind someone and one shot them, no skill required. Knight is the heavy hitter class, a class with weapons that do alot of damage, but have the length of almost nothing, basically the short end of the stick, skill required but you're at such a disadvantage why even try. The classes are unbalanced, but the mechanics are worse. The mechanics are easily exploitable, past level 10 you start finding exploiters like the classic 'look up and uppercut' absolute garbage. the game is no fun and has a toxic community, please save your money

This game is beautiful, the combat mechanics are awesome, and its fun - for a little while. As so many others have said, I really WANT to like it. I wish I could give it 3 of 5 stars instead of a simple yes or no.   What it lacks is a larger purpose: its pointless.  There's virtually no social aspect, no significant levelling system, and no 'grand map.'    There's no overall leaderboard, except during an individual battle, and no way to see a history of who you've killed or vice versa. The only way to check your stats is to get out of the game and into your computer to open an .ini text file, which only shows how many total kills you have by weapon.    Points and Rank mean nothing (except for unlocking a few relatively insignificant weapons early on).   There is no 'grand map,' so you gain nothing whether your team wins or loses; just jump into the next battle - switching teams if you like - and do it all over again, and then again.   Why?

This is a great game. Too bad I could't finish it. There is a scene where Jason and Buck are in a knife fight. There are a series of mouse and keyboard strokes necessary to win the fight for Jason. When I come to a particular keystroke it does not display so that I can then push it ... so Jason loses. The game cannot proceed beyond this point. Looking online shows this is a BUG others have experienced. Youtube videos of this particular scene show the letter onscreen. I have not found a work-a-round and Ubisoft has not offered a fix. I don't know why some have the bug as I do and others do not. My rig is 2 X 680 GTX in SLI with 3 monitors in surround. Bug still occurs when the game is in 1900 X 1080. Can't recommend game because I can't finish it.

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: This is my favourite game of all time. I have hundreds of hundreds of hours on this game from both console and when I had it installed as a non Steam game and I will have hundreds of hours more having just reinstalled it through Steam after losing my old version in a new Windows install.  This game is pretty broken without some tweaking, but once tweaked it is well worth the effort and I found the DLCs to be enjoyable and a good value. I love the setting in this game and can just happily get lost for hours wondering DC.  The game of course really comes into it's own after you've made your tweaks and start to install some of the many hundreds of excellent mods out there for this game, ranging from the smallest changes to huge DLC scale additions. There are a ton of guides and hidden gems to find which will teach you about the best way to tweak the game and install mods and after spending many (or few) boring hours reading and collecting your mods you will see for yourself that it is well, well worth it.  This game is better now than it has ever been and a few hours invested in setting it up (I know this sounds horrible*) will really pay off.  *You don't have to spend this long if you don't want to but to become really well informed on how to tweak and mod Fallout in an efficient and stable way then it will take this long but it IS worth it as it will completely transform the game in nearly any way you want.

First off, this game is funny if you have my sense of humor... for about 12 minutes. Then it becomes boring. The workshop items don't help at all, too. Also, this is way overpriced. I mean WAY... 10 FREAKING BUCKS? It should be about 0.99-2.49 for the short gameplay. All I'm saying is that you are wasting money if you buy this. Please, PLEASE listen to my advice, and spend/save your money up for something good... like StarBound... or Garry's Mod... or even ( Ecleast it's better than this ) Crysis 2. Ok, never mind, forget that. Never buy Crysis 2 either, its fun for 20 minutes until you meet aliens, then they're too OP and impossible to kill. But my point is, is that everyone who says ' OMGZ SO LOL LOL LOL FLY GOAT OMG PEWDS PLAYED IT!!!!111 HAZ TOO B3 GOOD,' are people that either (A : Just watched Pewds play it (or Markiplier) (B : Haven't actually played it but bought it, or (C Have a dumb sense of humor. If you look at most helful reviews, the people who 'Thumbs Up'd for Helpfulness' Haven't even played the game yet, and they think it's good because Pewds played it. (BTW Wanna see how that cycle works? Check out Gametheory, they made an episode of how GS [Goat Simulator] became so popular and other stuff)   Just press the button 'Only Negative' in the review section, and then you'll change your mind. Trust me, its good for 12 minutes, then its boring. Its just 'BL0W UPZ GOAT, WUTCH POODEEPIE, BUY GAME, WUTCH POODIEPIE, PLAY GAME, CRY THAT YOU WASTED MONEY'. Thats the cycle of GS. Thank you for your time, and please do not buy this game. Thank you.   And remember this for other games, so-called 'Bro's', (BTW I dont hate pewdiepie, Im a bro too, but just not a stupid one) just because Pewds played, or any other youtuber played it, and they made you laugh, doesn't mean the game is funny. It just means the Youtuber is funny. So sure, hate on this review because of the 'OMFG DIS GUIY STOOPID, HE HATEZ PEWDIEPIE, I HATE HIM, DISLIKE 4EVAR BEETCH!!!!', just dont buy the game. Maybe if It ever goes on sale for 2.49, but not for 10, not even 4.99. So please, get Hitman Absolution when it's on sale instead of GS, or get Sleeping Dogs, or Tomb Raider, or even Rust. But, I have some final notes for games you SHOULD BUY.   Shouldn't:  Turbo Dismount |OMFGGZ PWED PLAYZ IT, I LUVZ IT!!!  Crysis 2 | Please God, I'd rather kill myself.|  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------   Should:  Any indie game, you may think it's stupid or unpopular, or not Pewd's worthy, but Sleeping Dogs was amazing. And I mean AMAZING.  Broforce |One of the few games Pewds played that was good, not much gameplay, but awesomely fun, with all the updates.|  Tomb Raider |Main Story is ok, but Multiplayer is awesome.  Hitman Absolution |Lots of game play if you're a determined gamer to get acheivements, with awesome Campaign|    Good bye everyone. Please vote yes on 'Helpful', so I can spread the message.

Why it stands out: • fun chopping heads off • Wield bows, axes, hammers, poleaxes, etc • the combination of attack wind-ups & timing blocks/dodges makes for many hours of combat fun  What still sucks: • graphics are demanding, and everything defaults to MAX settings. can take some tweaking for good FPS • some maps are very unfair • there are 'noob' servers for low-level players, but after level 15, you're in with everyone else. this is a big hurdle for players who aren't yet very good

I waited to do this review to see how the DLCs were going to be.  First I started playing Warhammer in 1994 and Total War when Shogun (The First One) came out. This combination I have been wanting to happen for a long time and could have been a great game but it is far from it.   Total War games have continued to remove the strategic elements from the game and primarily just focus on the battles. This is ok for some players but not for me. So individuals that prefer a tactical setting will like this game. Those that grew up with complexity of Rome 1 you will have the same feeling as you did when Rome 2 came out.   The DLCs have continued to anger many gamers including myself but I do understand that making video games is a business. So if this approach is working then continue, I only ask that 'they' look at the long term vs the short term business goals and ask will it be worth it.  So the only thing that I can do as a consumer is, write this review and promise that I am done buying Total War games. It is sad because I truly did enjoy teaching younger gamers how to play Rome 1.

Do not try this game, as in many fascets in FPS.....this one has a imaginative and interesting concept that does not compare to other games of similar standards. First, alot of people are stating online that this game does not have a large amount of cheaters or hackers which is a huge lie. Hacking is very present in this game with people claiming maxed sensitivity and some fancy setting which still negates the speed of such weapon. Even if you catch such people commiting these actions there are numerous others that ruin the experiance of a game. Second, friendly fire is very present in the game.....be it does put a sense of realism in the game it also breeds a form of elitist mentality in a large sum of the player base toward the newer players in whch you are eithier be trolled out of game or more often kicked and unable to rejoin toward the more populated servers where the game was in one prospective interesting. Lastly, the progression systems for unlocking weapons is based solely on aggregated kills and not on kills that was helped as in other games. Many times while you are in combat a veteran players or at times a newer player will come in while in 1V1 combat take or steal ones kill and make you progression most tedious especially toward weaker weapons that do not kill in one or 2 hits similar that plaques the lighter classes. There are things in game that has some moments but these few times of brightness gets mostly overcasted by constant hacking, lag issues and lack of overall progression in which random interjections in combat by other players ruin the experiance.

TLDR? Too Bad. :)  I don't think enough negative reviews capture the actual 'Do Not Recommend' concept. Instead, you get a group of ticked off people that simply down vote a game for the price and DLCs. While, I also believe the price point was not acceptable nor are the DLCs with all of them commanding $18.99 and $7.99. I at least waited until it was 25% off, so I'm somewhat happy, kind of.  Now to the game. I had some fun and feel I got my money's worth with over 64 hours of gameplay to date. I will most likely go back and play it again at some point out of boredom. The game has a lot of interesting unit, class, and strategy combinations to choose from, but ultimately I really think the game is lacking.  Pros to consider: - All the races play slightly different while others play VERY different, which provides you with a good amount of re-playability. In previous Total War games, I felt, everything looked more or less the same. In TW: WH, the feel is truly different. - Good amount of army customization but if you want to make or paint your own army, you're out of luck. - Hero, unit, and city naming customization. In addition to item and trait customization for the heroes. While they do not “display” anything on the field, like a new shield, but the customizing is very cool.  I do not recommend because: - One Map (not battle map). We get one map with fixed locations and no ability to mix the starting locations up outside of a campaign mode or create your own map. Honestly. Lord of the Realms 2 which released in 1996 has this function. Its absence seems shoddy. - Quests are overly random and don't make sense. The story kicks off for each race very well and from an RPG standpoint the game kicks off very awesome. What I don't like is the campaign just randomly gives you objectives like; hey kill your ally and get 1500 gold/power/whatever and if you don't you failed the quest! Or how about sack the enemy strong hold in 5 turns and you’ll get 500 gold! While there are not normally repercussions for ignoring a quest. I find it truly moronic. - Random World War 3 in the onset of the Chaos Horde. After several play-throughs, it seems to be programed into the game to absolutely have the world implode when the notification that the Chaos army is on the move. Allies go nuts and attack you. Dormant “I did nothing to you the entire time in the game from across the map” now attack for no darn reason at all. All of them, just gang you. BTW-Chaos horde is coming. Stupid IMHO. If it happened once, cool, that was a nightmare. But all 4 times for me so far. - It is only about the Chaos. Literally the game—every freaking game you start regardless of race is about the darn Chaos. There is no other objective to this game but live long enough to kill Chaos/meet victory objectives. Maybe I want there to be a Wood Elf army on the move next time? And maybe the 3rd time I don’t want one at all. I just want to see if everyone can go ten turns without being bi-polar. - The politics of Total War continues to be a disaster. They did make some serious progress in politics making sense, but it still is just not there yet. If the game is built on Low, Moderate, High I would expect there to be X-% of success based on each level. So far, I have not seen one “Low” get accepted. Why not just say “No, Maybe, Yes” because that is what it is. - On a technical stand point it is not a smooth ride for your system. I have several computers varying in age and while all of them meet and exceed the system requirements, only the brand new computer runs this game without performance drops. Random lag, crashing, freezing, ect. were evident.  Kind of a negative, but mostly personal issues. - Graphically, it doesn't look all that nice. Not to me anyways, I feel like it could have been better. - I don't like the race locking for city ownership. I know some people think it brings to balance the game, but I honestly don't like it. I think you could maybe go at an angle of living in a non-racial area effects happiness, ect. Not something I would 'not recommend' the game over though. - Back to this. Ultimately, it comes down to kicking the Choas' butt and if you had a bad start, got into a war that you really shouldn't of or if your units are not top notch, you're dead. 3 chaos Armies took out 7 of mine (not wimpy) on the auto-resolve. Now while there is a going to be the classic, 'get gud, WHAAGH!', ect comments and “play the battle you jack-tard”. I simply look at the auto resolve calculator and believe if you do not fight the battles and get really good at them before Chaos arrives, auto calculator is most likely not going to work for you (significant variables apply and I was the first army they met out of the chaos valley). I personally don't like the battles and prefer the 'Risk' aspect of the game. But that is just me. I think the functionality of auto resolve should work continuously. I have played ambush battles and turned the loss into a win, but some dumb luck. - And yes the game is incomplete and placed behind an entertainment pay-wall. Remember when you bought a game and you got the whole thing? I do. You make the call on the pricing, but I won't buy any of this franchise not on sale at 25% or more for the main game. Probably 50-75%+ for the DLCs.  Thanks!

Despite being my favorite game of the past year, I still have to agree that Planetside 2 has one of the most difficult learning curves to pass in a game. For new players interested in trying out this game, I recommend expecting to die more than kill initially. However, the sheer scale of combat makes for an amazing display. I remember when I first started playing, I joined a battle spanning several territories-- Huge lines of tanks were exchanging fire as aircraft swooped through the chaos. It was an amazing introduction to the game, but not an exclusive one. Ps2 contains some of the most expansive, strategic, and intense fights I've experienced in the FPS genre. Progression through upgrades feeks rewarding, and there is no 'Pay to win' option for those who choose to spend money. I personally recommend trying to help your team before you start doing hilariously insane things (Like my outfit does). Overall, there are hundreds of ways to play the game, depending on what class, loadout, and customization you choose, which evolves over time as you earn more items. There will be times where you get tired of playing, then immediately get back into the game because you've discovered a new and effective way to fight. Conclusively, I highly recommend this game to anyone who wants an FPS that they can enjoy for a very long time.   TL;DR-- Planetside 2 is an MMOFPS that both captures the massive scale of battle and gives options to the micro scale of each individual player.

An excellent game that is very fun to play with your friends. Chivalry: Medieval Warfare is a lot different than most first person games, as you need to think and focus on what you are doing in order to counter and defeat your opponents. You need to focus on working around their defenses and attacking when their block is down, while focusing on your own defense. This is an amazing game that is worth your time. But this game really shines when you play with your friends. The satisfaction of dominating your friends and seeing them fall before you gives you a satisfaction you don’t get in many other games, because when you defeat them, you know it wasn’t because of a cheap shot or they caught you when you weren’t expecting it, you defeated them because you planned your attacks better, were swifter then them, and defeated them with your own skills. This makes this game extremely fun, and with the addition of customizing your own knights to your liking, makes you a one of a kind fighter in this amazing game. The only down side is to truly get the most out of the game, you need to play for a long time to unlock all of your weapons, as some very useful 3rd weapons need to be unlocked as you level up, but it isn’t anything game breaking. For $25 it is a pretty good deal, for all the fun you get when playing with your friends, but if you can find this game on sale, it would be for the better.

I really enjoy RTS Games, however this is my first Total War exprience. I'm used to a overhead view and micro managment of units, this was an entirely different exprience then I expected. If you haven't played one of these before, it's going to take quite a bit of time and research to understand to move foward. Once I invested a decent chunk of time on learning the system and what everything is I was able to expand and move forward and make progress.   There really isn't any story line or end of the progression, while you can messure your success each day the value of it demishes rapidly and performing any action or battle becomes mondain and boring, that is to say for me anyway.   The game is quite polished and feels complete. The Tutorial needs a great deal of work for those that is not going to invest the required time as I did to get going (if you haven't played a Total war game). But if you want a never ending game that you play for a few hours or a whole weekend for as long as you desire, this game has some great longivity. The Graphics, the races and terrain layout look excellent.   I'm a bit bais on the battles, I enjoy a good fight to the death. This, the battle is over in a short time and the enemy unit flees and get's away. That takes a lot out of it for me.   If a demo isn't availible I watch quite a few youtube videos before making the investment. All the videos the players seeemd quite pleased and enjoyed the game, it's likely you could do the same. For me, It just doesn't do anything for me, I really had my heart set on it, I'd like to a find a new RTS that is more current and pleasing such as some of the graphics this game offers.

I returned the game because whilst it is a good concept the graphics and animations (and therefore overall feel of polish and production value) were not just a step back from previous games, but in my opinion worse than the last four total war games including Napoleon Total War. In fact the quality of the animations and models reminded me of medieval 2 more than anything else, and pale in comparison to shogun 2. I dont have an issue with this per se as janky animations and poor model and texture quality do not a good game make, but if youre looking at the full 60$ asking price you better bet that comes into consideration. To be perfectly honest this game simply does not have the production value of a 60$ total war game.  The massive step backwards in AI group behavior, unit interaction animations, and unit diversity (in terms of model design), as well as lack of detail in battle maps and environments has left the product feeling cheapened and not worth full asking price. This is a shame as the concept was good, and implemented well.  I dont recomend this game for the price they currently ask

Goat Simulator is an interesting game. I've heard it started as a joke, but when the developers realized that there was actual interest in such a game, they started making it. I've had a lot of fun playing Goat Sim, but in all honesty, I'm rather bothered by the bugginess. Some people think that the lack of fine polish and poor optimization adds to the game, but it really doesn't for me. Perhaps it's just because it's still being developed and patched, but it certainly didn't make for a super enjoyable experience for me. Either way, the net experience was definitely more positive -- the game is creative and fun, with all sorts of cultural references sprinkled in. It's my hope that, with time, this game will develop into a more polished version, and all the bugs and glitches will be worked out so the masses can enjoy it more.

It's addictive and perhaps fun at the start. You feel like you are progressing due to the numerous upgrades and level ups scattered through the game and the insane amounts of money the game presumes you can make. Clearly the developers have never taken a basic economy course.  But there's not much else. The novelty of clicking does not keep you going; The virtually identical animations and monster types become more and more tedious until all you are playing for is that next upgrade. Which is when you start to glance at the alluring button to buy in-game money just to get that next upgrade and beat the next boss, until you need to do so again.  Utilizing gameplay to exacerbate people's impatience, just so they can make money is, in the end, their choice. But it is not good gameplay.  But it's your money so who am I to tell you how to spend it.

Do I recommend this game? NO! Looking at other reviews I can not believe this broken thing has gotten so much praise, it's a very interesting concept but it was impossible for me to get into it. The tutorial is broken, the difficulty is broken, the difficulty could have been forgiven though IF THE FREAKING BLOCKING WASN'T BROKEN. When I finally got into the menu after ten minutes of waiting for the game to start up (I honestly don't know if that was due to my Windows 8 HP 2000 laptop or the game) I was immediately disappointed by the customization, again, wondering how it got so much praise as I'm typing this, with no customization to your guy's body whatsoever, and then the armors look near identical, and you have to buy most of them. When I got into the tutorial after 5 mins of waiting, I was faced with the simple task of blocking this really annoying captain's attack. That took 20 minutes. Yes it's that broken. Especially if you're a veteran Elder Scrolls player. After finally succeeding I had to go through tons of anger-producing bullcrap. Oh you fight enemies in the tutorial. Sounds cool, right? No they will slaughter you. I had to run in circles plenty of times in those fights. When I survived that nonsense, I tried to join two games. First time, it loaded me as god mode in a super buggy map, only other 'people' to be found was two troops running in place. Second time, it loaded me right next to a river, where I couldn't move, attack, or look around. I was forced to stare at a river. Couldn't even try the 3rd time cause it froze. The game in general is laggy(could be my system) and doesn't have the worst graphics I've seen, but they definitely could be better, way better.If the above sounds nice to you, especially if you're looking for a challenge, then I guess the game is for you. I personally give it A 3.5 OUT OF TEN BECAUSE THIS GAME IS NOT ENJOYABLE AT ALL. Thank you for reading, have a nice day.

This game is worth every penny of my ten dollars. some people have been saying that it is fun, but it isnt worth the money. Heck. NO!!!!!!!!!!!1111!!1!1!!!11!!111 Take ALL my freaking money! The only time i disliked the game was the buying proccess itself, because i forgot my steam username, and nearly couldnt get the game and lost ten dollars. But the game itself is totally worth it, just dont preorder it like i did unless you are used to the humble bundle-store-thing and are confident you can do it.  [EDIT] The days when I wrote that review... Those were different times.   baaasically I was an idiot who got too distracted by the game's silly bugs to notice that the game was nothing BUT silly bugs. It's trash. There's no depth, there's very little game, and the only reason I managed to reach 22 hours of playtime on this game before realising it was a piece of complete and utter garbage is because I had a friend come over a lot and we took turns playing it. If you're willing to spend 10 buckaroos for, if you're older than 12, maybe 20 minutes of fun, then go right ahead (despite that thing about splitting time, I still have no ♥♥♥♥ing clue how I managed to play that much of it before realising it was horrible). It's a dumb, broken game. That's it. It's marketed as a dumb, broken game, it acknowledges that a lot in game, and once you realise that, rather than a dev working to make it wacky and fun, to at least be slapstick comedy, it was just that the dev couldn't bother to actually make it better. Then, upon realising that it was irredemably ♥♥♥♥♥♥, they just rolled with it, and came out on top - gathering the attention of millions of children, a couple youtubers who'se audiences ARE children, and a few unlucky people like me who were blinded by all the publicity it got from youtubers, and thought that maybe it had some depth.    Wait this game is years old and hype for it died out pretty soon after release. Whatever. Back to getting super ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off at toxic jerks on Overwatch (an infinitely better game.)

Some features have been cut from past total war games but it's similar to cutting fat off the steak, the end product is better for it.   TW:Warhammer is a great combination of TW and the Warhammer franchise, CA has done a great job of bringing this rich world to the video game scene with awesome models, abilities, and animations. Throw that in with the promise that all factions will be represented by the end of the franchise's production cycle and you have a fantastic series in the making here.  It has caught some flak for the fact of there is blood and gore dlc (all total wars have had this.... its so they can have a Teen rating on the base game) and that some factions will be added with either DLC or in the expansions to the series. There are going to be over a dozen extremely unique and completely different races in this game and the amount of work for one race is similar to one of their past games entirely, if it didn't have DLC or expansions they would have to ask over 500$ per copy... inflation sucks people we've been paying 60$ USD since the '90s

Alright, so yeah after seeing this game on the market for some time and never really looking in to it i kind of just brushed it under the rug as just another indie game. Well after about a year I was watching one of my favorite YouTuber's. Markiplier, play this game. And he really got in to it so i was like ok i should try this game out. So I put down the $4.99 and got the game stayed up late in the night and started the game, and just in the opening where I click new game I was alrady feeling uneasy and hearing what the guard befor you had to say was just down right shocking. So I was watching the security cameras for about one minut or so and then I put down the cameras and there was this freaking bunny right there is my face, I jumped out of my chair and was runing for that light switch, and then I came back and hade my older brother come see how scary this game was. And of corse he did it with out seeing anything or anything jumping out at him just like freaddy was taunting me. He got up told me that this game is not scary then left. So I got back on this time on night 2 where my brother left off and all hell brock loose there where things runing around this duck was standing out side of my door and every time i hit the light switch there he was just watching me. So I shut the door's and then saw that I was out of power the lights whent out the door's opened up and there was nothing. Not a sound then there he was standing there watching me, then pow! this thing is in my face im runing for the hill's and never looking back. So yeah over all I give this game a 5 star rating and recommend this as a must buy.

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: LONGEST GAME EVER  Jesus Christ.  As with all Bethesda games it is highly customisable. It does NOT run well on PC, needs a lot of patching and it's normally against my rules to vote up a game that needs so much TLC, but, it's Fallout 3 baby.  I would reccommend checking nexus mods and steamforums for a guide on how to really maximise what Fallout 3 can do, but even with that the random crashes still occur semi-regular and are HUGELY frustrating. I imagine that's not going to be a problem with Fallout 4 so I'd reccommend for a first timer just to wait for that.  I want to not reccommend this game for the above reasons, but it's an incredible game.

Is it fun? At times, in short bursts, sure. Its fun.   Great melee system. A variety of weapons make for varying playstyles and strategies.  None of which you get to actually enjoy. Because every single time you start to do so, an Archer will simply snipe you in the back and pad their kill numbers. Or that enemy you've been battling with, slowly whittling them down? They're all covered in blood and nearly dead, and...POW! Right in the back, and another archer has stolen yet another of your kills.   And if you get close, surely the squishy archer is a dead man, right? Wrong. Then they just whip out a lightning fast, unblockable dagger and stab you to death.   This is Chivalry: Archer Avoidance, in a nutshell. Run to a fight. Get sniped by archers. Whittle down a potential kill, to have it stolen by archers. A great melee system ruined by the addition of completely unnecessary ranged class.

I've played dota for eight or nine years. It is fun and worth the time and effort to learn.   Unfortunately, Dota 2 is currently maimed by an idiotic matchmaking system that punishes you for winning. That's right, punishes you. You win a few games, get over fifty percent w/l, and then all of a sudden you're getting match with guys that don't speak english and fail to understand even basic concepts of the game. Then, when you lose a ♥♥♥♥ load and your winrate is down to forty eight or forty nine percent, you're magically tossed back into a group of people that actually know what they're doing. Then you get a win streak, and get some wins and get out of the hole.   Then the cycle starts all over again. There is no way around it. No amount of always taking a carry, or always taking mid, or always waiting to pick to get what your team needs is going to help you improve your w/l rate. It is rigged, and it is frustrating.  There is also no excuse for the servers for english speaking people to always be flooded with people that don't speak english. This is not racism, this is common sense. You're playing a team based game so you need to be able to communicate with your team. It is ignorant of Valve to allow non-english speakers on the servers in such overwhelming numbers, as that it ruins the play experience for all involved.

Figured I'd come back to see the game with the series of DLC available annnd boom, to 'update' the game to what it should've been at launch I'd have to pay more than the original cost of the game for 2 more races, blood, and some generals. And before some fanboy jumps down my throat, if they wanted to remove blood to avoid a higher rating they could make it a FREE DLC, not charge for it.  ♥♥♥♥ing Sega. So over it, 7% are sticking around for DLC I've been hearing, you deserve it, hope someone else picks up the IP and does something proper with it and Sega can go back to cutting races out of historical strategy for day 1 race DLC releases, week 2 race DLC releases and week 4 race DLC releases like they did with Attila. Cant support this anymore.  Never again Sega. Its not even a budgeting issue for me, I'll throw the money away on some garbage VR game before I support this type of ♥♥♥♥.

Dota 2 promises to take the unique blend of online RTS and RPG action that has made Dota popular with tens of millions of gamers and expand upon it in every way. This is a competitive MOBA game of action and strategy, played both professionally and casually by millions of passionate fans worldwide. Players pick from a pool of over a hundred heroes, forming two teams of five characters. Radiant heroes then battle their Dire counterparts to control a fantasy landscape, waging campaigns of cunning, stealth, and outright warfare.

This game is a great stress release. As a goat, I bring mayhem to unsuspecting people and objects... so much distruction, so little time. Add to that an awesome variety of in game and steam achievements, with no rush or demand to get them done... take your time! Explore your surrounds.... Summon your inner Goat, bring forth Goatblivion through dark ritual!  Yes, some may say this game has it all. Truthfully, I don't know as I have not completed it, but after one nights play I know where I can go to escape normality and release my inner goat freely.  8 / 10  *Some little tips/tricks go a long way in this game, like using your slow motion button to help complete the achievement 'walk on two front legs'... But this is a game where you put a little in - Get a ♥♥♥♥ load out! :)

This game started off sooooooo good. You felt like a powerful medival warrior...  At least it used to be.  Knight class (Heavy Armor) got nerfed so now it gives you only one more hit than a man-at-arms (unarmored). Same with the vanguard.  Archers are limited to only 3 a team, so expect to never get to play them.  To many DLC weapons and skins. It can be real confusing when trying to tell if your opponent is on your side (several skins run about without shirts on) and you never know what the other guy is swinging at you.   The worst thing is the 'rank up' system. It tracks your skill purely by how many battles you've been in, it doesn't matter if you do well or not. After rank 15, I got it in a week, you are dumped into the same player pool with everyone rank 15 to 100, and most of them will be in the 30s or higher.  Play until you hit rank 15, after that the game loses any value of fun.  I did really like this game, and I put a bunch of time into it, but the developers have been making a lot of bad choices in it's updates since launch, and are slowly killing the game.  P.S. - Do NOT waste your money of the Deadliest Warrior version. It is everything wrong with this game, and so much more.

I'm not a fan of MOBAs, but this has to be the worst of the lot I've played. It says something for the MOBA community when every other of the 'top rated' player reviews says something about the game's terrible community, how the game will suck the hours of your life away, or that it is supposedly filled with evil Russians (how does any of this warrant a positive review?).  Sound effects are uninspired, music is okay, character design is utterly laughable as Valve tried in vain to disguise the champions' Warcraft 3 roots, same generic MOBA gameplay like any other, washed out 'painted' landscapes soon began to hurt the eyes, same, immature and venomous community that any other MOBA has, and bizarrely lacklustre items to replace the typically imaginative skins found in other MOBAs sums up my experience.  Valve has been responsible for some brilliant releases, though this is not one of them. They appear to be making any game they know will make them a good deal of cash, the enjoyability of the product clearly no longer being an issue - the only dependent factor being that people will inexplicably buy into whatever they're given. I suppose that one positive element of DOTA 2 is that you can play as any hero for free from the very beginning. Though polished, and far from the worst game I've played, it'd be a complete waste of your life to sink any amount of hours into this game and I am genuinely saddened that it draws in 800,000-900,000 players daily according to Steam statistics. Good games are few are far between nowadays, sadly.

This game in its current state, is, in my opinion, one of the most watered down, shallow and simplistic Total Wars to date.  The lack of race options at launch gave the game for me, a very short lifespan, with Campaign replayablity almost non existant.  Whilst the game is aestheticall pleasing, the map is beautiful, the unit models are very nice also, but, the units themselves suffer from perhaps the biggest mistake they have made for a Warhammer title, being that they failed to put in unit officers, musicians and banners. This is simply criminal.  Back to the map, whilst it is lovely, it is way too small. You get zero sense of 'grande' in this campaign, you can basically city hop from one point to the next making the map actually feel smaller than it even is.  I do think the game will improve, but not until it is fully complete, which is going to be a number of years down the line with the additional two expansions fully added.   You cannot offer a Warhammer game, without all the races being present, and expect it to be any good. Until we can play as all races, it will never live up to its potential.

7.00 is here, and its a blast. For sure I cannot say 100% if in the end the gameplay will be better or worse, and that because unlike some creatures of habit that feel their world come crushing down on them before even trying to learn the new changes, I will put more time into it to make a better judegement. For that reason alone no-one should take any of the hating seriously. Some people actually played 1 match in the new patch then quit. Wha? How can you know if it is better or worse like that?  All I can say is what I do like about it so far.  I like the direction of talents. They do not change a hero drastically like I feared, and got rid of the useless attributes.  UI is great, minimal and out of your face giving better vision which is always important in a competitive game and something that alays bugged me.  New map layout needs more playtime to be get a proper review from me, but so far I was able to jump into it and learn it quite fast. Shop locations are now FINALY balanced without the dire having to go to the moon for it (yeah, those few extra steps count guys), Roshan is no longer cheeply contested with dire jungle next to him and a river now surrounds him, and more jungles are added to up the importance of jngling.  The biggest changes are the shrines and the new bounty locations. This all is a step closer to PROPER jungling which was sorely lacking in this game. All it was thus far was go from camp to camp and rinse and repeat. Added bounty has also made jungling a more viable strategy, very much needed, and jungle control has now also become more important thus map control.  To compensate for some of these changes shrines add replenish locations closer to the lanes, allowing for better laning, and also a defensive strategy when need be against either ganks or bounty hunters in your jungle (no pun intended, lol).  Shrines also create for a better defence around the ancient.  Small additions like 3 slot bag and courier options are also much appreceated (you can now see who had called it before you and send it back, or alter the route of the courier, then continue its path to said player).  In general the patch is great, and it did not simplify the game neither LoL-ish it. It added much needed depth and gameplay in areas that were trully lacking. Jungling. Jungling in this game was really behind compared to other moba titles in the compatition.  And for all those saying why would they make it like LoL. They didn't, they are adding improvements most moba games already have. You don't evolve wih the genre you die out, simple, and there were elements in Dota2 that were lacking.  Given time, I can bet most of the haters will love the new patch. Except for the pretentious ones that are stuck in the notion that this is becoming like LoL and feel this is a bad thing.  Neither is true. Dota 2 is still dota 2. Adding elements increases depth, nothing was taken away, and the pace of the game was greatly improved. The layers to new strategy have now become a lot more, and people are simply frantically rushing about trying to learn it hence not happy about old tricks not working.  That is called a habit. Competitve games can do without that tyvm.  Definately recommend this title, still to this day.

It is difficult to recommend this game presently. When it works, it is enjoyable like so many other entries in the Total War series. However, I have encountered a game-breaking bug that has effectively prevented me from making ANY progress in campaigns beyond a certain point (normally around turn 70-90) in two of my three campaigns so far. Basically, the game decides to spawn the Chaos armies in a scripted event around turn 70-90, but if you're unlucky like me and so many other players, Chaos won't spawn and your game becomes bugged. At this point, you cannot end turn or move your units around the map. Nothing will fix the issue short of starting a new campaign, and seemingly there's nothing you can do to prevent it from happening, either. Thus, if and when the bug occurs, your campaign is borked and you've lost 10-15 hours of play. Given the hundreds of posts on the issue over the past month at the CA forums, Reddit, and the Steam group, I find it inexcusable for a company to let a bug of this magnitude slip and go unacknowledged until yesterday.  CA says they are 'looking into' this bug. However, if the fix doesn't retroactively apply to older campaigns, I'm done with this game and any future CA titles. I do not have the time or patience to constantly restart campaigns any time I encounter a bug.

The maps are huge with 4 continents (maps) with 8km x 8km scale so it can literally take minitues if you wanted to run base to base...the game makes battlefield seem like a head of a pin in comparison of size. The game is free and quite fun most of the time...the upgrades and wepons can be a lil grindy but it is free to play so you can't have everything...and even with the games issues we can look past most of them cause of the sheer scale of the game...its goona have bugs but overall its a good game!

TL;DR: No, items aren't useful enough and punishment for deaths are too harsh. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ To be honest, despite the low amount of hours I have on this game, I would not recommend this game by any means to anyone who wants to play a Moba and aren't gods at them. Two big reasons:  One: Items.  Most items are very useful and easy to use, but simply don't offer enough in terms of defense against stacked characters. No matter the items, if you are versing a Lion who is decent enough, he will kill you unless you or others kill him first.  Two: The biggest one, YOU ARE PUNISHED FOR SUCKING NO MATTER YOUR SKILL LEVEL Yeah, this might seem weird, you would want people to be punished for doing bad, but apparantly to Valve missing out on XP and possible kills isn't bad enough. So they thought about how else could they punish someone who is sucking, no matter if they legitimately don't know what they are doing or if they just are having a bad game, and it struck them: Let's have them lose gold. Yeah, if you are having a bad game, you will never come back from it because you'll never have the gold to get the items to help you. It's a simply screwed system that can't be fixed.  So yeah, thanks for reading this through if you did.

If you're looking for a medieval game with competetive multiplayer, realistic mechanics, beautiful graphics, balanced classes including archer and knight... then you better look somewhere else. If you're thinking that this game has realistic combat you obviously didn't play it. Chivalry Medieval Warfare is a game that makes you wanna smash your PC with a 2-handed hammer (with nice skin for 5 $) and then throw it out of the window.   I bought this game on sale and i thought I'd get realistic combat. What I actually got was a bunch of knights making crazy-♥♥♥ tricks with swords, archers with daggers faster than light ( spam2win), and dudes killing you with their bare fists. No joking. In this game a knight with full-set plate armor can be fisted (you could expect this joke) to death. Also if you're thinking that archer can't parry/block a massive 2-handed warhammer that in reality could smash through a brick wall, your computer and your first born son you're right. It can't. In reality. In this game it's actually possible.  But it doesn't matter that this game is awful. It's not bad and can be very enjoyable if you can hold on your nerves. If it's not the realism you're looking for you'll probably like it. I, unfortunately, bought this game hoping I'd get realism. And although I enjoyed playing it I can't really recommend it.   This game had a huge potential, but unfortunately for me (and some others) this game was a disappointment. Pretty much like me for my parents, I should be learning but instead I'm writing about a game I don't even like. Gotta end this here. If i helped you in any possible way, please send me a letter so I can show my parents I'm not a useless piece of ♥♥♥♥. If you read the whole text, thank you and please - make a right decision, whether you're buying or not.
