+ Probably the deepest, most complex MOBA there is + Massive cast of heroes with huge variety and each with a very unique playstyle + 100% free, all heroes available, no pay-to-win, microtransactions are cosmetic only, and there are endless ways to pimp out your heroes, HUD, announcer and more.  PROTIP:  most people know this but if you are looking to buy items check the Marketplace, you can buy from other players usually much cheaper than from the official store. + Despite only 1 official map, every game feels totally different due to endless combinations of heroes and builds + Devs put a lot of effort into balancing, updates are very frequent + Active and talented modding community, tons of fun, crazy custom game modes to play + Tons of servers available including South Africa and SEA + Tons of settings to tweak in terms of controls and HUD options so you can play exactly how you want- a big deal in a game where technical skill and response time is very important  ~ Won't be a concern for most people but the AI for computer-controlled bots is really terrible, and they play nothing like actual humans. Unless you're learning the very basics of the game practicing against bots will actually teach bad habits and adversely affect your skill. ~ LAN play is supported, however you still need to have an internet connection to launch the game ~ Personally, I feel that although the variety of cosmetic items is nice, many of the more expensive items have really flashy, over the top particle effects that can make already visually cluttered teamfights very hard to follow. As of this review there is no option to disable custom cosmetics.  - (In it's current state) very little rubber-banding or comeback mechanics. Unless all players are exactly equal in skill, once one team starts winning they will continue to snowball to inevitable victory, and playing from behind in DOTA is one of the most painful and frustrating experiences in videogames - Extremely steep learning curve, not to mention the game is constantly changing, coming back after a month almost feels like playing an entirely different game - Like most online games, the community is absolute cancer - Like most online games, playing alone is absolute cancer   WARNING: Personal sob-story ahead. There was a time when I was so addicted to DOTA that I neglected my studies, social life, my health, pretty much everything else. It ultimately culminated in a bit of a breakdown, and since then I only play when my friends get together for a LAN. Now, I obviously don't blame all my problems on the game, there were a lot of factors that led me to that point in my life, but DOTA was definitely a big one. Not everyone will get hooked like I did, but I do think the game is inherently quite addictive. Due to the very high skill ceiling, you want to keep learning and getting better, and it's very satisfying when you win, but very discouraging when you lose. You'll keep coming back no matter how many times it beats you down because that high from pulling off a close victory is really exhilarating. Those of you who have played Dark Souls know what I mean. The difference with DOTA is that you'll never actually beat the game- there is no final boss, just the next match, and the next match, and the next. Anyway, just something to keep in mind.    TLDR:  It's the definitive MOBA experience, but not for the faint-hearted. An extremely technical game. Would only reccommend if you have some friends to LAN with, it's free at least.

This game is all bright colours and flashing lights. There is more within the massive technicolor HUD and map displays than there is in the gameplay. Vehicles control well enough but lack versatility and usability. The only vehicles that players seem to use are APC's because of high armor and high capacity for spawning/transport, and a helicopter. Helicopters offer the ability to stabalize, hover, and straif - which actually allows for some combat to take place.  There are a select few weapons that are practicle, because this game plays like shooting fish in a barrel. You are either the fish for that round or the ones shooting. There is 0 varried gameplay, a select few who have appreciated and mastered this title, and then there are brainless doorknobs which take up about 40% of who plays this. Luckily, that's still 60% WORTH of a decent player base. This fact does not save it from being a particularly dull and boring shooter. You might as well play Halo 1 because thats how dated the gameplay is. Except Master Cheif could straif more effectively.  Would it be odd to say I still like it? Just not enough to play it. So,  Boo. D-

Even while it was on sale, I am so disappointed with this one, that I have found this a waste of my money....

Updated this review... read on for my original and further down is my updated version:  I've played this game on and off since almost release, and in short form, it's essentially a great free game, however one with a fair few major flaws.  Ads: + Excellent graphics + Varied Classes and Factions - they really do feel very unique + Large Battles (well large is quite a large understatement here...) + Varied Maps + (The potential for...) Good teamplay + FREE  Disads: - Takes a long time to earn Cert points - in game currency, (and...) - Higher priced weapons are very good - The majority of the bases are fairly similar, leading to repetitive gameplay - Imbalance in server population (spikes of a majority of one faction, leading to domination of map) - Server population has been reducing - Can run fairly poorly  8.5/10  (EDIT):  Ever since Daybreak has taken over, I no longer can recommend the game:  - Updates seem to be getting worse and worse that seem to fix nothing but cause even more bugs to appear, which is clearly a little crazy, and also incorporate yet more crap into the game. Age old bugs and issues from launch have not been solved, and despite attempts at solving performance issues there is not a great difference.  - The server population has completely been obliterated (you may not notice it at first, but the reason for this is that they have merged a very many number of servers together, and even with this, the reduce in player numbers is still very noticable).  - Not only this but the community has become completely toxic. There is absolutely no fun to be had here anymore when not playing with friends - I warn you, do not play without friends.   - I've noticed many more cheaters and aimbotters as of late, much higher than I had seen playing this game previously.   - Lots of items have inexplicably been completely nerfed whilst others remain untouched?   - Over time and updates the graphics of the game have become worse, so that if you were to compare them now to what they were a few years back, you'll see a huge difference. The game has turned from an absolutely beautiful masterpiece to a fairly mediocre, or even perhaps at times sub-par looking game (and that's taking into account the graphics of other games getting better). Don't believe me, check out screenshots online.   - And finally the killer is the fact that this game is now clearly a cash-cow. Stupidly high prices for weapons and evidently not a lot of effort is being put in here.   Writing this review hurts me, because at one point this was my favourite game, and still there is a part of me that adores it. But by taking a clear picture it is evident to see the downfall that this game has had since it was released and compared to the original Planetside. This game, like the original Planetside was hugely ahead of its time, and it had the potential to be something truly revolutionary. But in recent months it's clear the dream will never be met... There was so much potential here for something greater, and it's been wasted.   A damn shame. :((
This game used to be good, but then it got an arrow to the knee.

Planetside 2 is a shooeter where three factions are pitted against eachother on combat over four unique continents; Indar, the Desert continent, Esamir the icy wasteland, Amerish the lush and mountainous landscape and Hossin, a thick swamp. Every faction gets fun to use equipment for dealing with the situations and terrains present on each continent, and it's a bundle of fun to play. Organized outfits (the clans/guilds of Planetside 2) can be found on every faction of every server.  You won't regret picking up this game, the battles are huge and involving and you can make a huge impact as just a single player in these huge fights. The game is sexy, runs fairly decently in even the huge fights involving over 200+ people (I run with 16gb of RAM, an I3-2120 and a GTX 970, and I get at least 30 fps in all situations, with over 60 in most situations).  The fact that it is free is just a huge icing on the cake, and honestly if I had to make a suggestion on the microtransations, then I can only say that buying guns with real-life money is wasteful at best. The guns do not take an overly long time to grind for ala other F2P games, and it's definitely a million times more rewarding to find get that gun you've been saving for ages for instead of skipping to it. If you feel like supporting Daybreak Games, the company that runs this game, then I suggest purchasing only aesthetics as it is a million times more fun to grind the guns manually.  My only gripe with the game currently, as of April of 2015, is that there a quite a few prevalent game-breaking bugs that make the game tough to play when they arise. However, these bugs only pop up in fringe situations and can be fixed easily with a minor inconvinience. It is very easy to see past these bugs, and it should not be an off-putting factor for anyone on the fence about trying out this game.

SCAM! Pay full price for the game and they still want you to pay another $20 to unlock each faction.  Game mechanics are difficult and do not seem to fit this sort of game.   CAMERA VIEWS are limited: Zoom will zoom very close except the army/character panel will cover up what you want to zoom to see. One might attempt to simply change to god-mode and look straight down in order to see the zoom...but....there is no option for that camera mode.  CYCLING through units is broke: Cycling through units seems to be random. Whether keeping to the right or left, the cycle will jump back to units you have just been on. keep clicking in one direction will not systematically cycle from one toon to the next without repeating. This makes tracking large amounts of units difficult and even caused me to lose a campaign because I cycled through troops until i eventually landed back on the one I started on....wrong! The cycle skipped some units entirely. A feature that removes a unit from the cycle once it has exausted all movement would be best. Also a feature that we can check a box to leave that unit out of the cycle for a turn. Hero abilities stop randomly: Some hero abilities were acivated and left alone. Sometimes they would still be active after a couple turns, sometimes they would have been turned off.  BALANCE seems to be way off. I played the dwarves (easy) also on easy mode and barely won. Play the empire (normal) in easy mode and get wiped by the AI. Seems as though the AI is granted double or triple movement points, not to mention they start with more armies.  Another campaign I was attacking with a full 20 army the moment I recruited my last army, I attacked and noticed the balance meter indicated I had like a 1% change (the bar was almost all red in favor of the enemy). How in the world can the AI gather such massive armies in the same time it took me to build just 1 leader with a full 20 slots? The sheer time on waiting enough turns to make that money in the first few turns while the AI has double or triple the funds means there's some major imbalance here.  HERO UNBALANCE: WTF? My last campaign had a level 13 hero assasinating a level 2 enemy with 100% failure rate. On the final assination attempt it was a critical failure and my level 13 hero died after trying to assinate a level 2 over 10 times. Other AI assinations seem to have had a 50% success rate while mine had a 1% success rate (yup, in turn 78 i got my first assination out of dozens and dozens of attempts and failures) and the game was in easy mode. So is the difficulty adjustment broken?  BATTLES are ok. I can see that these are the primary reason behind this game. Unfortunately this is a turn based game but there are no turns in the battle. Scrolling and panning to get a view you like of the battle field is annoying. try to zoom in to see some units in the trees and your screen will be blocked by the trees. I love the graphics, but, they should get clipped out of the camera view if I zoom to a certain point. Also, zooming out does not give a full view of the battlefield, leaving a lot of units out of sight. Tutorials are lacking and it was not until after a few failed campaigns and battles that I discovered that your hero/lord/leader abilities/spells had to be manually cast.  First few campaigns are annoying. TONS of pop ups, pauses for the tutorials, quests, cut scenes, narration...etc. Click once and sit back and let the game play itself for a few minutes then jump back in and click a couple more times to wait while the game plays itself (not talking about the other factions taking their turns, that's expected).   All the positive aspects are that this game is a challenge and it is very encompassing with the alliance/diplomacy system. Diplomacy will make or break your strategy.  Wish steam would adopt a different rating system. Thumbs up or down leads us to think we rate the games as they either suck or they dont.  Sadly, i give this a thumbs down because I paid full price and upon opening the game, I expect to be able to play the full game. Instead I am limited to playing only a handfull of the races while being told I now have to pay another $20 for the privelege of playing the races that I paid for in teh first place.   The TRICKERY and DECEPTION of trying to dupe me into PAYING for the ability to play all the factions is unappreciated. Also the ONLY FREE DLC is broken. I click on the box that says 'Yes, I already have Steam' and nothing happens, but, click on the box 'No, I need to install Steam' and that box works just fine. I paid full price. just let me download that one free dlc pack. Likewise, because of this trickery, I will NEVER purchase any other DLCs for this game.

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: This is a game that I have enjoyed throughout the years, first on Xbox, now on PC. I have never unti now, however, experienced the full Game of the Year Edition. And boy am I experiencing it.   If you are considering buying Fallout 3, I wholeheartedly recommend it. It is a beautiful open-world RPG set in the post-nuclear remnant of an America that never moved on from the 1940's. The sad, bleak atmosphere is one of the most amazing parts of the game. As for the gameplay, it couldn't be more flawless. The weapons are all so satisfying to use, and the weapon diversity is great; it's loads less crowded than the next installment, New Vegas. I recommend ramping the difficulty up to Hard or Very Hard to see just how well you can survive the harsh Capitol Wasteland. Perks and skills are earned as you level up, and some of them (I'm looking at you, Bloody Mess) can make the game very interesting. There are many viable playstyles. I usually use Small Guns and Melee Weapons early on in the game and start using more Energy Weapons and Big Guns later. It seems to flow naturally that way. All in all, it is a very satifying game.  The expansions/add-ons included in this Game of the Year Edition bundle are some of the most incredible, diverse, and interesting expansions I have seen in video games. Point Lookout gives the feeling that I'm stuck on Crazy Island or something. It's nuts. It adds some really powerful weapons like my favorite, the Lever-Action Rifle. Operation: Anchorage is my favorite out of all the expansions. The story and gameplay it adds are tons of fun. It sends you back in time to this war with China and the battlefront is Alaska. I enjoyed it quite a bit. The Pitt takes you the slavery capitol of the post-apocalyptic world: Pittsburgh! Lots of cool adventures to be had in the steel mills. The atmosphere of the Pitt is very dark and fiery. It's rather scary. And no one is nice there. I don't want to live there. Mothership Zeta is probably my second favorite of the add-ons. You get abducted by aliens who want to study you, so you escape and blast their faces with their super awesome alien guns. Quite enjoyable. Finally, Broken Steel adds post-game content. Without the Broken Steel expansion, when you finish the main questline of the game, that's it. Boom. The game is over. Can't play anymore. But if you have this add-on, you get to keep playing after beating the game using the same file! Also, the level cap gets raised to 30 from 20. This adds loads of awesome Perks to get. I was so excited to get the Puppies! perk since my dog died like right after I got him. So sad. But now I have a new one! Not sad!  I have enjoyed this game quite a lot, and I can continue to enjoy it. There are so many quests to do, so many different choices to make, so many things to shoot, and there is even an atom bomb to blow up (or not :D)! Please, go and enjoy Fallout 3: Game of the Year Edition.

I love mobas. As far as PC games go, it's my favorite genre. I've played the original Dota for years. League of Legends and I've dabbled in Smite and HoN. Dota 2 beats all of them as far game play, balance, hero design. It has holiday events, free skin drops. They allow you the option to sell your skins and other drops in the community market. My steam wallet is sitting at over $40 as we speak strictly from Dota 2 community market sales.  There is one critical flaw in this game. I can honestly say, that in my personal experience over 95% of the players can not, or will not speak english. Not in text, not on the mic. This makes team strat damn near impossible for an english speaker. The game allows you to check which servers and language you want to be included in - any that you leave unchecked will not add you to the matchmaking system in those locations/languages. I live in the US, and I can only speak english. So I only have US servers and english checked. Yet still every game I feel like a foreigner in my countries own servers.  I ask them why they click US/English if they can't speak the language, but it's a redundant question since they have no clue what I'm saying.  There really is no excuse for it and sadly enough it ruins the whole experience for me. I might as well be playing with bots.  In conclusion I will say that this is a great game. But unless you speak every other language except english, you're going to want to go play something else.

I've been an RTS fan for my whole life, and a HUGE fan of the Total War Series and Warhammer Series as well. This game is AMAZING. The graphics are top, the visuals of the battles are cinamatic worthy and the lore is spelended. Only one hour in campain and Im already hooked. The release is very stable, especially for a Total War game. I just have a few flicking UIs that I know would be fixed very soon  NOTE: This isnt your typical Total War game nore is it a Warhammer game. It's a combination of both games and it was pulled off well. What makes this different? *Combat is more faster paced *Cities on the campain map are a bit closer to eachother. Think of Shogun 2's campain map. *Hero/Commanders are a one unit squad *Heroes can have mounts! * MAGIC ON THE BATTLEFIELD, BIG PLUS *Campain has alot of changes, This includes how tech works and political stuff *Special Units and different classes example: 'Big units' would be the Giant orges   I will add more stuff to this later on when I find new stuff. But I highly reccomend this game.  Go get it so we can play co-op campain! SEE YOU IN BATTLE!

I dont play (ok, played) this on my PC but on my Tablet.. I thought I write my warning here..  The game is a time waster.. very good one.. and became with the last update even MORE time waster. Let me explain. The game is a resource game.. running in real time. You can play it clicking your ♥♥♥ off, play it idle and do nothing at all beside a few clicks every here and then.. or a mix of both.  I played a mix, as sometimes I want to click a bit and other times I prefer to sleep! :p So for 5 days I wasted my time.. and I felt very sorry for myself during game time.. why am I wasting my life with this? Anyhow.. got myself a little setup and reached Lv400 in 50min on my farm run for hero souls. Got about 350 on average on a run. Skilled mainly chance to spawn a Primal Boss and Hero Souls drop amount plus more gold in IDLE mode. I was happy wasting my time... and the update came.. no question, do you want to upgrade? Just suddenly I got way more Hero Souls.. niiiice, what a lucky run.. when I hit over 1k Souls.. I started to understand, something goes different as usual. Bed time.. started game again next day and screen pops up.. Transcence bla bla.. Help Screen to explain it all.. like a lerner driver gets this instruction: Open Door of the car, start car, drive as it is demanded by law, park and exit car. So.. basicly nada! Next I start my run.. why are my heroes not guilded anymore?? Why does all take soooooooo much longer? To make it short.. that is what r2games sold you. We made a upgrade and BALANCED the game. How unbalanced it was before.. example: My next upgrade for chance to get a primal boss was 72 Hero Souls... after the update +86k Hero souls.. so the developper thought it needed a balance to a skill that was 1 : 1200 out of balance. Yes, but we gave you more Hero Soul income too... true.. went from 400 average to 1500 on a run.. lets say 4 time more... to 1200 more cost.. my same farm run of 50min is now over 3 hours... and instead of beeing able to upgrade my chance for hero boss 3 times on one farm run to 400.. I would need over 50 runs for 1 upgrade. So wasting time is one thing, this is just simply super stupid.. I guess to many people came to the end of 'get arthritis when you are old game'.. and instead of putting some brain into it.. they just made everything a s h i t l o a d take more time.  So all in short: If you want to kill your last brain cells with boredom, if you cant understand or play games, which demands at least an IQ of 90.. this is your game and you will LOVE it!!! In any other case.. do yourself a favor, man... drill yourself a hole in your head.. makes more sense than playing this game for brain dead idiots. This is THE game for street cleaners, garbage men and bums living under the bridge.. about the IQ you need to play this junk and think this is a great game..

The only way I would be able to recommend this game to players would be if you had 5 constant friends to play the game with. If you play the game as a sole individual you will encounter a world of toxic hate never seen before on any video game in existence.   In every single Dota game you can expect people to be any or all of the following 1) Rude 2) Egoistical  3) Toxic 4) Ill mannered 5) High and mighty  Gameplay wise, it's one of the best games around but it's a game where team play prevails, which is why I can only recommend the game if you have friends to play the game with. Take my advice after almost 1,500 hours, if you come in to this game as a sole individual, teamplay with 5 people who don't like each other very much is just not going to happen. This game is not noob friendly in any way whatsoever, it's an extremely competitive game and only for the most hardcore of video game players.  You could probably just install this game and play the custom game modes, which are less competitive and more relaxed, but how could I even possibly recommend this game to my friends or other players when it's a game filled full of hate towards other players.  If I had to say the single biggest most important way Dota 2 could be improved then I would introduce a region lock that forced players to only be allowed to play with players that lived in the same country as them. As most of the toxic and hate stems from Western Europeans arguing with Eastern Europeans and half of your team doesn't even speak your language. The same happens on US servers where Peruvians are toxic to Americans and vice versa.

This is a good indie horror game, it's not great as the replayability is little to none after day 6 unless you've grown a taste for screaming both angrily and in fear, the atmosphere is very disturbing as even though it takes place in a pizza parlor after hours (Which would be most any kid's dream if it weren't Freddy's place..) and the fact the animatronic animals will kill you while screaming and moving right in your face is definitely worth saying 'jumpscares galore' as well as the fact you have a very limited amount of power to Check cameras for the animatrons, Close the doors before they get you, or Check the door lights to see if they're there or not, you need to survive 6 hours per night (About 3 - 5 minutes per hour, right around there) while the AI gets notably harder with each new night (Night 1 obviously is the easiest as most of them will idle except for two and night 5 or the bonus 6th night are the worst scarefactors as they will easily overrun you unless you've figured out this game's system of checking the cameras/doors/lights.) but besides the atmosphere and scares from the animatrons the game's mild, there's no real objective besides living and the story is non-existant unless you go out of your way to google it.  This game gets a 7.5/10

I've played and wrecked Empire Total War, Shogun 2 Total War, and Attila Total war on Legendary difficulty. Thought I'll play the Empire's campaign and wreck the game on Legendary again. The fights against other human factions felt very similar to previous Total War games (although there are very noticeable AI improvements), still it was no big deal and I won most battles fairly easily.   But when I started fighting other factions the game got really interesting. Got wrecked by an Orc army when their Orc Boyz broke though my center faster than what I had anticipated, got wrecked by the Undead when I wasn't able to use/protect my artillery from their flying units, and got wrecked by Undead again when their magic broke messed up my front lines. I've never had so much fun seeing my human army get crushed by another army in any previous Total War game.   Love the surprises so far, can't wait to see what is to come later in the game. Definitely worth a buy!

This game is always a crowd-pleaser, both with casual and serious gamers. Playing more than an hour or so at a time alone can get boring, but the addition of new maps and abilities helps to stave off the feeling of repetition, while mods allow for more customization than one could ever ask for. This game really shines when it comes to split-screen. Playing with a friend and seeing how many weird tricks and combos you can pull off or how many funny Easter eggs you can find is fun for hours, especially when you make up your own challenges. This game is definitely strange, and is best played with a friend. I would recommend picking this game up on sale because of the lack of real content and solo play-ability.

I cannot recommend this game to anyone. Why, you may ask? Simply because of the fact that its purely meant to consume your time.   You kill mosters by clicking or idling and use the gold which they drop to improve your character and buy heroes and imrpove those. So far for that. You do that until you reach lvl 130-140 where you simply never ever will pass the bosses. (too low dmg) Then, you restart the game. You gain Hero Souls, which give you dmg boosts if you keep them or can be used to buy other extras.  Thats it. You play the game util you can't proceed any further, then you resett, gain hero souls, play until you [...]  As always, there is the shortcut of paying. You can pay to improve your heroes, you can pay for hero souls, you can pay for relics, you can pay for basicly anything you want.   So... either play this for hundreds / thousands of hours (because there is no 'end' unless you count 100% achievements as finishing a game) or you ... quit halfway through. Optional, you don't play it at all, which i advise you to do.  The game is soley a waste of time and trying to get you spend money on it.

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: Fallout 3... Where to start....  This is the game that introduced me into RPG games. It was and will always be my favourite game.  The interesting things in the games lore, the places, the people, the weapons. All so perfect. And the DLC makes it even more God Tier.  I've played more than this steam review will say. I own it on Console and the retail disk copy and i am proud to own it again on steam.  There is no way you can get bored in this game. If you run out of Quests. The modding community is there for you. So many possiblities and mods that make it amazing.   This is the most amazing game i have played. Full stop. No recent games have even gotten near Fallout on my list. It's just so bloody perfect.  Buy it if you don't have it. Get GOTY if you can. You won't regret it.  Oh and for those who say they have problems with Windows 7. I use Windows 7. It's called Google and the Modding community. I suggest you actually look around a bit.   I give it a strong 9.5/10.

Clicker Heroes  Just another idle game, a quaintly re-skinned Cookie Clicker with a ‘mobile games’ aesthetic. Nothing to rave about, but what’s there is solid, if only within its genre. More satisfying than comparable titles simply due to the layers of abstraction it places between the player and ‘watching the grass grow’; it’s more ‘interactive’.  The devs know their audience; the interplay between heroes, ancients and active abilities w/ cooldowns provides latitude for mathematical analysis - active players will want to invest differently from passive ones, for instance.  Scrupulous readers will notice the abundance of ‘pay-to-win’ complaints; but pay to win what, exactly? There are no leaderboards at the time of this writing, so basically all you’re paying for is hastening the experience of whiling away your time. Nevertheless, the game still manages to feels somewhat solicitous, and maybe it does have something to do with the presence of a cash shop.  tl;dr: Cookie Clicker for RPG enthusiasts - a baby step in the right direction.  *** 6/10 ***

The last review I've done of this game is outdated for years, yet the game changed so little on the bigger picture it's a disgrace to say that, but it's not worth playing. Not anymore. The population counts have been getting lower and lower, yet no one at DayBreak seems to care. Also note this isn't my real hour count, it's probably around 1k hours now.  - patches come at a very slow pace, expect not to see one after months of waiting. 'You want a patch ? Oh look, another weapon skins bundle !' - some weapons have been either underpowered or overpowered since day 1, yet never changed (TRAP & directive weapons being garbage for example, fury on invisible flashes completely broken, as well as Air to Ground weapons). - the population counts getting lower and lower means you're going to see EXACTLY the same people playing from now on, and they'll often be the ones who sunk thoussands of hours in the game, so expect them to beat you everytime if you're not good at FPS'. Also, the autralian server is literally dead, with a peak of 500 players accross two continents, which is low, very low, while Connery, an US server, is probably going to get merged soon enough due to lower and lower pop counts aswell. - Despite its improvements, the new player experience will remain terrible : if you're an experienced FPS player, it's gonna be rough. If you're completely new to FPS genre, you're going to be eaten alive. Also there's no way for a new player to know exactly what attachments does what, since most of the stats are on the wikis & stuff. - to get anything done in this game, you need a team. And it's either going to be completely moronic, or you're simply going to be outnumbered 4 to 1 on a base worth defending, while your faction has the biggest pop on the continent, fighting another base with 100+ players against 12 or something. - 4 years, and the lore is still lackluster & almost absent from the game itself, even better, a lot of weapons are not from the factions, and the factions literally have 2 freaking vehicles for them : a heavy tank and an aircraft; while you have 8 other vehicles who look almost exactly the same, have exactly the same weapons accross all the 3 factions. - No viable anticheat, there're cheaters who're going through the walls, the ground, who're spinbotting with LMGs in the sky yet still playing, I'm talking about more than 100 hours in game without getting banned, this is just sad. - 4 years latter, lags and optimization are still garbage on battles with more than 100 people in.  So, let me ask you one question, is it worth for a new player to play planetside ?   I'd have answered yes in 2013, but in 2016 ? Unless you REALLY want to get into the bits of big fights left (which are going to disappear soon enough), be prepared to face huge frustration moments. Despite devs' recent progress for new players, it's already too late, since the new players don't stick around either way, nor even try the game. Only a relaunch could save its game after getting all the bugs and numerous cheesy weapons balanced.

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: READ FIRST, NO NEGATIVE REVIEW   I really like this game, played the normal version (Steam) for like 30 hours. But I wanted the DLCs and bought the GOTY in a sale. Turns out this is the hell. Idk what it is, but I can't get it to run for more like 20 minutes before crashing. Idk if it's the mods or the steam version, but well... I don't even use that many mods, because I knew modding Fallout 3 GOTY with Steam Version would be difficult. Just some graphic and UI changes and Ironsights. Not really much more... The thing is, if you want to play vanilla... Give it a try. But if you are going to mod this game, which I recommend for the most games Bethesda made, buy the CD version, since it seems way more stable. Maybe I will give it a try again when I got my new PC, but until that I will play New Vegas again, which runs highly modded on my PC, with no problems. Maybe a crash here and there after some hours, but not less.   After all: I recommend Fallout 3, but I don't reccomend the steam goty :/

SP is amazing took me around 30 hours to clear all the bases, activate all the radio towers, clear the main story missions, and dabble into the side missions and loot collecting. The guns feel great and their is a decent variety of weapons here with plenty of customization options for you to make your perfect killing machine with. The Map is also amazing the jungles are beautiful and there are a large amount of ruins and caves to explore. On top of that the game is populated with some down right amazing animals that will literally rip your ♥♥♥ a new one if you don't watch out for them. Overall i really enjoyed the experience and highly recommend buying it. I also recommend buying the deluxe edition of the game since Hurk from the monkey business pack is probably my favorite character in the game after Vaas that is :).  Here comes the bad news though. MP is complete crap as of release. Hopefully a few patches down the road it will be fixed but for now it is miserable. MP matches are filled with bugs, matches are hosted peer to peer making for a real lag fest, and in my case at least the game crashes at the end of every match. Although i do have to say the matches themselves are pretty fun while they are happening at least when you find a game with no lag.   Sadly I have to say the weakest point in the whole game is the Co-op. It has extremely linear game play, is as bug infested as MP, and lacks proper hosting or search options in menu leaving you with the options to either private match which requires 3 other friends to join before launching or you can hit join public which throws you into a random lobby with 3 strangers one of which will randomly be selected lobby leader and has complete control of the chapter selection and etc. :X.  Overall I would give this games SP a 8.5 out of 10, its MP a 3 out of 10 with the possibility of becoming an 8 out of 10 if they can fix the bugs and crashing, and i give the Co-op a whopping 1 out of 10 with the possibility of raising to a 4 out of 10 if they fix the freaking hosting options.

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: Having put over 500 hours into the non steam version, Fallout 3 is one of the best Rpg's of the past 5 years. It, like many of Bethesdas other titles are a farcry from perfect, but enjoyable none the less. The thing with this game, its in the 'its the journey and not the destination' catagory. Its writing, story, main characters, and cannon related to the falloutverse are off or poorly done. What the main story and fallout history fail at, the world and everything else more then make up for those short comings. Inside is a deep world to explore with so many side quests and interesting places to see, its hard to not get lost and overloaded. Do yourself a flavor. Buy this game.

This is one of the best multiplayer FPS's I have ever played. The maps are huge, the graphics are beautiful, and there's a ton of customization. If you can get some friends to play it with you it will be a lot more enjoyable (other wise join a squad in-game).  Another huge plus is it isn't pay to win - although, paying does give you quicker access to weapons. It isn't remotely game breaking though, so I would say it's one of the best balances I have seen with a 'free' game that has buyable content.  The last huge plus for me was that anyone can play it and enjoy themselves, but there's still an extremely high skill cap for people that are skilled at FPS's.

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: 'You want to fight and level up your character? Too bad, here's a crash.'  'You want to enter a building necessary to progress in the game? Sucks to be you, have an infinite loading screen.'  'Stuck in combat and trying to switch weapons? LOL here's a bug that makes it so your pip boy displays nothing at all.'  'Want to keep your health up while you go through the subway? Have some invisible enemies, and have fun realizing that they are in fact invisible.'  'Want to target an enemy with VATS? Haha, here's a bug that makes it go to 2FPS in the selection screen.'  'Did you just finish walking a super long distance to somewhere? Here's a random crash for no reason.'  'Are you just trying to start the game for the first time and play? Too bad, here's a frozen screen right after the opening cutscene finishes.'  Seriously, would it really be that hard for the developers to update this game so I can play on a modern operating system? Did they really think they could just release the game on steam in this state? I've tried all the .ini tweaks and everything but the game still crashes every ten seconds. Fix this Bethesda.

This game has an incredibly cool concept, and was fun for about a week. But now, I can see that this game has as many holes in it as swiss cheese, which the developers clearly don't care to repair.  Positive:  - Sweet customization: plenty of cool options to choose from. - Immersive gameplay; awesome war-like atmosphere. - Intelligent integration of technical striking, such as slashing, overhanding, uppercutting, jabbing, parrying, kicking, etc. - Interactive speech in-game. - Feel like a boss when you win a fight.  Negative:  - 'Dragging', a flat out abuse of the game's striking system which makes you nearly impossible to beat when holding a two-handed weapon. Throw's game balance off completely. (Specifically Claymores and Zweilhanders) - Cancerous community. People generally use all the abuses, and find all the loopholes to make the game hell for people who just want to have a fun, balanced game. People who abuse the system also mock you for pointing it out, and try to get you kicked. - Team killing. Not like this is that big of an issue, because you can't just walk into your allies' swings, and this makes it to where it's much harder to gang up on an opponent, which is perfectly okay, BUT half the time, teammates don't give a single crap about killing teammates in order to get kills, even though the game tutorial teaches you how to avoid friendly fire. You will find yourself the having more deaths by friendly fire than fire in some matches, which I find infuriating. - Team stacking: another example of total garbage in this game, is that strong players (usually draggers) like to all join one team, so they can have a field day with less experienced/less skilled players, giving some teams virtually no chance of winning at all.  The bad far outweighs the good, and is only fun when playing low ranked matches against people who haven't learned how to abuse the game's loopholes, or with friends. Even in low rank games, I've caught obvious people smurfing just to feel good about themselves for annihilating a bunch of noobs.  My recommendation is don't bother downloading, because this game will get your hopes up with its awesome, and immersive gameplay, but then destroy your hopes with the distinct, and obvious imbalances, that people don't mind abusing to ruin the entire game for everyone. You will be excited, because Chivalry: Medieval Warfare seems like a really awesome game on the surface, but then crushing disappointment will follow, because the community will suck the fun right out of it for you. So, again, I recommend that you don't put yourself through it, and don't waste a red cent on this crappy, beta, unrefined game.

I have to say, I'm really happy to wasted a harmless amount of my money only on Xmas sale for this trash. I thought it could be like... a nice dark'n'gloomy, bit of a realism medieval first person game with a awesome and thrilling-serious-battlefield atmosphere, but NOPE. It's a damn childish trash fairy tale. Yes, it takes it's time to learn this game (like any other does), but even when I had good rounds... it wasn't that much fun. The only points I really laughed about, is the damn brutal way of dying. But a game shouldn't be only about K/D ratio and blood'n'guts brutal animations. ...and those freakin skins... I mean, how could I feel like I would be on a serious medieval fight, if people run around with childish vanilla stereotype skins??   SO, be aware: DO NOT PAY THE FULL PRICE, if you want to try it out... or... just don't by it at all, if you hoped for what I did: A 'Not too, but a bit of a realistic medieval first person game with a awesome and thrilling-serious-battlefield atmosphere'

I see the reviews for this game and the ones that stick out the most for me are from the people with 1000+ hours playing the game or the highlevels the dont recommend the game. The reviews they give are true for the most parts and thats what really sad. Dont get me wrong this game is fantastic and yes i would recomend it. The one true flaw with this game is indeed the community. This community is one of the most toxic i have been exposed too since the first time I played leauge. I cant tell you how many times ive entered a free for all only to find out thats is actually a team death match in disguise and your on niether team so it just turns into a medival gangbang. If you try to voice your opinion you instantly get a barrage of negativity and people telling you how you are just inferior at the game though you are quite literally getting 5 v 1'd somtimes but oh no your just bad at the game. I long for the days when I was just a wee level 5 playing in the low rank server with my friends and you could have geniune fun just slashing at your enemys without them 1 hitting you or spinning around like a hurricane of death. I can't tell you how many times ive been a duel server only the get utterly destroyed and when you ask the person how they are doing that they insist that you are just bad and that you shoud stop playing the game. It's players like that that shouldnt be allowed to play the game cause they quite literally made me stop playing because i thought it was hopeless, but I always felt myself getting pulled back and to just try again and again.   Now im not saying that all of the high ranks are just meaners but its quite a high percentage of them. If it wasnt for the few high ranks that took time out of their day to spar with me, give me tips and pointers I dont know if i would have kept playing and I cant help but think for the other people that wernt as fortunate as myself and were pushed away from the game early because of this stuff and all the fun that they are missing because of it.   However this is one of the only games where when you level up on you actually feel like your leveling up in real life. Each level I gained after level 15 was not just given to me, I had to earn it. The more you play the more you will develop the eye to see things in the mechanics that you yourself can use to come out on top. This game is challenging and it is full of alot of BS things that people can use to kill you. But the more you play you will find your own BS to use against other people. At the end of the day high ranked battles are just who can do more stupid ♥♥♥♥♥ before your enemy can.   To sum things up is this a good game? Most definately. Would I reccomend it? Yes but definately if you have a friend to play with. Is the community the best? No its not but you will find those servers somtimes where everybody isnt a colossal ♥♥♥♥♥♥. Is there some things I think should be added to the game or fixed? Yes there needs to be some sort of team level balance system so all the level 50's cant stack one team and ruin everybodys fun and people dont think they are just doing something wrong.  Game: 9/10 Community: -9/10  Msg me if you wanna play sometime.  And dont complain about feinting it was actaually intened to be in the game.

This game creates an astonishing level of rivalry between two friends. I was at the company of my friend whilst we played some jolly Dota 2. When we was contacted by a wild Russian, then another and so forth. We fealt threatened so I used all that i had in my power to fight back against the Russian scourge. With a twisted grin and keg of ale, the Dapper Whale clicked report. Again and again on each Russian within my grasp, my grin was growing crooked. Now stretching across from cheek to cheek. I began to laugh and squeal with delight. At the power that was bestowed upon me. Imaging what i could do with this button, first i will report the Russians, THEN America, why stop there i might even attack China! I had reported every teamate but one. My friend. With a wry smile, and a cackle i whispered one utterance to my friend through a messenger pigeon called 'Skype' With a click and a report i felt that my work here was done and the game had lost all enterainment value for the day. So i exited the game and now i'm in low prio for another ♥♥♥♥ing week because i refused to play with Russians because the language filter dosen't ♥♥♥♥ing work.
You know.. I'm not even calling this DotA 2 anymore, for me it's 'Game with russians' ;-(

I was hyped and bought the game. I regret my decision. Probably a worthy pickup on sale, but full price? No   I liked the idea and the lore of Warhammer, put into a total war game. However, I don't like it anymore. The battles are plain boring, as the realistic style of Total War really doesn't do the epic fantasy battles of Warhammer much justice- and vice versa. I found the battles so boring I don't even fight them. This despite the fact that leaders have more abilites like spells- it still doesn't bring any feeling to the battles. So I found the most valid strategy is to mass cheap troops and autoresolve. Quite boring that, too. The AI works mostly ok in the campaign map, but is as usual quite stupid in battles.  I think RTS-games like Dawn Of War serve the Warhammer-like battles far better than putting them into a Total War-form.  So, it's not a bad game. But it's a very boring Total War-game. I would recommend buying Shogun 2 with Fall Of The Samurai and installing Darth Mod, and you will have a far superior game for a much smaller price. Alternatively, wait for this game to appear in bundles or on a sale.   2/5

The first patch hit today, 30.06.2016, more than a month after release.  The good news is that the technical issues described in my original review (see below) have been fixed, though it took an unacceptably long time.  So now I can say that this is a pretty good and enjoyable game that I'd recommend to fans of the genre :)  CA can change this review to a positive one for only 2,49€. That's what they charged me for the blood and gore DLC.  -----------------------------  Original review:  Vsync doesn't work on nvidia hardware. Can't force vsync via control panel. Tripple buffered vsync in borderless mode doesn't work... yeah, that's right. It's like they took special care to break it. 2 dollar indie games get vsync right 99% of the time.  Their in-game vsync abomination makes the UI flicker badly. Yes, apparently this passed 'testing'.  I don't expect issues like this from full price releases. Most Early Access games aren't this amateurish.  This is Priorities Gone Wrong: The Game. They could spend cash on the Denuvo garbage, but it seems like they skipped QA entirely for the product they offer paying customers.  I'll update this to be a review of the actual game once the tech issues are sorted out. If I remember to...

I've been an RTS fan for my whole life, and a HUGE fan of the Total War Series and Warhammer Series as well. This game is AMAZING. The graphics are top, the visuals of the battles are cinamatic worthy and the lore is spelended. Only one hour in campain and Im already hooked. The release is very stable, especially for a Total War game. I just have a few flicking UIs that I know would be fixed very soon  NOTE: This isnt your typical Total War game nore is it a Warhammer game. It's a combination of both games and it was pulled off well. What makes this different? *Combat is more faster paced *Cities on the campain map are a bit closer to eachother. Think of Shogun 2's campain map. *Hero/Commanders are a one unit squad *Heroes can have mounts! * MAGIC ON THE BATTLEFIELD, BIG PLUS *Campain has alot of changes, This includes how tech works and political stuff *Special Units and different classes example: 'Big units' would be the Giant orges   I will add more stuff to this later on when I find new stuff. But I highly reccomend this game.  Go get it so we can play co-op campain! SEE YOU IN BATTLE!

Far Cry 3 is better than its predecessors but claiming it's 'Elder Scrolls with guns' is hyperbole at BEST. The game has a beautiful world, yet it's shallow and sparse--lacking true believability or detail. This leaves the player feeling empty and unmotivated; having no emotional attachment with the world or its characters--something one wouldn't expect from an open-ended world. Far Cry 3 takes place on an island that consists mostly of wilderness with a few small shanty villages and pirate outposts that you can 'liberate'. The game has some brief adrenaline-pumping sequences but it is ultimately a generic FPS through and through. Granted, it does have a light mixture of other elements like weapon customization, skill trees, and crafting. However these options don't make combat any less repetitive or the quests any less tedious. The story develops in traditional, albeit questionable ways and side missions and challenges are laughable and boring. I wouldn't recommend this game for $30 (which is what I paid for it). I would wait for a better deal. I know there are people out there who enjoyed Far Cry 3, but I'm not one of them.

This is by far best Total War game ever made, Warhammer Fantasy is one of the best fantasy worlds and so when that tied in with Total War you get an awesome game .  Everyone know about Lord of the Rings but that fantasy pales compared to Warhammer where you have a world in which millions die so often, in this game you have magic system, you have machines of war like steam tank, you have unique generals and leaders (unlike in any previous total war), you have monsters, giants, trolls, flying units, amazing looking campaign map and great music, quest battles and much more. app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: One of my favorite games of all time. Unfortunately, it's currently broken on Windows 10. All of the fixes to work around GFWL and the multi-core processor bug appear to have broken themselves in the transition from 7.  It's too bad that Bethesda is unlikely to fix these problems for the vibrant community that continues to support this game--a game which no doubt is still very profitable for the company.  At least New Vegas still works.

I don't think that ranked matchmaking system is fair. One needs to remember that this game is about teamplay but if you are always given teammates whose skills are no match for the enemy team, it starts to be problematic.   Another issue is that no matter how good you play if 'your team' loses, you lose -25 points anyway, so you are never rewarded for your trying and hard-work. Apart from these, I think Dota2 is a good platform for moba gaming yet competitive system is not mature, after all these hours I invested to this game, I quit. I could no longer feel happy, it was replaced with stress and games are supposed to be for fun.  Would I recommend this game? No, the time is valuable and in my opinion Dota2 can't compensate the value of it. (I know I spent many hours, thats why I am giving this advise)

So for some rëtarded, büllshït reason, Steam saw fit to remove my old review of this game. SHAME ON YOU VALVE, YOU PENNY-WHÖRING CÜNT-WRANGLERS!  Now that that's all done 'n' over with, on to da review!  Considering the ultra-shïtty game that was the previous installation in the FarCry series, namely FarCry 2, I was VERY negative towards FC3 when I started playing it. But lo and behold, it managed to not just turn me around 540 degrees, but also shove a 'LOVE ME OR DIE!' sign up my ärse. And after having a team of no less than four proctologists (butt-doctors, hurr durr) spend eight shifts each removing said sign, I was back to duke it out with the game again, and this time, I made it my personal li'l bïtch!  That right there might seem like inane, off-topic crap, but it's actually a pretty accurate analogy for how my actual gameplay experience was with FC3. I stumbled around like a complete fockin' rëtard at first, getting my äss handed to me by basically anything with a moderately bigger gun than me (which was everything), until I got my first few skills. Then, it was 'screw you, enemies, I've got STEALTH KILL POWER!' and away I went! I was a slicin', dicin', lean, mean, murder-machine, stalkin' the scene! So, yeah.  On a more serious note, the game has abso-bloody-lutely awful music, but that's 'tolerable' considering the fact that casing eject ports are for once on the right side on (most of) the guns (i.e. the ACTUALLY RIGHT SIDE!), the characters are SURPRISINGLY deep and interesting, the plot doesn't take 'no' for an answer when dealing with censoring and goes all-out nutbag fockery (literally, as the game has an actual sex-scene!) with blood, gore, swearing, booze, gambling, nudity and hell, even a fockload of drugs to boot! (That one bit with some funky fungal fun was plain awesome.)  There's not a Jagged Alliance 2-style epic amount of guns (which had upwards of a hundred freakin' guns methinks), but FC3 does have more than enough guns in almost every category (sans shotguns) to warrant a 'diversity's choice award', and the fact that it's almost completely free (except on certain missions) in how you play it, how you build your skills, it's absolutely knee-breakingly astounding how a game with a completely worthless predecessor like FarCry 2 could actually be GOOD, if not even GREAT. 8.7/10

EDIT: I have tried getting into it again, and I still see the problems listed here. It is also a fact that I hate F2P games, for it is often it is P2W.  Don't let Steam's Game Time fool ya'll. I've played this game since Nov 2013, daily. I got the game directly off SOE's page. When I first tried it, I felt confused in a good way, and It was fun. 100's of People on foot, in Tanks, In Transport Trucks 'Called Sunderers', And in fighters. Then after 2-3 Months, I felt like I was repeating yesterday, over and over. The first impressions the game left on me vanished. I decided to stay, however, seeing I invested time, and money. But then a few months later, I noticed a decline in player activity, something I honestly expected. It dropped to mere a continent having fewer them 50 people on it. At that point I felt like people left because of lack of content, lack of instructions, or lack of movitation. I then decided to quit my Membership, and leave the game all together.   Now, onto the Pros, and the Cons.  Pros: > A lot of weapons and tools to use. > A lot of so called 'Outfits' that are player groups. > A good mix of Land, and Air vehicles to pilot. > Big battlegrounds to exchange fire. > Servers for different Time Zones.  Cons: > Cosmetics and Membership are overpriced. > Weapons with in-game currency are overpriced. > Requires a High-Grade PC to run at decent settings. > Poor Tuturial level. > Poor In-Game Mic chat. > Possible unexpected game crashes. > Newer players can mess up a Base Capture-Defense  Thats all I was able to think of. This game isn't good. I give it a 4/10

Ah, yes, Five Nights at Freddies. The most overrated horror game (Not sorry) in the history of horror games. To start off, I'd like to convey my disbelief that I actually had to BUY this game. As in exchange MONEY for it. It's about the least engaging game I've ever played. On top of that, it looks like a game that should be open to download and play for free rather than having to actually pay for it. That being said, it doesn stand out from its' indie game counterparts in several ways, like a Mexican immigrant standing among a group of US Army Rangers. Moving on...  As for the positives, there aren't too many. I suppose the most I can say about it is that it did, indeed, create a tense atmosphere and it certainly made me feel slightly anxious. The thought of strange, disturbing animatronic stalking you in a small building where you're powerless to fight back is something that the game recreated perfectly. Sometimes I even found myself turning around to check whether or not I was alone, so the game certainly knows how to create a nervous feeling for the player. That said, that still doesn't redeem it.  The level design is flat out...what's the word? Basic? Simple? Linear? It basically consists of several still images where the only change you'll see is Chuck.E Cheese popping onto the screen for a couple of seconds and then buggering off to his Child sex dungeon, before showing up again with a face that says 'I'm done down there, did you miss me?!' And that's why I had second thoughts buying the game. It seemed I needed to pay for more than the game was actually worth. '£5 worth of sitting around watching the Happy Tree Friends over here wander from room to room until one finally finds me and sinks his teeth into my manboobs? No thanks, Steam...' That's the problem with FNAF. It's TOO basic. The gameplay is boring, the level design is about as linear as an 80 tear old Man's ♥♥♥♥♥ and the only sense of horror you feel is when you see the animatornics, which only show up for a couple of seconds.  Then, we have the jumpscares themselves. I'm not even going to mention the huge leap in logic that a reinforced door required power to stay CLOSED. But here's my main problem with FNAF. The whole game exists for the premise of a jumpscare, which contradicts what a jumpscare is actually FOR. It's not just a punishment for losing the game, Scott, it's a climactic moment that is supposed to be built-up through atmosphere and tension. Although FNAF does a fantastic job of building up said tension, that feeling dissipates before the jumpscare actually happens. FNAF, like many other horror games nowadays, lacks pacing. That beautiful little trick that naturally builds up a beautiful amount of tension without even trying. When the jumpscare happens without warning, it does nothing but jolt the player awake, rather than actually scaring them.  So, do I recommend this game? Personally, no. I didn't find it to be particularly fun whatsoever, and found it less engaging than eating my own ♥♥♥♥. I suppose, if you just want to scream into a camera to rack up a large view-count on Youtube, this is the perfect game for you! Problem is, whereas FNAF considers itself a horror game, it's more of a point-and-click minigame with some horror-inspired elements. So, no. Personally, I'd say spend your money on something else...

It is difficult to recommend this game presently. When it works, it is enjoyable like so many other entries in the Total War series. However, I have encountered a game-breaking bug that has effectively prevented me from making ANY progress in campaigns beyond a certain point (normally around turn 70-90) in two of my three campaigns so far. Basically, the game decides to spawn the Chaos armies in a scripted event around turn 70-90, but if you're unlucky like me and so many other players, Chaos won't spawn and your game becomes bugged. At this point, you cannot end turn or move your units around the map. Nothing will fix the issue short of starting a new campaign, and seemingly there's nothing you can do to prevent it from happening, either. Thus, if and when the bug occurs, your campaign is borked and you've lost 10-15 hours of play. Given the hundreds of posts on the issue over the past month at the CA forums, Reddit, and the Steam group, I find it inexcusable for a company to let a bug of this magnitude slip and go unacknowledged until yesterday.  CA says they are 'looking into' this bug. However, if the fix doesn't retroactively apply to older campaigns, I'm done with this game and any future CA titles. I do not have the time or patience to constantly restart campaigns any time I encounter a bug.

This game is very unique, and downright terrifying.   I first found this game a few months ago when only the demo was available. I played it, and I had no idea what I getting myself into...  This game is terrifying, it's a point and click game but it has a crushingly terrifying atmosphere, because you could be jumpscared at any moment.   In this game, you play as a man who got himself a job at a kids pizza store named Freddy Fazbear's Pizza. You have been hired to work the night shift and you begin the game at Night 1. You cannot move in this game, you can only operate the door lights, peek up at your security cameras or shut/open your doors. You are unaware of the fact that the animatronics you are looking after (which are basically animal robots which are mascots to the store) actually move around at night, and if they find you...they will kill you.  You spend the five nights of this game constantly peeking up at the cameras making sure all of the animatronics are in place, and when they move you must keep track of them otherwise they will get into your office and horrifyingly jumpscare you.   That is basically how you survive in this game, you keep an eye on the animatronics and when they get near your office, you just shut the doors so they can't get in. Sounds pretty easy huh?  Well, these animatronics cut off your camera when they move around, which means that you have no idea where they are and they could have just ran straight next to your door without you knowing and get you. Also, if you're late catching them they will cut off the power to your doors, meaning certain death.   If that wasn't enough however, you have a power bar which means that you must be careful with the amount of power you use. (You lose power by looking at your camera, using the door lights and shutting the doors.) And once that percentage hits 0, you have only a matter of seconds to live before Freddy comes and finishes you off.   There are various ways you have to handle the animatronics in order to survive, and they all work differently but I am not going to tell you how to handle them because then the experience just won't the the same for you!   The jumpscares will make you jump, and will make you scream and it WILL happen so if you're going to buy this game, make sure you know what you're getting into!   The couple of negative things I could say about this game is that it does get tedious because once you know how to survive, that's it! That's it for the rest of the nights and you'll be safe, once you know the way around the game you will breeze through it. Another thing is that, after a certain amount of jumpscares; you do get used to them and they will not scare you so much, which does ruin the atmosphere a bit and may just frustrate you if you fail.  Overall, I'd definitely recommend giving this game a try and it will be challenge to complete all seven of the nights (yes, seven!) Just make sure you're prepared before going on this rollercoaster!

High skill ceiling with very simple controls. There isn't any other game with melee combat that gives you more direct control. Swinging feels weighted and satisfying. Every kill you get feels like you earned it. Combat is slow enough to let the player know exactly what's going on, but quick enough to feel frantic. You can be killed in an average of one to four hits, so every mistake you make feels like it's crushing. With all this, it's never unfair. It's easy to understand what you're doing wrong when you fail and what you did right when you succeed. It's that great balance and feedback you get from classics like Counter-Strike and Unreal Tournament.  The developers even provided free content patches, including additional game modes and maps. There is a plethora of modes to choose from, ranging from objective maps to free for all, even including a duel mode for those whose emphasis is on the competitive nature of the game.   The objective maps are interesting and unique but suffer from poor balance. Votekick is not hard to abuse if you get the server on your side. Some, but few weapons have balance issues in that they simply aren't as viable, despite being unique and fun.  Overall solid game and very much worth picking up at its current price, but this game is frequently on sale around $7.50.

I don't know if Icefrog is still the head of developement in dota 2 but the gameplay has been deteriorating since its release. Every patch has something altered in the game instead of just fixing bugs. Old heroes who had the same skills for decades (since dota on Warcraft 3) have been changed and nerfed (Ex. Techie) while new imbalanced heroes are introduced into the game. The map has been completely changed in its first historical alteration in the last patch. They're attempting to bring in features from LoL. Dota 2 is losing more players to LoL. And it's a pity that they are willing to cut originality in order to keep a few douches.   The matchmaking and reporting system is horrendous. If you win a few games then you'll automatically be paired with losers. If you suck a few games, people randomly report you and you end up in the low priority pool. Which is pretty much a penalty. This happens often when you play alone with a four-man team.  It's been over 2-3 years since release and these issues have barely been addressed. They focus more on creating content so it drives money in. The gameplay and nerfing/buffing of heroes has deteriorated the once praised dota experience. It's not worth playing anymore. I know a lot of old school dota players from warcraft 3 that have avoided playing this version.

Spent a whole day as a goat, rampaged through a city, blew up a few gas stations, flew a jetpack, sacrificed 5 humans to Satan, got hit by 17 cars, double jumped over a few buildings, fought a goat trained by Michael Bay, then came home to play Goat Simulator.  It's a pretty good game.

Pros: I was interested in the story as the first part of the plot revealed itself. I wanted to take on the villains as the game wanted me to.  Cons: Uplay and Steam can't figure out who is running the program when I first install it, requiring Uplay to be closed and reopened in order to run. Annoyed that the borderless window mode cannot be minimized, which resulted in a pain point as I configured my gamepad. Not enough checkpoints in the tutorial; Mess up a less and go back 2 or 3 lessons. Game crashes at maybe the halfway mark of the tutorial and I have to therefore start the entire tutorial mission over again; That is, the checkpoints don't even save so continuing... Isn't.  Bottom Line: Too many pain points too early on making for a poor first impression. Maybe you'll have better luck than me? Who knows. I don't recommend you put money down to find out. Avoid.

The Whack-a-Mole of the horror genre, Five Nights at Freddy's plays unlike any spooky game you've ever seen. While the player never once moves from their office, and while each level is only a couple minutes short, the game is deceptively simple--spending your nights at Freddy's actually demands both strategic thinking and fast reflexes. Using just a simple mouse-only interface, very little animation, and some clever design, this game not only creates a superb atmosphere of suspense, but also manages to be quite challenging. All in all, I'd say it's well worth $5.

Don't get this game. Don't. I know what you're thinking, it's hilarious, and you can't wait to find all the secrets or play with the wacky physics or whatever, and it'll just be a relaxing mindless game you sometimes come back to play for a quick dip of stupid humor. Trust me, I thought the same thing, and so did all the friends I asked.  That's not going to happen.  You're going to buy it, play it for 10 minutes, maybe come back to it after a day or two, and then you will never touch it again. This game is not worth your money. I get that that's the whole joke, but it seriously isn't. Think of all the other things you could do with $10. Seriously, list them. Unless you've done every single other thing you can think of with these ten dollars, I don't recomend this game. Unless this goes on sale for a dollar or less, skip it.

I wish I could give this more of a in-between rating, but unfortunately there isn't an option for that. But I guess overall, I have to say no.  It's meh. You get two hours of enjoyment out of it pretty much. I guess if you are absolutely bored and have nothing to do, it can pass some time since it doesn't really have a goal and you won't get sucked into it like other games, but can occupy you.  Most of it's charm comes from it's references. Those are pretty much where all the humor comes from. Sure the physics may be silly, but it feels like there isn't enough to play around with to get enough laughs.  The map is actually surprisingly small. I initially thought it would have more to do. You see a city in the backbround, but unfortunately, you can't got to it. That would have been a fun enviroment to play in, but unfortunately, it's just not part of the one map. Also, the developers put in houses that you CAN'T enter. There are only two houses you can enter: The one you spawn in front of, and the Coffee Stain Studios one. I just find it kind of stupid how you have a small map, and make it a tiny bit smaller by having useless un-enterable buildings.  It's also sucks how the civilians are pretty much another object. In a game like GTA, it's fun to wreck havoc because there is a whole bunch of people and you can go on a blood thirsty rampage and watch the civilians flee. Then cops show up and try to kill you and you then have even more people and things to blow up. The civilians here are kind of few, and they just don't do much. They may make screams, but they don't really run away all that much.  It also seems like it is a hog when it comes to CPU power. Unfortunately, I can't really say much on this, since I don't have a super expensive gaming rig, but apparently some people say they have a good gaming rig and they don't get as much framerate as they normally do. But still, I feel that hardly matters, since it seems like it's still playable even on my laptop, albeit it's on low settings.  I do like how the developers capitalize on the fact that it endorses bugs. That is funny to see at first, but when you get down to it, it kind of ruins the gameplay a bit. If you see a funny stretchy body bug in something like Fallout or Halo or Gears of War, or most other games, it's funny too see because that is an unintended result, and things are funny to us when we don't expect it. But, when you get those spazzy body physics in this game, you know that's what the game intends and it just isn't that funny.  It feels like this game is not worth 10$. Maybe more like 5$. But still, who knows. This game does have workshop, so maybe enough people can make fun and amusing maps to play on or some fun functions and features, and that can save this game. But of course, that is assuming that the people who are devent at making maps and what not don't get bored of this game to the point where they don't want to work on it anymore. But still, it doesn't matter so much to the developers. They already made a ♥♥♥♥ ton of money from this. It was advertised well and a lot of people boarded the hype train. I was one of the passengers. Now I am in a place I don't want to be and can't get my money back.  TL;DR It's only worth half it's price, and it seems to be lacking in a lot of areas. Meh physics. It sold well because of good advertising and hype. Can provide two hours of fun, and can possibly pass a short amount of time every so often if you need something to do or waiting for something.

This is going to be a long review, if you want a synopsis of it, the game has an incredible battle system, smooth, and very well done. The biggest problem of it, are technicals, like high ping in some regions (South America for example), bad optimization, etc. BUT if you can afford those technicals issues, or if you have a friend to play it, then buy it when it's on discount.  Remember that this is based in my opinion, and i'm triying to be the most objetive possible, because i liked the game, but can't recommend this game because of the problems that i'm going to say.  Note: Even if i can't recommend it, i'm still going to play it, because the game is so funny to play, that i want to keep playing, that's it, even if i sound like an hypocritical.  If you want the long version, there you go:  First of all, i like the game, but i just can't recommend it to anyone that cannot afford those technical issues, since the game has A LOT of problems, like a high ping (At least if you're from south america), desbalanced team matchmaking, bad translation to spanish, a lot of bugs and more. But hey, the combat system of the game is incredible good, making 1 v 1 system very smooth and 'skill dependant' (You can parry, block, counter-attack, kick him in order to get through his shield, and has variations of attacks). All players have the same opportunities against the others, and only experience is which separate you from another player, because all weapons are balanced (In their own way, can't compare a Zweihander with a bow).  Conclusion: Chivalry is the perfect example of how technical issues can be so bad that can surpass all the in-game pros that it has.  Like i said earlier, if you like the game, ain't affected or can afford those technical issues (Like me), has a friend to play it with or just saw the the game at low price, then buy it.  If you doesn't meet at least two of these four 'points', then don't buy it (In my opinion) , in the other way, i highly recommend it.  Note: Remember that i pointed the game as 'not recommended' not as 'disliked' (Because if you read my review, you know that i'm still going to play this game. This is a really common missunderstanding when someone reviews a game in steam.

Very disapointing.... Tried to make far cry series in to an RPG eldersrcoll style but with guns. Don't get me wrong i love the Elderscrolls series and have them all. But this does'nt really work for FPS.  What you expect is the best of the original Farcry back on tropical islands with superb eye watering graphics and some super FPS godlyness. Unfortunately what you get is a stupid RPG style which impeads the game and makes it such a slow paced crawler. This isn't helped by the very poor GUI menu system which you have to keep going in to back and forth.  That combined with, you can't play the game until you have installed and updated the Uplay software which delayed me for another hour and half as the ubisoft servers was so slow to download the data it required before allowing you to play the game. Steam launches Uplay and you just can't get around it without launching the poor software.  Positives: The graphics do look good and there is plenty of throw backs to the original Farcry landscape which is also very good.  Negatives: Uplay game launcher, Poor GUI Menu System, RPG styled game play which killed the game.

Load times were extremely fast on SSD but had to move off their to make room for other things and it loads pretty slow on HDD. All in all like I said in the first sentence, yes the game is worth it but be prepared for the vomit of DLC that will be coming for months between $3-$20.
