Total War: Warhammer is a pretty good game. I've had fun playing it, and I keep playing it a bit now and again. I've also bought all the DLC. Graphics are nice, it does capture the Warhammer Universe pretty well... but there are just too many negatives.  - CA are pretty incompetent. Patches will often render your current game unplayable. I lost a 120 turn game between patches.  - When the game patches, it clones the entire game. This means that on an HDD it can take upwards of an hour, and on an SSD you need at least 25gig of free space.  - I paid $25 for the Beastment DLC which had pretty much copy and paste Ork mechanics. Lazy, lazy gameplay development for an expensive DLC  - I get HUGE frame drops whenever there are undead zombies on screen.  - I've had to find about 8 quality of life mods just to make the game playable and fun. Speed boosts in friendly territory (or you just get kited indefinitely. I was so mad when i manoeuvred 2 armies to corner a raiding army and they just ♥♥♥♥ed off in boats.) Camera mods, enemy unit composition mods (or they just kite you for days with cavalry archers). Mods to make heroes more fun. Just basic things that should have been in the game.  - Incredibly lazy game design for dificulty levels. Harder level AI simply cheats - more gold, better stats in game, increased morale etc. They don't play any differently, as in, they don't employ better tactics. CA has literally just buffed their stats unfarily.

PROS: A smallish map with a LOT to explore and the goals make the game more than just a mess-around game (although it really is that in the first place) and the fact that it is supposed to be buggy makes the game that much more hilarious. With the golden goat trophies this game makes my day. You can become [SPOILER ALERT]    a flipping sperm whale and flop around the map or even an alien from Sanctum 2 (it kinda looks like a bug giraffe thing)   . There are many other goats you can be if you collect enough golden goat statues. This game even has workshop support, so if you get bored of the normal goats or the original map or even just want more abilities for custom games, then you can get an item from the workshop or make your own. For such a small map, the place is flipping packed with easter eggs (such as the golden goat trophies) and, my favorite, a cool robot dude in a storage crate held up by the crane and [SPOILER ALERT]    If you get certain achievments you can actually be the robot!    And on the side, there are many references to other games like Coffee Stain Studio's game Sanctum 2 and Flappy bird.  CONS: The fact that they are only removing bugs that crash the game means that there will always be bugs. Always. Sometimes I find myself getting stuck on a rock and glitching underground. I still would like the bugs there but some of them are just plain irritating. The game also requires a pretty good graphics card, so make sure your computer isn't a potato and the game doesn't eat your computer. I had to turn my settings all the way down and only then did most of the lag go away. Another thing is that the Flappy Bird game (Flappy Goat) is the most rage inducing thing in the ENTIRE game. To unlock the achievment for the Flappy Goat you needed to score ten and my high score is like six. And the reason it is hard is because the hitbox of the goat is bigger than the goat itself so you end up hitting something when it looks like you didn't. And with some of the goats like the space goat for example, its a lot harder to know where your headbutting because you dont hit where your head goes, you hit right in front of you so it kinda seems a bit akward, but hopefully they will fix it. The game is still in development so all the bad stuff right now will probably be fixed in the future and new stuff will be added.   Overall I give this game a 11/10. Apart from the bugs which they are never going to fix (which isn't really that bad) and some akward hitboxes this game is virtual gold. Mostly because the bad and irritating things about this game don't bother me as much as it would with other people. If you are looking for a good laugh, a goat with jelly legs, and a cool game to play with your friends at home    (They are planning to add local co-op)    then this is the game for you!*   *This game is Chuck Norris approved

<b>Warning to those with lowish end computers!</b>Obviously from my play time I didn't get much of a chance with this. I just wanted to warn other low end computer users like me that this game doesn't work well at all unless you have a bit of power to your system. This might seem like a 'No sh*t Sherlock' observation, however the same requirement specs in other games sometimes runs fine on my system, however that was not the case with this one. I also came across the problem with my logitech controller that happens often with steam games, where my controls are all wonky. 'Up goes down, the action buttons are random' I don't know why this happens with steam games. Some accept it, others don't. The same game not from steam will work fine, but the steam version won't. (Figured this out thanks to the humble bundle, deciding I wanted the acheivments after realizing I had a choice over what version of the game to get) Anyway, wasn't sure if I should give this a thumbs down, but since I had to choose one and giving a thumbs up to something I couldn't get working didn't seem fair. It'd be nice to have a middle option, like a 'Tried and couldn't get it working' review. :P

Odd little things and arros to click, like the 'download' symbol you see, but inversed, and shown durring a loading player state like...I sit there and think...'What will happen if I click that? Explodeth the game??? Instant gold?....and you hover the mouse over andddd nope...won't touch it'.... stuff like this ALL OVER!   Make matters worse, so you have this giant menu to look at heros...ok, animated little thumb files...you click in, little run down, but no 'see what they can do' just a button that offers you a demo round with them like what??? so all that effort into a making a aniamted thumbs but what COUNTS! WHAT REALLY COUNTS is this shove in load a new screen sort of presentation? OHHHH IT GET'S WORSE!   So go in to play: I select my character, choose the game mode (which is confusing as fewk, I just chose : 'All' which makes you think you are about to queue up for ALL the modes availabe, but now it just means 'all characters available' as opposed to 'just 3 at random' mode....you see it is brain dumbing down UI choices that make me think : 'Why do people call this the 'smart mans MOBA' over LoL? Lol is actually WAY more logically put together than this POS.  So I ge my match fired up in under a minute. And then....WE CHOSE AGAIN heroes...Wait wait wait, oh and get this, it is not, of course, USER INTERFACE FRIENDLY! You have this Windows 8 / MAC interface rip off window selection of characters... you know, like a bar of icons to sift through like a whirly book...so I now, as a new player, I have to RESWIFT through all these champions...You see before, on a one page lay out, it is organized by FORCE - Agility - MAGIC heroes (and you have to click into each one to see which one is carry, distance etc... just bad), but here it is nothing...just all sloppily thown into this whirly book icon thing...so I panic since the match is about to start and timer counting down, I start franitcally swifting through...oh god who was it again???? What did I want? Oh look, that one looks cool...no, stay on target.... AH HA! FOUND IT! WHEWWWW lock it in....  And now another 2 min wait for...I don't know what...but in the end about the same waiting time as LOL to fire up. So no major issues...  In game....ok...oh god...*Insert massive rant on the horrid UI. Poor camera. Bad map movement*. WHAT? I pressed C for camera hoping it locks me in place, but NOooooo I activated a pack donkey....folks...I kid you not. My character straight up goes STATIC, and I became a pack donkey.... DONT EVER PRESS C!   So then back to game once I got that straightened up. I follow my zerglings to the nearest tower, some guy is killing my zergies behind the tower, ok, I start whacking the tower and some one that was 100% invisible unlcoaks, and 2 shots my 'Tank assassin' guy (he being a regular assassin, some kind of shark with invisibiliy).... And THAT is when I literally pressed ENTER: 'This game sucks, LOL is better', Abandoned the match. Hit EXIT: Uninstalled from Steam!   0/10 back to LoL Simulator

Hello Everybody, I am an experienced Total war player and Super fan, I started with Medieval 2 and loved it, and loved every single game since. Not this one though. The first time I attacked a village and realised there were no longer village battles but just a regular land battle like any other, I knew this game had gotten dumbed down and was treated very lazily. Why else would they not have village battles except for being too lazy to implement them, or just plain rushing the game. Also I hate the fact that a hero and an agent, if put in the army, takes an entire slot in your 20 stack army, so not only do you have less units and soldiers than previous games to start, you lose every single soldier that would normally be in your generals unit, and if you take an agent you lose another unit of soldiers. I could go on and on about the mistakes in this game, but I will not because others are doing so, this game is just a huge pile of mistakes, and utterly pales in comparison to previous titles. This game, like many others, tries to please more and more people after each title, so with trying to please more and more people, they lose the original greatness that this franchise is with each new release of a title. It's sad. Please do not purchase this game to send Creative assembly a strong message.

The game itself is nice and well designed. But this review is negative for SEGA's stupid marketing performance about the cancelled Chinese version. They claimed to have simplified Chinese version at first which made Total War fans in China excited. But they cancelled the Chinese version while the translation was 80% finished by a famous Chinese localisation team Jianjia (Most Chinese localisation team are doing this voluntarily and get no payment or any donation. They are one of them.). Upon the cancel and NDA becoming invalid, this irritates most Chinese Total War fans who are looking forwards to this game. They are fine with English version game but felt like being tricked while hearing this. This made me believe that all Japanese game company's marketing department (except SE maybe) were directed by a group of idiots.

They say this game is skyrim with guns, HA! im not even a fan of skyrim but if your a complacent dimwit with no concept of how these games are constructed read no further and go ahead and | have your happy meal served to you, have you hand held and walked through every mundane step of this total waist of hard drive space. For a start skyrim like all of bethesda's masterpieces is loaded with an unthamomable veriaty of intreguing areas, NPCs, and side quests that lure you, seduce you willingly away from the main story path time and again and have you whiling away countless hours wondering whats round the next corner carefully choosing who you will side with, who you will or will not help, while this game does the exact ♥♥♥♥ing opposite, beyond the primary story and a pitifull bounty board this game offers little more than farming for crafting material. Yes you can re activate towers, take over shanty towns and every single one of them is near identical and makes itself so easy a monky could be trained to do it but are more like obsticals designed to prolong your play-through time than, there is NO dialogue choices, NO path choices, the quests themselves offer NO choices in terms of order and rout, and throughout the game your option is either to fight head on, or sneak. It may be an open free roaming map but you're simply going in strait lines from one linier dungeon to another one at a time following the most utterly ♥♥♥♥ing predictable storyline iv ever seen in a game like this one. even the gunplay is just tailered to the average child who grew up played you know what of duty. but all this i could forgive ALL OF IT, if only the AIs wernt so utterly stupid, they will either rush you or stand slowly shooting at you maybe tossing the occaisional nade. The wildlife aspect is obviousely a random script event but even with its most random ilussion is notyhing more than an gimmick to make the world seem alittle more alive but really its just saying spawn animal here, spawn pirates there, animal force target pirates and places that infront of you. even the pirate jeeps are limited to half the speed of other vehicals obviousely to prevent them from chasing you too far, WHY? why cant they chase me to the end of the map? that would be 1 interesting aspect of the gameplay, 1 purpose for it being in a sandbox map and not just a platform game. Yes i can see the apeal if you like pretty shooters, but to compare any aspect of this game to skyrim is absurd its more like xcrash bandicoot with guns and not in a good way. really I play MMOs that are less repetative and more interesting than this over produced soap oprah and thats speaking from a single player standing point, I could go on.  TLDR: you go in a strait line from one narrow linier quest to another, one at a time, with a couple of gimmicks and repetetive completionist quests along the way. with the dumbest and most predictable AIs youl ever see, and thats being KIND

Far Cry 3 is probably the first single player FPS experience I've spent more than 100 hours in. Although the multiplayer is terrible, the single player is quite frankly a blast to play. As a prissy high-class snob, you're left on your own on Rook Island, a cruel and dangerous place, where you have to survive by killing pirates, wild life and explore the island for secrets and help the inhabitants with the strangest things.   The gameplay is solid, the gun mechanics are spot on, and the game looks beautiful. Not Crysis level, of course, but it's still one of the prettiest looking games to date.

One of the few MMOFPS games in existence, Planetside 2 is by far one of the best designed. It pulls off large scale warfare with little framerate issues, but latency may lead to a few unfair deaths. Unlocking weapons will also take a few days for each one, but at least it gives you something to work towards constantly. Some argue that it is p2w, and I kind of agree, but spending time with the game will earn you far more kills and upgrades than buying yourself a shiny new gun.   Unless it is a new sniper. It's a fun game but the vanilla version is really lacking. It has very little content and could benefit a lot from more maps, game modes or just more things to do in general. I understand the developers want to benefit from all the work they put into the DLCs but as I said the vanilla game has very little content and often than not leaves you pretty bored after playing the game for a little while. It would be nice if they could update the vanilla game with more content instead of passing it of as DLC. I think Goat Simulator has a lot of potential and could possibly become one of the most fun crash course/sandbox games on steam if it wasn't so lacking.  I'm recommending it because despite what I said, the game is fun even though the fun doesn't last very long.

The guns are fantastic (as well as the customizing), the sounds are excellent, the side missions will last you quite a while so you won't get bored, and more. This is truly a great game. Highly recommend this to anyone.

This game can be really hard for players first starting out, especially if they haven't played many FPS games before. Once you get a hange of things it can be a lot more fun. Also when first starting out try to join a squad or outfit (there are videos on the internet explaining how to join squads/outfits). Playing with other people than just by yourself is a lot more fun. I personally haven't seen many trollers or pleople that are mean, so the community is pretty nice. It is a little hard to get anywhere without dumping money into this game but people can do it, that is good if you are trying to save money. So far I haven't spent any money on this game but that might change soon because I want to see this game grow. Also there are youtubers out there that review this game and let people know on any updates (I watch Wrell) and those can help a person out a lot. Overall this is my favorite game to put time into. I would give this game 9.8 out of 10

**EDIT on 08JAN15**  TLDR: Never chatted. Team was wiped by a superior team. Whiney player blamed the mute (me), I get reported. Get 7 games LP for doing nothing wrong. ♥♥♥♥. This. Community.   DO NOT PLAY.   Yes, I don't recommend this game but I continue to play it and this game has the most logged hours out of my entire library BY FAR. Legit playing hours. Not AFKing at the main menu. So, take what I say in weight of gold.  I'm addicted to this game because yes, down deep, it has everything I look for in a game when it comes to competitiveness, strategy, RPG mixes and just its gameplay overall. So it's addicting. I keep coming back to it besides the fact it is the only game my entire life that gets me so angry I punch my desk leaving a gaping hole through the wood. Real wood. My hand is still recovering.  Today, I'm playing a ranked game. My team is getting horribly wooped and it's just a cascade failure. We were able to make some comebacks here and there but never enough to catch up and make a real change in the pace of the game. We were screwed.  Now, I'm muted. On my 3rd 165 hour comms ban in a row. Because people don't like it when others don't appreciate being called internet words we've heard and then some when said person is completely ignorant or wrong in what he said. Mind you, simply ignoring these people doesn't work. I'll get to that in a second.  So, because I'm muted I cannot say anything beyond provided phrases in the chat wheel related to gameplay. Like, attack or get back. So, the entire game this nightstalker is blaming me for our ♥♥♥ whooping. Apparently, it's because I didn't buy a blink before 23 minutes. Mind you, that's because I couldnt save 2.3k for the damn item because every time I get 60% or more towards it we'd have a team fight and we'd get destroyed. If there wasn't a team fight I couldn't find farm because the other carries were taking it or the lanes were too pushed out I'd get ganked. Yet, the simple fact me (axe) did not have blink is the reason why we lost with over 20 kills down. So, the majority of the game he is whining in chat to have me reported because 'axe is ♥♥♥♥'  We lost. Whatever. I go reqeueu for ranked and all of a sudden it stops a couple of minutes in and I get rewarded 7 mando games in Low Piority. Oh ghee. Perfect example of the community in DOTA2. Screwed if you defend urself in chat. Screwed if you dont. I have never felt such strong desire to strangle someone in my life before I discovered Dota2. I truly wish I never let myself get into the MOBA genre of gameplay. It's too addicting and not worth the stress. Maybe I'll get more self control and play this game less -- of which I do but I think it will be another year before I'm done playing completely.     ____ Horrible community ___ Some of the worst you'll find in online gaming. With how unforgiving and hypercompetitive the gameplay of DOTA2 is having a troll or just even a inexperienced teammate will ruin the game. Once your team has gone so far beyond the point of a comeback in the match, the fact that there is a lack of a surrender feature like the one found in League of Legends guarantees that you will be forced to waste 30-60 minutes of your life in a slow, painful defeat. There's no forgiving nature both from the game or the majority of players if you make mistakes or feed the enemy team and etc. You will likely be ignored or yelled at with various insults if trying to direct (or as DOTA2 community rankings describe it as 'leadership') your team with advice.  ____ Poor & Unfair MMR System ____ The current MMR system is simply a win or loss additive. You win, +25 points. You lost, -25 points. No account for the average MMR of your team against the opposing team. No account for the split between MMRs. Nothing like that.   You can be doing everything right with your character and his role in the match for your team and still have a crushing defeat because of various factors. A lot of these factors are part of the game or any competitive match for that matter, true. However the game demands a lot of you depending on your role in the match. If you fulfill what's required - or rather expected - there is no reward. I have been in countless games both as a carry or support role and have done everything I can and more to push the game in our favor of victory and still lost. This has been both because the other team was better or there were trolls, noobs or inexperienced players on my team.   This system keeps you in an endless rut of bad game after bad game. This is because the lower your MMR drops so does the quality of players you will be matched with. I was just under 3k MMR but have continually dropped down to the point where it's rare to have a good game. I don't mind losing if it was a fun, competitive game. But this ties into the community alot where you have no motivation to keep palying right if there's no reward for it.   -- Addicting Gameplay. Seriously... look at my hours. I hate the players yet I keep going back. What does that say?

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: I love this game.  I've played both Fallout New Vegas and Fallout 3, and there's something about Fallout 3 that just appeals to me much more than New Vegas.  I love the atmosphere in this game, the devastation of the nuclear war really sets its tone to the map covered with ghouls, there's abomination creatures such as Radscorpion and big ♥♥♥ ants.  Whats missing from Fallout 3 is the combat, a lot of the weapons are very inaccurate, such as assault rifles, hunting rifle, laser rifle and all the pistols besides the magnum if you scope.. And that doesn't appeal to me, because I like accuracy weapons, feeling like i'm in control instead of a random spread cone.  You can't use iron sights in this game either, which feels like it should have been there.  The quests are overall fun if you read the messages on computers that goes along with these quests and if you take time to explore and look for hidden loot.  This is the best Fallout in my opinion, but I don't think its better than Skyrim.  Remember that you can mod the sh*t outta this game, so you can eliminate many of these drawbacks.  Have fun, I recommend this. 8/10

Here is the thing with medieval warfare. Its a bad community. I play deadliest warrior - same game mechanic with a better community- a smaller community but a better one, there are less try-hards and more people who just want a laugh, less helecopters. This is a game where you can expect to loose a fight to somebody with more time than you, so dont complain that you cant kill a level 50, he will just be more experienced - THATS WHY HE IS LEVEL 50, but the higher level players will more often than not speak in chat, if you type to them they will probably help you out and make life easier for you and the game more enjoyable. Also I would add that if you gave the dlc the chance it deserves you will find that the helecopters stay in Medieval warfare, deadliest warrior takes the players with more skill over there so you can expect less exploits to be used.   P.S. in the tutorial it will tell you how to block (on medieval warfare) you might want to listen to what they say.

Maaaaaaan some of the people who write these reviews, I swear. 'Game made my CPU fan overheat. 0/10'   Anyway, game is pretty good. The campaign map feels a bit cut back compared to Attila and Rome II. No governers, family tree, can't see the buildings you've constructed in settlements, less buildings to choose from, and settlement battles don't actually take place in the settlement (except for walled cities) - they happen in a field with the settlement in view behind the battle. These are fairly minor things however, and don't impact the game TOO much. More so minor gripes on my behalf :P  But what is lacking on the campaign map is made up in the battles. Units have good weight, larger variety of units to choose from, more complex than 'paper-scissors-rock' etc. The new Lords and Wizard characters make a good addition as well. Lots of RPG elements in how you shape your characters. Factions also feel very varied and unique.

600+ Hours and I still feel like this game could've been better than what it is right now. It's filled with people who exploit the combat system [like me] and reckless noobs who spam LMB. Feinting is a good way to fight but it has been deemed a psycopathic behavior. I know the competitive duelers do it but I'm no fan of feinting. The community is ♥♥♥♥, I guarantee you that. Probably one out of every 500 players is actually helpful while the rest always talk ♥♥♥♥ about each other. Even when you lose a fight against a guy, a usual 'gf' will be uttered but no... the opponent will call you out and say how bad you are. I've been through those so many times it's not even funny. There is no chivalry in this game. 90% of a server's chat history is mainly people dissing each other or politics. The game isn't fun anymore. TDM used to be great when people worked together but now it's segregated to those tryhards, teamkillers, and archers who think sniping from 1000 miles away is still a good idea. There is also a steep learning curve as others have mentioned but it takes a LOOOOOOOONG time to get as skilled as the players you see in the duel servers. The combat is mediocre and is nowhere from realistic. Everything is always split second or drags and feints, sometimes it really is hard to read the ripostes and feints on particular weapons like the holy water sprinkler but that's just due to my lack of judgement. The dev team's updates are lackluster and do small updates at a time rather than large ones. And within those small updates it really hinders gameplay performance at times but I really do approve of finally being able to kick a person on a flight of stairs [and it only took them 3 years to fix that?]. This game always go on sales so don't buy this game at its original price.  I'd still play M&B Warband over this game over any day. And I'm expecting Bannerlord and Mordhau to come out ASAP so I can finally put an end to this burden of a game I play.   So in the short run, if you really want to play this game, go ahead, by all means. But there will be better upcoming indie titles like the ones I mentioned earlier. Just mind the toxic community and expect to get your ♥♥♥ kicked within 3 seconds if you're a new person.

Great game . I have played all the Total War games and this ranks as one of the best. The variety in the game due to the excellent content in the Warhammer universe gives Creative Assembly plenty of units and characters to draw on. The marriage of Total War and Warhammer is a marriage made in heavan. It would be good if they could get the Warhammer 40,000 license too as the Total War engine would work well with that also. Heres hoping.   My only gripe is that unlike the early Total War games they seem to release a half finished game and then charge you a lot of money for the remaining hallf. I do remember the days when you brought a game and did not have to buy endless DLC's which in fairness should be in the game in the first place.

What is this unoptimized mess of a game?!  Low fps on great computers - Check Combat bug exploits - Check Uncaring team to fix all that - Check Toxic community - Check  What. The HELL. Is this?! I bought this game thinking that if Age of Chivalry mod was good - then this game would be even better. Dear god was I wrong.  To go into some detail - the biggest offset is that it runs like a potato. Not ON a potato, mind you. I had 35-40 fps in this on LOWEST settings. I had to download a setting script that made the game look like a bad PS2 game just in order for it to be on 60 FPS without constant stutters and jitters. And my computer ain't bad - I know that. I know that, from the specs and the game features - it is MORE THAN ENOUGH to run this game. But it isn't - because the devs do not know how to optimize for ****. It is a shameless act, especially for the year it was made for (and even to this point).  Alright, so I got past all that. Somehow. So how's the gameplay? It is exactly the same as the free mod! Alright, ALMOST the same. But the gameplay is near identical. Except for there being a couple of bugs in the combat system that a lot of people exploit. The mod has no such problems. So, if I can't enjoy the better graphics (since it runs like crap) and the gameplay is flawed - then why would pick this game instead of the free mod they've released long ago? That mod runs great and has absolutely no problems. The combat is the same. The mod, made many many years ago, is better than this 'full game'. What a joke.  In conclusion: uninstalled it and went back to Age of Chivalry (still has players btw, for a reason). I say don't bother. A lot of potential - but left for dead by the devs. Shame on you devs. For leaving the game unfixed and unoptimized. What a disappointment.

I dont usually write reviews on steam due to how many people do write reviews and write just about the same things as i would however on the day of the release of this game i couldnt help myself but to help this game along on the day of release and give people a true and honest review!  As a non Total War series expert as this is the first Total War game i have played since Total War Medievel 2 i can asure you that this game is everything you would wise for in a game. Amazing textures even when zooming in and out of the map and closer into the battles of the game look amazing. The game is great for everyone new or experienced because of how you can set the difficulty of the campaign and this can be from easy to really difficult.  Everysingle Warhammer fan will find this game interesting and fun to play even if they are not a Total War fan because of the types of units for the different fractions as they all have unique units which all play and operate very differently.   I have also read many reviews on steam about this game before writing my own and honestly i am very shocked to have seen so many people click the thumbs down on the reccomendation option of there reviews due to small and silly things that are causing there gaming experience to not be as enjoyable as the others. alot of the people who gave the game a bad rating/ review are mainly explaining how the game is having technical difficulties and lets be open here, nobody likes technical difficulties espcially not on a game you have pre-purchased and want to play on the release date however things do go wrong and developers do miss things out and this happenes with most games however before giving the game a bad review due to your computer system doesnt meet the requirements or a genuie issue let the support teams help you first!  Overall the game is brilliant and personally well worth the money however not everyone likes the same games and me myself didnt experience any technical issues!!!!!!!!

The thing about goat simulator is that its one of those games that is fun for a little bit and then you never play it again, you find the secrets and thats about it. It isn't really a game its just a simple sandbox that rather than having unlimited fun, it just kind of expires and you're left with nothing. I'd give cheers to the devs for getting new content out there, but the score system isn't enough to make it a game. No one bought goat simulator because they wanted to play it and get a high score, they bought it because they have nothing better to do and on account that the whole game is just a meme. Rather than making the whole game a joke being told over and over again, the developers should try to take an approach similar to Octodad, where the game had a STORY and there was a point of you being there, unlike Goat Simulator which doesn't really have an engaging goal or any story at all. Goat simulator's concept is alright, and it could work for sure, but the execution of it makes it bland and gives it a finite amount of entertainment. If the game was given a factor that made it feel a bit more like a game rather than just a limited sandbox then I might've given the game a positive rating. I realize I'm going to get hate for this practical look at this game based on my experience, and because when people read reviews they want everyone to have the exact same opinion. In conclusion, I rate Goat Simulator a 3/10, I think it just really needs a better pull factor than the score system and the 'memes'.

The relative ease of modability makes it have high replay value.  Of course, as with most Creative Assembly titles, the downside is an unhealthy number of DLCs, some of which should definitely have been part of the core game. Just because your game is a good one doesn't mean you should be charging money for blood and gore effects... that's utterly ridiculous.  I can recommend the game, but I have a hard time doing so when the business practices are what they are...

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: Always a favorite game series of mine. Such a great story line, but also so many side missions and hidden gems along the journey. This plays well on any system, even on my low grade laptop I use for everyday work. The fact that it is also game controller compatible makes it even more enjoyable when you want to get away from the board and mouse gameplay. Thumbs up!

It's short. It's limited. It's not gonna change the face of gaming...  ...but it's entertaining. It's scary, it makes you jump and freak out in the anticipation of jumping. It has some sort of charm to it and it's characters that is rare these days.  It's original, it's freaky, it's cheap, it's challenging, and as I mentioned before (the most important part) fun.  It's just as fun to introduce someone to the game and watch them play it in the dark as it is to play it yourself.  When I try to think of a list of people who would not like this game, I realize they're all kinda lame and not very exciting people, so if you're a fun person who's down to try cool stuff, give this game a go.  DON'T BE LAME.  Thumbs up for Fazbear.

Garbage failed Mount and Blade clone. Anyone supporting this piece of s'hit needs to kill themselves.    Plays like a poor man's version of Mount & Blade. M&B's multiplayer does everything this game does but much better (including having 200 people in a server whilst this allows for a max of 32), except for the limb removal. The poor optimization and insanely bad netcode are also big issues (because of Unreal Engine 3). The biggest fault that I find however is that it doesn't feel like a team-game despite being presented as one. Fighting alongside allies is usually a detriment due to the friendly fire. None of the mechanics of the game encourage players to fight in cohesion or even really work as a team. Everything about the gameplay feels disjointed, like playing a mod of an FPS that never intended to have melee combat in the first place (that may well be how this game started). Also found it funny when I went to customize my knight and noticed 80% of the options are paid DLC as if this were some f2p game; now that's kind of ♥♥♥♥ed up.

I got into this game because I played Warhammer Fantasy for years. I know nothing about the previous Total War games.  I'll recommend it because it's fun and keeps you busy. The Lore is well-represented and the battles are a lot of fun. I've mostly played the campaign, myself, and it has it's ups and downs. The AI will screw you over at every chance it gets, cheesing you out on even the lowest difficulty settings, careful planning and a lot of luck is needed if you want to get a good start.   Near the 40+ turn marker, I find it gets kind of weird, having to defend and recapture settlements over and over again (unless you're playing as Chaos or Beastmen of course) because it's virtually impossible to sustain 20 armies to defend each settlement. This hampers your conquest a ton and gets very repetitive. Especially as someone who favors the Greenskins, the campaign is fun... but seems unnecessarily tedious at some points.  The DLC policy for this game is completely rediculous. Nevertheless, the content it delivers is great. I know the whole 'don't feed the machine, duuuude' crowd will not be pleased but if you're willing to spend the extra cash, it's sort of worth it.  Overall; Good game. Great battles. Well-represented Warhammer lore. Overpriced extra content. The AI's mom can suck ♥♥♥♥♥ in hell.

Total War: Warhammer is one of the best looking Total War games I’ve played. The game runs better than Total War: Attilla does on my moderately powerful gaming PC based on the same settings (high) and averages a fairly smooth forty frames per second with no noticeable drops. The chunky Warhammer characters (reminiscent in style to Dawn of War) suit the Total War graphical style better than I expected them to, and as a result the license feels completely at home in the Total War shell.  In summary, Total War: Warhammer is almost everything I hoped it would be. It is perhaps the best use of the Warhammer license that I’ve ever seen, easily rivalling the Dawn of War series (which is thankfully different enough that I don’t need to decide which is better or worse) and perhaps delivering a game that is dangerously capable of pleasing both Total War and Warhammer fans alike, because of how well it handles the strengths and weaknesses of each. Sure, it’s no longer a case of rewriting world history, and true, trolls can actually be killed in Total War: Warhammer, but the balance of benefits comes together to create a great looking, interesting and often challenge take on large-scale, real-time strategy.

This game has been changing a lot rather quickly. First, you had the Dread Knight, which was the point where lots of players just gave up and stopped trying, like I did. Back then, you had to ascend (Pretty much like prestige, wiping your progress just to get a tiny bonus that keeps stacking the more you keep doing it) over and over again a few times before you were able to get past zone 140 or so, because the price of the Dread Knight was astronomically insane. Lots of us, who hate doing the equivalent of rolling heavy rocks up a hill just to watch them roll down again, just stopped playing here.  After that, they decided to add mercenaries, and my god, this change was amazing. Now, you didn't had to ascend anymore, you could simply send your mercenaries to farm Hero Souls and money, and getting through the zones was pretty much a breeze now. You could also farm those random fish drops in hopes of getting rubies, and you could also send your mercenaries for rubies, too. So, you could skip ascending altogether, just gather enough rubies for a quick ascension, and there you go! I got through zone 200-1800 that way, and it seems like the game was getting a bit too easy, but still, you could finally feel some kind of ♥♥♥♥ing progress.  Then, update 1.0 came. They nerfed lots of ancients, for example, it was quite easy to get Chronos stupidly OP, giving you like an extra 300 seconds for your boss timer if you were an idler like me. They nerfed it so it only gives you around 16 extra seconds or so. But hey! You can level Chronos up now! It's just going to cost you 5 quadrillion souls! For a whooping .22 seconds. So, idling now like in the old days was out of the question. But hey, you could still gather rubies to get another quick ascension, right? Well, yes, but now, there's super ancients basically, that look like Lovecraftian old ones. What's the catch? You HAVE to trASScend to get these, which means you have to wipe your progress. Just ♥♥♥♥ you, you have to wipe your progress if you wanna get far now. And nope, there's nothing you can do to avoid said wipe. So, unless you've got an awful lot of time to spend in this game, getting far is now pretty much a pain in the ♥♥♥. Going from zone 1950 or so all the way back to zone 1 makes me feel like killing myself. And I didn't even got that far compared to other players out there.   This is where I call quits, they just nerfed everything that exists to give you an excuse to grind harder. I know lots of you will love it, and I know I might get lots of hate for my point of view, but that's how I feel at the moment.

You will goat harder than you have ever goated before. If you don't laugh out loud a few times then you are playing something else with no goats in it. I got my goat onto a moving helicopter today. Battle on an epic scale. It's Battlefield x1000. The scale of the map and buildings are beyond words. Much easier to find combat now and lots of good feedback on your performance per life. I'm loving this game now that I have a PC that can run it.   THE GOOD:  Gunplay: Solid and feels good. Weapons have recoil and decent punch to them.  Sound: Sounds like war and ambient sounds are amazing too.  Graphics: If you have a system that can crank this it is simpley breathtaking. From the epic vistas to the all out insane battles for bases this is a nice looking game.  Level Design: Bases cannot be described in words. The shear scale of some of them is awe inspiring (biolab in particular) You'll just have to play it to get it.  Getting 80-110 FPS in ULTRA with my new rig.  SYSTEM SPECS:  5930K at stock 3.5 ghz  EVGA GTX 970 SC  16 GB RAM   Final thoughts......  Wow just wow! Like I said it's Battlefield on a much more epic scale. If you love Battlefield for those 'Battlefield moments' then you should give this a try. Yes it's F2P so it's INSANELY grindy to get new gear. But if you love it dump money in it and get some stuff. I've just been griding it out the hard way but the core gameplay is so much fun I don't mind. I'd say this and Warframe are hands down the TWO BEST F2P GAMES EVER.

Absolutely amazing game. The storyline is a little generic, but who cares? You have a great amount of fun going around and sneakily taking outposts. That, and one of the best things about this game is that you can hunt. It's alot of fun to hunt the more dangerous animals, because they actually pose a threat to you, and you have to be sneaky. Overall, if you're debating on getting this, get it. It's a load of fun in it's sandbox environment.

I used to love the game even with all the issues and bugs it has. But lately as I have played this game a lot these issues are just building up and killing my enjoyment in the game. First of all, you do need somewhat of a good pc to run this game, if you don't you'll be stuck at the loading screen for like 10 mins and on top of that you'll lag like crazy while in game. Then on top of that the game will periodically crash for no reason whatsoever. It can happen while you're in the middle of an intense duel with an enemy or it can happen when you spawn. Either way there's no way to predict when it'll happen. And it doesn't happen rarely it happens somewhat often. When it does happen I need to spend another 3 mins trying to load the game to work. And sometimes you won't even know if the game crashes or not unless you manually go back to your desktop and find the crash window. On top of the crashes there's also a ton of hacks in the game. Some people have unlimited stamina and insane run speed. And they don't seem interested in fixing the hacks or banning accounts that have them. Either way it kills the enjoyment for everyone else that's trying to enjoy the game.   Even with all the bugs and hacks there's also the problem of rank stacking as well. It's when a group of high level players will stack on a team, and these are the people that complain about low ranked servers being in existence. So beginners playing against them will have no chance to learn in a heavily steep learning curve of a game.  If they fixed at least some of the issues i mentioned the game would be immensely better.

I think it is very easy with the Steam review system to recieve an incomplete understanding of how good a game is or isn't. With just a thumbs up or down it is hard for anyone to tell you much about a game. So I would like to break this game down as much as possible to give you are really good source for information.  Firstly lets address the negative reviews that state 'the game is great, I had a lot of fun but **** DLC'. These reviews are not reviewing the game. Ignore them immediatly, there are problems with this game but DLC is an option the problem would only be if the game did not have enough content to begin with.  So lets look at that, what do you get in the base game. The base game gives you 4 races, Empire, Vampire Counts, Dwarfs and Greenskins. The map that you are playing on is set in the Old World of the Warhammer universe. By default all races have 2 legendary lords however through the free updates some have gotten more. Each campaign can take anywhere from 40 to 70 hours to complete. If you consider 1 dollar an hour a pretty good investment this game oozes good value. However if it is **** that would not matter.  Alright so gameplay, this section has to be split into two sections campaign and battle. Starting with campaign this side of the map is a perfect example of 10 steps forward 2 steps back.   Campaign Pros: All cam,paigns FEEL really different Diplomacy is easy to use and understand Stances are all useful and feel intuitive Visuals are beautiful Cities changing to match faction is an amazing addition Economy is limited forcing players to actually make desicions when building armies  Campaign Cons: Regional Occupation (The concept that only certain races can occupy certain cities, terrible idea) Movement in your land is same speed as enemy causing annoying chases through your land Though cities due change when upgraded it is very hard to see the difference unlike Attila or Rome 2  Onto battles, the battles stay mainly the same from previous games with the addition of crazy new units to spice it up. The Ai is also much improved. You can tell a ton of work went into making these great. However the games keep pushing towards smaller maps and faster battles which may have gone a little to far in this one.  Battle Pros: AI (it can actually put up a good fight) Diversity Magic Visuals Custimizable UI (Bound to space bar) Nice additions to control make it easy to move army Impacts are greatly improved  Battle Cons: No blood (Maybe I'm just messed up) Lack of kill animations (understand the point of removing the match combat of older games however a system like Dawn of War where when they go to kill an enemy it plays a combat animation would have been nice) Maps are very small Battles are very short (5 minutes - 8 minutes)  Lastly we need to discuss seiges and the lack of battle diversity in terms of types. Total War Warhammer features two battle types, seige and land battles, no minor settlement battles, no fort battles and no naval battles (not so salty about the last)  Seige Pros: The first few feel epic Art is beautiful  Seige Cons: Single or double wall leaves zero strategy Entire battle is spent watching your troops slowly try to break past theirs Infinite tower range makes artillery useless Only feels like there are 5 different maps Different factions have the same settlements with different art Dwarfs are the most dissapointing as if you want their trailer it shows multi tiered setlements  In conclussion, Total War Warhammer improves on much and gives you a ton of value for the money you are spending, even without mods or DLC. Some of the issues I have mentioned can be fixed with mods. With the game all moded out like mine is the only issue I still see are that seige battles are dull and lack strategy. Other than that this game is amazing and if you love TW like I do this is a breath of fresh air into a very old franchise.

When you first join Planetside 2 it seems just like any other shooter, but when you get away from the initial base and into a fight you can really see the amazing difference. Planetside 2 features thousands of players per map, and there are 3 maps per server that you can warp between (it also features a training are where you can test guns and other gear before you purchase them and lets you practice with no cooldown on vehicles or respawn timer as well as practicing in a friendly enviroment where your not getting shot at). And it does this with almost no lag i have only lagged a tiny bit, and iv played almost 100 hours, and they are working on getting rid of that tiny bit of lag that happens when the servers get super full. I absolutely love this game, its so amazing instead of being like all those other generic shooters you cant learn where everybody sits an waits, camping doesnt work so well. you have massive maps to fight on. you really have to stratigize and work with your teamates. there are three factions to pick from. You can do basicly anything you want, drive tanks, humvee's, atv's dropships, gunships whatever, the possibilities are endless. the classes are so easy to customize to your unique play style whatever that may be. Do you want to sit back and snipe, lay down heavy fire, heal your buddies? doesnt matter there is a class for you and if the fit isnt perfect, you can customize even further. Honestly i dont think this game will ever get old, and i really think that even as great as it is, its only going to get better. the realism is amazing. and as a plus if your parents are against M games, dont worry you can still play. I love how you cant just rush the enemy base you have to work together with other squads, your tanks, and of course your air support. No matter what you want to do, there is something here for you, and dont get discouraged if you die, this is war it happens.   My advice for new players is first find your class, then play with some other more experienced players. keep your head down till you get more experience and never give up.

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: My first experience with an open-ended RPG was with Morrowind. I thought it sucked. This is the same type of game, and it's one of my all-time favorites. A great, atmospheric and desolate world to explore, plenty of stories shown in the environment and in sidequests, exploring the concrete jungle of the downtown district is seldom tiring, and the main plot is pretty engorssing, too, even if the characters are a little forgettable (oddly enough, New Vegas is just the reverse). The gunplay is a little stiff, I admit, but fortunately it's not the focus. That's on the lonesome exploration and discovery, which rarely disappoints. Just pick a direction and start walking; ever time you do will be quite different.

Some facts about this game:  It takes about 100hrs before you are a noob, before that you are essentially worthless. I'm not exaggerating. It will take at least 100hrs before you feel good enough to say you 'know the basics.' This game is not fun without friends - seriously - everyone agrees you need teammates you know to enjoy learning the ropes. This game is a masterpiece. I cannot recommend this game - losing is so infuriating and crushing that you'll sit down to relax, play a game, then an hour has gone by and you are angrier than you ever could've imagined. This game is a time vampire, and it isn't worth it for the 50% chance of gratification in my opinion.

I really can't believe how bad this game is due to other reviews of it. Very tired of Ubisoft formula. SCORE 41/100.  I thought it just had to be cool. I was let down in nearly every way imaginable. Still shocked how subpar, derivative, repetitive, and poorly designed it was. After beating and selling Watch Dogs (PS4), and then getting this on Summer Sale and really not liking it at all, I came to the conclusion I will no longer buy the trinity of Ubisoft open world action games.   If you have played any Assassin's Creed or Watch Dogs, then you've played this. Towers to unlock, stupid collectibles, incredibly poor stealth, no actual cover.  TOWERS ARE SO FAR APART, horrible when you die. This is a perfect example of huge open world that is empty, lifeless, and annoying. So, so annoying.  Inventory is an atrocity, fills up in minutes, herbs don't stack. The driving is even worse than Watch Dogs, if that is possible. You get hurt from very small jumps, it's stupid.  In some ways I am glad I got it on summer sale because I won't ever get another Ubisoft game at full price. I *might* get them for 10 bucks or buy and resell of the PS4, but never ever full price.  And the graphics aren't that great, because Ubisoft is really bad at optimizing game engines. Tomb Raider and Hitman Absolution look much better.  To top it all off, UPLAY IS A NIGHTMARE. It's a terrible service that makes EA's Origin look fantastic in comparison, and that is saying a lot.

Oh the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, where to begin. A low ping is actually a DISADVANTAGE because of client side hit detection with no latency limit. Your enemy will put 10 bullets into you and it will show up as a single hit on your machine, giving you no chance to react. Oh, but it'll require you to fire for a solid second to kill them back.  Rockets actually move SLOWER THAN VEHICLES! This is even more dumb once you find out it takes literally 5 seconds to reload, and your entire pool of 5 rockets will generally only serve to annoy weaker vehicles. And if you actually do manage to scuff the paint on your target? They'll just back up and repair it in a few seconds anyway.  They gave a class invisibility and did no better a job of balancing such a broken mechanic than every multiplayer game that's attempted it before.  There are pistols and submachine guns that are stronger than machine guns. 1 hit kill weapons in a high TTK game.  The game includes auto-run not because it's convenient, but because it's necessary. In other words, prepare to spend a lot of time running between battles.  I have never been in a game where the terrain was so awful to navigate. So many random impassible ravines, mountains, rivers, etc. Why? Because ♥♥♥♥ you! Bases are also a pain to navigate due to random walls and obstacles placed with no apparent rhyme or reason. When every building is the same (not looks similar, literally is the same), it adds to the confusion about where exactly you are at any given point in time. Of course, that's if you can even find your way into the base in the first place. Many have walls for days with only a few entrances in seemingly random locations.  Bio-labs are an endless cluster♥♥♥♥ meatgrinder. Imagine BF3 metro with walking tanks and a much longer walk back for the attackers.  The developer also has a poor track record of dealing with hackers and exploiters. There are some still exploiting their hearts out 9+ months after video evidence first surfaced of their misdeeds.  This game is just rife with bad design and technical flaws that makes things vastly more infuriating than fun. Stay far, far away. An alternative you might try is Heroes & Generals. That game at least has server side hit detection and infantry can do more than tickle tanks.
Holy crap this game is everything I wanted Far Cry to be. It's got satisfying combat, a solid stealth mechanic, and no stupid Trigens. What it DOES have is DIE ANTWOORD.

I don't think I have ever played something more exciting in my life.  PlanetSide 2 is an online, open world FPS game. You get to pick from one of three 'clans' and fight for control of different planets in real time. It's a constant battle that never ends, and the world is enourmous.  When you first jump in, the tutorial is there and it does an amazing job of teaching you the ins and outs of PS2, and my god, is this game ever well made. Everything frrom classes to vehicles, ground and air, are there for you to use.  The community is also amazing. Full of helpful people who wish to fight for whatever clan they chose to play for in the war, and the medics are never hesitant to help you out, nor are the engineers ever hesitant to hand you some ammo. Everyone in my experience was polite and fun to play with.  The game, performance wise, is quite demanding. Considering you are playing online with up to hundreds of other players and everyone is shooting at eachother and blowing ♥♥♥♥ up. But even still, the game looks amazing on its best graphic setting, if your pc can handle it, that is.  You would think complete open world warfare would be chaotic, but the facilities and areas of the map are designed in such a way that tactics can be planned and executed on enemy clans easily. The game is very easy to understand and insanely fun to play.  Overall, it's one of the best free to play games out there, especially since its loaded with content and has a huge amount of things to do within it. Don't hesitate to try it out, it certainly is worth it. 10/10.

How to Accept Your Autism  Being autistic can be rough. People tell you that you're embarrassing, that you're rude or insensitive, or that you're a puzzle that needs to be completed in order to be whole. But that doesn't mean that they're right. This article will help you come to terms with your autism so you can focus on being the wonderful human being that you are.  Meet the autistic community. This can be done by contacting a friendly support group, or through a search online. Learn what autistic people have to say about themselves, their symptoms, and the way they interact with the world. Autistic people in general are very welcoming to newly-diagnosed or self-diagnosed people. Autistic people can offer advice and tips to those in need (and often do so, especially online) The general positivity of the autism community can help you feel better when you are feeling sad or have low self-esteem.  Read about the strengths that come along with autism. Autism is a complex neurological condition that comes with several blessings along with its impairments: Deeply passionate interests. These can lead to tremendous expertise, and a very successful career.[1] Helpfulness. Autistic people in general have a high sense of social responsibility, or the desire to solve problems and help others.[2] Precision. Autism is often noted to lead to focusing on small parts, rather than the big picture. This can lead to remarkable detail-oriented work, where a neurotypical might be unable to focus so clearly on individual aspects of something.[3] Visual intelligence. Autistic people have tested higher on visual and nonverbal intelligence tests.[4] Sincerity. Autistic people tend to mean what they say, and act as a 'voice of reason' without becoming mired in social complexities.[5] Your honesty and genuine spirit can feel refreshing to others. A unique perspective. Autistic people can learn in unusual ways.[6] This provides insights that neurotypicals may never realize, and can become a great asset in collaboration.  Find therapies and treatments that work for you. These will help you work on your weaknesses so that you feel more comfortable and happy. You can also learn coping mechanisms, alternative methods of doing difficult tasks, and how to capitalize on your strengths. Options include sensory integration therapy, seeing an autism expert (for coping strategies), occupational therapy, special diets in case you are allergic or sensitive to something, behavior therapy, and seeing a psychologist for emotional issues. Always check with a doctor before altering your diet or attempting an alternative treatment. Be careful about behavior therapies. Some therapies are based on compliance and may hurt more than helping.[7] If your therapist's goal is to make you more normal (rather than more comfortable or more competent), or if you feel upset and anxious about seeing them, then find a better therapist.  Make autistic friends. Along with the usual benefits of friendship, you can share coping strategies, discuss autism together, and be yourselves without any fear of repercussions.  Read about successful autistic people. Plenty of famous people have been diagnosed or thought to be autistic. Historically, Einstein,[8] Thomas Jefferson, Emily Dickinson,[9] Mozart,[10] and more people were thought to be autistic.[11] Famous autistic people today include Tim Burton,[12] Susan Boyle,[13] Adam Young (from Owl City),[14] Jerry Seinfeld,[15] and more.[16]  Focus on your skills and character strengths. This will help you spend less energy mourning your disability, and more energy on doing positive things and enjoying your life. Spend time on your hobbies and things that you're good at. Enjoy the feeling of competence and expertise. Make a list of your positive traits. Consider both personality traits and skills. Place the list somewhere where it'll be easy to see when you're feeling sad about yourself. Help other people. Prepare food for the hungry, raise awareness for important causes, or volunteer for online projects like wikiHow. Effecting a positive change in the world will distract you, help others, and make you feel happier about yourself.  Avoid people and organizations that dehumanize you. You are not broken or lesser. People like you do not deserve to be abused, coerced, silenced, or eugenically aborted. It is okay to cut toxic people out of your life. You don't need their negativity, and you're much better off without them. You are not required to argue that your existence is worthwhile, and it's okay to decide not to waste your time and energy on them. If you're stuck with these people, you have two main choices: to educate them, or to avoid them. Educating them can be done by showing them an article, and making an appeal to their desire to be a good person. If you try this and fail, or if you know that they won't respond to reason, it's better to avoid spending time with them, and avoid autism-related conversations. You don't deserve to listen to toxic ideas about your existence.  Practice self-care. Being disabled can be difficult, and it's important to treat yourself well. Cut out energy drains from your life so you can focus on what matters most to you. Pushing yourself to meet neurotypical standards will only take a toll on your health. It is okay to ask for academic accommodations, take extra breaks, or quit doing things that are too stressful to achieve. Pay extra attention to general health advice: sleep for at least 8 hours, eat fruits and vegetables, limit junk food, minimize stress, and exercise regularly (taking walks counts). Self-care is extra important for you, to mitigate stress and help with meltdowns. If you have trouble with self-care, it's okay to ask for help. Assisted living, a group home, or living with your parents might be better for you. Talk with a doctor, social worker, or therapist if you're struggling. There's no shame in meeting your needs, and it'll free up time for things you love.  Stop apologizing for being autistic. You have the right to ask for accommodations, stim in public, and do what you need to do in order to function. Toning down your behavior is your choice—not something to be pushed or coerced out of you. You are not required to act more neurotypical just because everyone else is used to it.  Get involved with positive autism-related organizations. They will help you understand yourself better and make a positive contribution to the world. Many autism self-advocacy groups have a large online presence. You do not need to physically go somewhere in order to get involved.  Recognize that autism is just a thing of your imagination. People can not love you and your autism. You are a lesser person for it.

7.00 is here, and its a blast. For sure I cannot say 100% if in the end the gameplay will be better or worse, and that because unlike some creatures of habit that feel their world come crushing down on them before even trying to learn the new changes, I will put more time into it to make a better judegement. For that reason alone no-one should take any of the hating seriously. Some people actually played 1 match in the new patch then quit. Wha? How can you know if it is better or worse like that?  All I can say is what I do like about it so far.  I like the direction of talents. They do not change a hero drastically like I feared, and got rid of the useless attributes.  UI is great, minimal and out of your face giving better vision which is always important in a competitive game and something that alays bugged me.  New map layout needs more playtime to be get a proper review from me, but so far I was able to jump into it and learn it quite fast. Shop locations are now FINALY balanced without the dire having to go to the moon for it (yeah, those few extra steps count guys), Roshan is no longer cheeply contested with dire jungle next to him and a river now surrounds him, and more jungles are added to up the importance of jngling.  The biggest changes are the shrines and the new bounty locations. This all is a step closer to PROPER jungling which was sorely lacking in this game. All it was thus far was go from camp to camp and rinse and repeat. Added bounty has also made jungling a more viable strategy, very much needed, and jungle control has now also become more important thus map control.  To compensate for some of these changes shrines add replenish locations closer to the lanes, allowing for better laning, and also a defensive strategy when need be against either ganks or bounty hunters in your jungle (no pun intended, lol).  Shrines also create for a better defence around the ancient.  Small additions like 3 slot bag and courier options are also much appreceated (you can now see who had called it before you and send it back, or alter the route of the courier, then continue its path to said player).  In general the patch is great, and it did not simplify the game neither LoL-ish it. It added much needed depth and gameplay in areas that were trully lacking. Jungling. Jungling in this game was really behind compared to other moba titles in the compatition.  And for all those saying why would they make it like LoL. They didn't, they are adding improvements most moba games already have. You don't evolve wih the genre you die out, simple, and there were elements in Dota2 that were lacking.  Given time, I can bet most of the haters will love the new patch. Except for the pretentious ones that are stuck in the notion that this is becoming like LoL and feel this is a bad thing.  Neither is true. Dota 2 is still dota 2. Adding elements increases depth, nothing was taken away, and the pace of the game was greatly improved. The layers to new strategy have now become a lot more, and people are simply frantically rushing about trying to learn it hence not happy about old tricks not working.  That is called a habit. Competitve games can do without that tyvm.  Definately recommend this title, still to this day.

If you're looking for a medieval game with competetive multiplayer, realistic mechanics, beautiful graphics, balanced classes including archer and knight... then you better look somewhere else. If you're thinking that this game has realistic combat you obviously didn't play it. Chivalry Medieval Warfare is a game that makes you wanna smash your PC with a 2-handed hammer (with nice skin for 5 $) and then throw it out of the window.   I bought this game on sale and i thought I'd get realistic combat. What I actually got was a bunch of knights making crazy-♥♥♥ tricks with swords, archers with daggers faster than light ( spam2win), and dudes killing you with their bare fists. No joking. In this game a knight with full-set plate armor can be fisted (you could expect this joke) to death. Also if you're thinking that archer can't parry/block a massive 2-handed warhammer that in reality could smash through a brick wall, your computer and your first born son you're right. It can't. In reality. In this game it's actually possible.  But it doesn't matter that this game is awful. It's not bad and can be very enjoyable if you can hold on your nerves. If it's not the realism you're looking for you'll probably like it. I, unfortunately, bought this game hoping I'd get realism. And although I enjoyed playing it I can't really recommend it.   This game had a huge potential, but unfortunately for me (and some others) this game was a disappointment. Pretty much like me for my parents, I should be learning but instead I'm writing about a game I don't even like. Gotta end this here. If i helped you in any possible way, please send me a letter so I can show my parents I'm not a useless piece of ♥♥♥♥. If you read the whole text, thank you and please - make a right decision, whether you're buying or not.

Dota 2 is a real-time strategy game in the sub-genre called MOBA (multiplayer online battle arena). It is a direct sequel to the popular Warcraft 3 Modification. This game has been picked up by Valve corporations and is being worked on by none other than one of the original creators of the Warcraft 3 Modification. After its official launch on the 9th July 2013 it has been a massive hit in the MOBA genre. With it being the number one game on the free to play list on steam and arguably being on par with the largest contender on the MOBA market - League Of Legends.   The game corporates a large roster of playable heroes which are instantly available with gameplay which can offer ten times the amount of strategy and depth compared to any other game on the MOBA market. This combined with players who are working on the game for other players and the fact that the game is trademarked by steam. Dota 2 also has a large competitive scene including the annual “The International Tournament” held by steam.  I totally recommend Dota 2 to anyone with a computer. The ability to play casually or professionally with your friends really is awesome! xD 94/100 -Dom

My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.' Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through.' I agreed. At 19, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: Bethesda Game Studios knows how to make a time-consuming game. Fallout 3 is one of the few games that I can play for 5 hours and feel like I've only played for a half hour. The main story line is somewhat linear compared to other aspects of the game, but I'm not the type of person that's bothered by that. There are countless side quests that don't feel like pointless tasks as side quests do in many games that I've experienced.   The only real complaint that I have, if any, is that the use of V.A.T.S. is a MUST in order to survive the wasteland well. The game doesn't FORCE you to use the system, however. If you can afford to spend the extra ammo, there's nothing stopping you from running into a horde of super mutants, guns ablazin'.  A word of caution to those running Windows 7: MAKE SURE YOU SAVE PERIODICALLY WHEN ROAMING THE VAST LANDSCAPE. Fallout 3 has a wonderful autosave feature, but even that might not save you if the game crashes on you. There are several articles for Win7 fixes for Fallout 3, but even those don't solve 100% of problems.  Other than the lack of Windows 7 optimization, this game is incredible. 10/10  (Get hyped for Fallout 4!)

TL;DR: Have you ever worked on something where no matter what you did, it would reset, and you spent days doing the exact same step over and over praying that it'd make progress but it never seemed to? PS2 is like that except there's no hope of moving forward.   I've been trying to play PlanetSide 2 for a long time, but now I've finally got my chance, since my computer is now decent. I cannot fault the action or character progression. Both are amazing.  Character progressions is the standard unlock/upgrade with mods system, with boosts only being enough that you'd win a one on one fight, and slow enough that it provides interest in continuing to play.   One on one fights sound like a lot? I can see that, in pretty much any other FPS. In this game, if you're getting into 1 on 1 fights, you're playing so wrong. The game gives you a maximum snipe range of 1,000 meters (but I've only been able to get reasonable kills at 500 meters with the assault rifles). The long range combat is incredible.  That's not to say one on one fights are unsupported. There's a class designed for it, Light Assault, which has a jetpack to allow you to sneak ontop of your targets.  This game has mixed arms combat. As in, the tanks, aircraft, and infantry all have to fight the same battle on the same map, and you can destroy tanks as infantry, or aircraft as a tank, and ect. This creates an epic feeling when you shoot a rocketeer with a rifle and kill them before they can take out a friendly tank.  So, why don't I recommend this game? Staff abuse? Rude community? Just angry that I'm no good at it?  No. I don't recommend this game... Because there is no win or lose state.  Seeing as there is only 4 maps in the game, that are all going at once, they don't want players to take over a map and lock their enemy out of that map, as that might make their enemy have a less fun experience. I can agree and see that. it'd probably be very common for a faction to get wiped off all maps and thereby prevent their spawning.   If the game had several maps, it'd be near impossible for a faction to get wiped off of all of them, and even then, they could swap to another map.    They don't want to do this. Instead, the way the game works is only 2 of the 4 continents in the game can be controlled at once. If another gets taken, it'll unlock one of the previous maps.  So the entire game is just a constant struggle where no one will ever be ahead or behind.   I wouldn't be too upset about this except every thread online I can find about it has people DEFENDING this choice as if it's a good idea!!   It's not a good idea. It's putting a bandaid over a missing arm.  That said, the gameplay is fun. If you're 12 years old and like brainlessly shooting people for no reason, it's a good alternative to school shootings.  3/10

I have a few hundred hours in this game but just ported it to steam so it doesn't seem like I have a lot of experience but I do. First off for this game, if you want a worthwhile tutorial, then you won't get one. This game is the hardest game to pick up that I've ever seen because you feel so insignificant and under powered compared to everyone else. This is horrible for keeping players. If you pick this game up I reccomend going on Youtube and watching a channel called Wrel. He is very good for new player tutorials and helped me become the (meh) player I am today. The game itself is absolutely beautiful at night and in big battles. The infantry gameplay is fun with 6 main classes. Light Assaults, they have jetpacks and close quarter carbines, Infiltrators, the snipers and stealthy class of the game, Heavy Assault, with rocket launchers and an overshield to absorb damage, Medics, they can revive people, Engineers, they give ammo and can repair Max's and place turrets, and finally MAX units. They are walking tanks of death that are extremely hard to take down but are slow and can easily be killed by C4. These classes make each battle unique and can actually make for some really interesting strategy's. The vehicles are nice and have a depth of custimization, like the infantry. Over all this is the best FPS out there, while being free and without Pay to Win.

Huge Battles, Tons of Vehicles, Huge Maps, Great Graphics and its *FREE* Whats not to like?  2016 Update: With the addition of the construction system, Planetside 2 now allows players to build bases and generate Victory Points that help lead to your faction to winning the continent. This both allows players to fortify location and creates an epic vehicle meta. To destory a well fortified player-made base massive groups of armor and infantry come together to make a truely EPIC spectical and shows what Planetside has to offer.  The UI has been though several revisions and now allows players to pick from a drop down menu in the settings which they prefer.  Planetside 2 has so much to offer to players that there really should be something everyone can find and enjoy. If you enjoy tank warfare then pull tanks, if you like building bases pull the new ANT and mine resources, if you like dogfights and air to ground combat pull a ESF, if you like infantry there are several classes to pick from that have unique playstyles and roles. There are support classes for infantry like medic and engineer, support classes for ground vehicles like ammo and repair sundys, there are even support roles in the air like the massive galaxy transport that can be modified to act as a air ammo resupply.  ____________________________________  Pros:  -Free 2 Play -Combined Arms -Player Made Bases -UI options -Grand Scale -No Matchmaking -3 Factions with different weapons can allow for a re-freshed experiance by trying another faction.  Cons:  -CPU intensive -Poor Tutorial (Youtube tutorials are recommended) -Can be hard to know where to go when playing alone -All players new and experianced on same field (experianced players know alot more about the map and how to deal with different situations)  ____________________________________  In the end Planetside is coming up on its 4 year anniversary and is still here. Developers are active on  reddit.com/r/planetside  on a daily basis and engage with the community.  I HIGHLY recommend this game.

Holy ♥♥♥♥, this game is good.  What it lacks in occasional polish and poor storyline (and _abysmal_ voice acting. Those accents *can't* be real...) It more than makes up for in charm.  Well, not the voice acting, someone should go to jail for that.  It's fun, visceral (often gruesomely so), and pretty even money, since the blocking mechanics are a bit twitchy and all the weapons hit with so much heft, even classically poor players of FPS-type games like this will find their K/D ratio pleasantly high (Mine was better than one for a while, which is rare for me).   It's not without bugs, but if you can get past the mislabelled key tooltips and occasional glitchy display, it's really fun. Definitely a game a group of people to cause a lot of trouble playing whilst drunk on a friday night. Any level of coordination would be devestating, fortunately, coordination never happens in pugs, so otherwise it's just gory medieval fun.
