Chivalry is a first-person fighting game (FFG?) built around close-range melee combat, with a smattering of archery. It never loses sight of the fact that, fancy moves or no, getting personal is a messy business. Heads, legs and arms fly by the dozen in every match, a feature made approximately ten billion times better by the fact that you can further de-limb opponents as they stare in shock at the first mortal blow. There is nothing quite like hacking someone's arm off, then executing a swift and true beheading as they stare open-mouthed at the stump.The gratuitous brutality of knightly melee combat teeters between comedic and cathartic in Chivalry: Medieval Warfare's gory encounters. Well-placed killing blows send limbs and heads flying, accompanied by fountains of blood spewing from drippy stumps that call to mind the iconic Black Knight duel in Monty Python and the Holy Grail. It's hilarious at times and excessively gruesome. Gutting foes has a lot more weight to it here than in other recent entries in the Medieval combat genre like War of the Roses or Mount and Blade: Warband. That alone doesn't make Chivalry the best in its class, but it does incite a certain bloodlust that'll keep you charging into the chaos.

What can I say about Far Cry 3? The game is pretty. That is the only good thing I have to say about this game.  The following review may contain spoilers!!! You've been warned!!! You start Far cry 3 and the first thing you notice is how great everything looks and you think to yourself 'This is gonna be great'. Since this is a game that lets you free roam you do the first storyline mission, maybe two and then you just go explore. The problem with exploring is there really isn't anything to explore. You have to liberate the radio tower in an area to unlock the map and then you get 2-3 camps to liberate to remove enemy soldiers from the area. The only other thing to do is find all the collectible crap that might unlock signature weapons but mostly is just there to keep the OCD people playing until they complete 100%. Everything that was fun or interesting about the game was over by the time I finished the first island. The second island in the game was not fun at all and contains pretty much every crappy gimmick that has been put into video games in the past decade. Seriously timed button presses, mini games, and poorly made rail shooters. I only completed the storyline missions on the second island just so I could finish the game. It wasn't fun, interesting, or engaging. It seems like they knew their game was bad so they decided to make you have to jump through hoops to unlock literally everything in the game. You have to unlock the map, the weapons, extra weapon slots, extra ammo slots, all the skills, literally everything. Nothing in this game happens without you performing some kind of grind. This isn’t fun, what happened to the days when games were fun?

Beware, it's not a 'medieval combat simulator' despite it may look like one. Game mechanics needs some serious fixing. If you are looking for such game - this one is not your choice. Chivalry is still full of bugs and glitches that many players use. This game is not a 'game skill' contest, it's 'glitch masters' contest. The one that knows most of game mechaincs bugs wins. Glitched dragging, ground sniffering, abnormal character moves etc. is what give you advantage over enemies, not your game skills. ag You do not have to learn the game by playing, just go learn all this stuff that rakes game mechanics, it's all on youtube. And those who use it consider it as a 'skill' and devs do nothing about that. So if you like to enter 'who's more effective bug user' contest that's your game. If you are looking for fair medieval fights with honored knights in realistic atmospehere - wait till another game releases. Chivalry is not such a game.

Good fun, can be slightly addictive. Absolutely huge and plenty of options for just mucking about. You will die a lot but so does everyone else. The videos pretty much show it all. Aircraft, vehicles, huge battles. LOTS of explosions and the chance to make it not a fair fight all the time, providing you're sneaky enough. It can be a bit buggy, and sometimes the the servers will lag to the point where it's just unplayable but they're usually back to normal in an hour but tbh that sort of stuff should be taken as a given considering i don't know another game like this that takes place on this sort of scale.  Edit: i have since found that the lagging (actually desyncng) is fixed if i disconnect my laptop (only my laptop other laptops work fine alongside with it) from the wifi. Also after a planned patch update it might be worth not playing for a day or two, because the patches always mess up the logging in and usually break something (like sticking at 96/98% on the loading screen). For a free game it's a great FPS, I can get a bit grindy but the stock weapons are fine for new players (tend to be midranged weapons) and if you feel you're grinding you're probably not playing the game right as the point of games is to have fun, not to feel like work. Also the lack of tutorial (or at least the basicness of it) is rather poor, so for the first few hour's you'll be dying a lot more than you will once you've found your feet but after about 5 or so hour's you'll get used to it. If you want a complete mincer of a fight that's safeish from vehicles go to a biolab fight. You'll still die a lot but you'll get some kills and remember to try stuff in the VR (it's an option at the bottom of the continent change interface). Find a good outfit and fight with them.

Having played 16 hours now, I will review. Chivalry is a pretty cool game but it has its ups and downs. Having unlocked nearly all of the weapons in 16 hrs of game play I am pretty much bored and done with it for now. So here are some pros/cons/and suggestions for future games of this type.  Pros: - The concept is amazing.  -The team objective modes are the best part of this game and the only reason I keep playing. It is super fun and brilliant. Could be expanded upon more though. - The way the weapon system works and unlocking of weapons is smart and a good way to keep people playing and motivated to get better at the game.  -War cry button = awesome -team damage counter and ability to kick out people that keep team killing is a good feature - good diversity of class/weapon types   Cons: -No female characters.  -Limited costume options. -maps and characters limited to medieval Europe.  - armor difference between vanguard and the knight isn't significantly noticeable.  - Some melee weapon ranges are off. Have received damage from weapons that havent actual come in contact with my character.  -lastly, and simply from the perspective of someone who makes historical recreations of medieval plate armor in steel... some of the costumes are not really very historically accurate. But you can see where some, even small degree, of effort was applied here and that is commendable.   Suggestions: - Add more than just medieval Europe. This creates more diversity of character/weapon types and maps. Middle eastern fighters, Chinese, Japanese, Korean, etc. All of these areas where in some degree of contact at the time and would add a great deal of diversity to game play.  - My last suggestion would be to strive for more historical accuracy, especially in a game that seems to be trying to avoid being a fantasy game. The more realistic you can make such a thing the more truly amazing it will be. The only counter suggestion to this is adding female characters. There are a large number of female gamers and they need to be included. I have tried to get a few of my female gamer friends to play with me and they have refused because there is not character to represent them in the game. All and all, awesome work! Make another one :)

DotA is the bizzare lovechild of several concepts. It sinks its psychological hooks so deep into you so insidiously that you don't even notice, in an example of conditioning that makes World of Warcraft look like childrens television. You are connected to a slot machine that costs no money to play, only time - the only catch being that each attempt takes 30 minutes to an hour and only after 10 or so minutes do you begin to have an idea of just how the experience will end. This is where the hell of DotA begins. Every damn time I press that  Play Game  button I think to myself,  Oh, i'll have a nice, good fun game that will take me at most, 30 minutes .   Each time, I couldn't be more wrong   Playing DotA is the reminiscient of being thrown into a group discussion at school. Except the people in your group are sociopathic, narcissistic monsters who will attack you at the first sign of weakness. I am fairly certain that a large portion of the players in DotA are actually hired by scientists who are trying to see if it is possible to create sustainable energy through human misery and anger. DotA players seem to be able to perform mental acrobatics that chinese professional gymnasts dream of each night. They simulatiously except your team to perform feats of teamwork that not even trained Russian professionals can pull off, while playing slightly better then a catatonic chicken. These people are horrible, horrible people, second only to /b/ trolls and parking inspectors.  And when you finally do meet good people and finally do have good games, these moments seem to somehow become engraved in your brain as how your percive DotA. The fantastic, jaw dropping moments that seem to rise you above the dregs of humanity seem to occur as frequently as saints coming down into the mortal world. Valve somehow has engineered these miracles to occur (Which I think might be proof of the divine), only to corrupt it into some sort of heroin-like substance that is delivered through spending a copius amount of time sitting in front of a monitor. The highs in DotA are brief, momentary glimpses of something beyond our understanding, in which we are shown just how frail we are in our day-to-day existence.  As for the social aspect of this game, don't bother. Before too long, you too will turn into one of those awful hunched over denizens that shuffle along the virtual pathways of the game, desperately hoping to find others who will help you overcome a game. Because playing with so-called  friends  turns DotA from a brief stroll through a mysterious wasteland into a grind that makes the most mindnumbing job seem free spirited and joyful. Playing DotA in a team is the equivalent of dropping out of school and joining a gang in order to make it in the world. You go from being tossed along the current with things out of your control to being surrounded by people at the first sign, will drop you for another who seems slightly more put together. Playing DotA with friends will drop you into a  Lord of the Flies -esq setting, in which you will be fighting with you fellow man just to make it in the world. Everything you ever knew and loved will slowly decay and turn to dust as you force yourself to get further and further ahead, while slipping further and further behind.  In short, 7/10, play with your friends or not at all.

PS2 is awesome in a way that BF and CoD is not, since there're no sessions, up to 2000 players possible in one battle (greatest battle so far: 442 players), and the teamwork and coordination needed to win a battle. Although there is a somewhat lack of content, which isn't the case in BF or CoD, more will come and the players have more influence on this content than the players of BF and CoD can atm...   My recommendation for all new players is to join an Outfit (Guild), since you get into the game mechanics and the social structure faster this way. And for European players, you need to join in at ProSieben Sat1 Games to play in Europe.   P.S. The game is undergoing performance updates at this time, so gamers with lower spec PCs can join the fight. Furthermore, it is coming as an F2P on PS4 (NO subscription to PS+ required for MP) in 2014.

I don't remember how much I paid for Goat Simulator, but thinking about it now, it was too much. This game really should be $1 or free/pay-what-you-will. If you are a fan of Tony Hawk Pro Skater, you will probably get about 1 hour or less of entertainment from Goat Simulator. I have 3.2 hrs played, and It probably will never get above 3.5. The levels are very small, and you can run around each one in a minute or two. The only objective in the game is to destroy things and cause mayhem, getting points and combos which unlock new 'goats' and new goat powers which you can optionally turn on. These new goats and powers only add the slightest amount of variety, as the level you are in has all the same things to interact with that it already did. I imagine that you would need a very short attention span to enjoy this, because literally all you can do in the game is headbutt and flail around, its fun for about 10 minutes, and then if youre really bored you go around the level to find the numerous buggy and glitchy 'easter eggs', which are really the only content. These do not accomplish anything in adding to the game, its the old makeup on a pig.  To sum it up, its a joke that is probably funniest when you see a video of someone play it, the fun level only goes down from there, it feels like something I should not have paid for.

***DISCLAMER: I think the game is fantastic overall and I am a huge fan of the entire total war series. That said I would not recomend buying this game until it is on sale for at least 50% off*****   Buying this game is like buying a puzzle that only came with a third of its pieces while the remaining two thirds of its pieces being kept behind various pay walls. I feel the need to discourage buying this game for full price is because I cant justify the utter lack of content in the base game. Rather than ranting I will just list my complaints:  * $60 for 4 races with a 5th if you ordered early. (Even if you factor in the fact that each race has a different look for every unit and a different play style that shouldnt justify the utter content drought, and especialy not ~$20 race DLC's.)  *A DLC sized Campaigne map. (I get that the warhammer world is huge, but why does that justify makeing the game a trilogy. Why not just give a bit of fan service and put the whole world in from the base game, and if you must have DLC's then make unique senarios.   *Expencive DLC's which offer features that should have been in the base game. (I wont even bother making any further comments on this, just look at their blood and gore DLC comment section, because everything I could say about this has already been said.)  I only critisize this game because I love it, but buying this game and its DLC's for full price is essentialy telling Creative Assemblies that its behavior is ok. I wont go as far as to say I would never buy a total war game again, but this was the last total war game I will ever pre-order.

this game is awesome, if you wanna be a one man army and take over the jungle then this is a must get. The first person shooter in this game is very good, one of the things i liked is how you unlock a skill point and each skill point is used to unlock a perk. i like the fact that you have an option through out the game when you liberate outpost. to go in stealthy or guns blazeing and each perk helps you in both situations.  There are 18 radio towers to scale as you make your way through the game, each of which highlights new objectives on your map and opens up new weapons to buy at local shops, and each tower is a unique first-person climbing challenge - a peaceful ascent through a creaking spiral of steel that's fraying at the edges, revealing beautiful panoramic views before sending you back down to earth on a thrilling zipline.

This game is Great! Total War Warhammer has captured the grit and emersion in realtime battles of the previous instalments while adding the only niche left outside of the historical benchmark. I love the units and how we must manage their unfamiliar traits. This is not your grandpa’s Total War!   People complain about the DLC and price. Although I agree, I don’t think that should effect my review of the game itself.   My only complaint is the AI in campaign mode. Anything above easy creates a situation where you are attacked by 2 or more full sized armies (Chaos and whatnot) at all times which makes it hard to defend or attack any faction larger than 3 territories. The relentlessness of the AI makes it at times impossible to build up structures to advance your army and economy (unless you are Chaos or Beastmen). I feel the AI is over powered... or at least getting building and army bonuses/ income that I am not. I am sure there is a spam button I am not pushing correctly but the game as a whole keeps me coming back!  Hope you enjoy!

I don't usually write reviews, but I do like this game and hope it could be better.  Pros: This game is fun. It would be worth paying money for if they fix the problems.  Cons: There are a lot of bugs that indicate a lack of polish * I can't set my screen resolution for fullscreen to anything but my native desktop resolution. Workaround is to set game to windowed mode with a set resolution via steam launch options then set to fullscreen after login. There is a change resolution option in the game, but it doesn't have any options but my desktop res. * When attpempting to join a game that is full, a chunk of code error shows up rather than a message saying the game is full. Not a problem, but seems like something that would be trivial to fix. * Game objectives that show up on the map sometimes have game error text rather than actual names * There is apparently a known bug on arena team matches where you sometimes don't spawn. Based on other posts it has been around a long time and is quite common. * Players in team matches can apparently have skins/colors that override the team color, so the only way to tell what team they are on is to mouse over them and see if the dot is red. This is rediculous. * Performance on a lot of maps is terrible, mainly because they make them large with tons of detail. We don't really care how pretty the game looks, we'd rather it not chop. * Archer is quite frustrating to play. Quite often shots go right through people without hitting them. * Block seems to be able to block attacks even from behind if attacking with a slash, and from multiple opponents. * There is no cost to being blocked. If two people keep blocking/attacking each other, it will continue endlessly, pretty much regardless of weapon speed (dagger might be the only exception.) I've heard it's supposed to attack faster after you block (riposte) but if it's there it's too miniscule to matter. Think Assassin's Creed swordfighting without having a counter attack. This also applies to blocking multiple enemies simultainously.

The most epic F2P PvP shooter out there. Organized mess with about 100 guys fighting over a base, trying to capture it. 20 tanks, 10 jets and 50 armed men on foot. just wow. 3 factions, each with its own indivudal playstyle, weapons, vehicles. Some faction may have better vehicles than others but on the other hand they can lack on the force of their infantry weapons so there is always a balance and you can play faction which you like, not just which is strong. Some people may not trust F2P games, but this example of the perfect F2P game. microtransactions are not needed, shop offers comsetic items, xp and ingame currency boosters and weapons which you can all unlock with ingame currency. This game has a really neat ingame currency system- each 250 xp you gain 1 Cert point (ingame currency). This means the better you play the more money you will have.And theres a lot of opportunities to earn money- killing, assisting, spotting, damaging vehicles, airplanes, killing at longe range, objective capturing and the list goes on and on. It may be a grind but once you will learn to be most effective at the certain situation money should not be a problem. Comunnity of this game is for me as a lone wolf player somewhat between ok and nice- you can and you will occasionally kill someone on your side, but thats not a problem, just apologise and everything is ok, most people even dont bother with it. No frequent insults and ***holes as far in my 450 hours journey, so thats nice I think.   Pros -Massive scale of maps, battles and continents -Nice graphics -3 factions with its own playstyle -Great community -No need to spend real money -Sony sometimes gives away promo codes for free weapons, boosts, etc..  Cons -The game is very greedy, so its possible that people with not so good PC wont be able to play it -The ingame currency may have slower income for novice players -Sometimes very time consuming as you cant afford to take a dump when there is a huge battle and every single man counts.  10/10

Even if you pick to only play with people who speak english, sometimes you get whole teams who don't even know how to say 'hi' or 'yes'. Then they pick a character that the team didn't need at all and go 1/12.  I know it's strange that someone with over 1,000 hours in this game is saying to never play it, but trust me, it will ruin your life.

I too, find the game okay to start with, but it offers less as a whole then previouse titles, and I do not buy into the excuse of 'animations' and 'unique' units.  The game costs 60 euros, with 3 playable races(Chaos was only free for a little while), and while ''unique'' in a way, after several playthroughs it always kind of ends the exact same way everytime. Consider how much of the prev titles are gone, and how much assets is being reused and just reskinned, the only efford goes into armies and their units, which isnt a very large roster.   There is also a clear downgrade in graphics quality, and there is also a bit of a lie in recommended specs, my pc would run 60+ on ultra, it never did, and still does not. And they got no idea why, which leads me to believe they just put some specs up and wrote it as recommended 60+ fps specs. Otherwise how else can they not have seen this?  Then the worste comes true.  2,5€ to unlock gore in a war game 7,5€ to unlock a faction that's already in the game 18€ for the first of many still missing factions  And this is just the beginning.. I will never recommend this to anyone .  This is written a bit after launch.

I can't even be bothered highlighting the great points, yeah its a good game but its essentially a bad clone of Warhammer: Battle March. This game doesn't contain half of the playable races or units that Battle March did, the siege combat is actually worse than in BM and when playing as Chaos in BM you can actually destroy towns and buildings whilst battling armies in canon locations where as here you just beat the enemy army and 'pillage' the town with a simple left click.  The game is good but the fact that I can find better points in a game of the same universe from 8 years ago should give an indicator of its current state. Its a fun game and I enjoy the scope of the universe you play in, its also very true to the lore however, if you want to play a good Warhammer game play Battle March, if you're after a Total War game with Warhammer elements then, sure, pick up a copy but not for full price or maybe wait for the next 10 DLCs so you actually get a complete Warhammer game.   Edit: $3 US To add blood lmao

I've played dota for eight or nine years. It is fun and worth the time and effort to learn.   Unfortunately, Dota 2 is currently maimed by an idiotic matchmaking system that punishes you for winning. That's right, punishes you. You win a few games, get over fifty percent w/l, and then all of a sudden you're getting match with guys that don't speak english and fail to understand even basic concepts of the game. Then, when you lose a ♥♥♥♥ load and your winrate is down to forty eight or forty nine percent, you're magically tossed back into a group of people that actually know what they're doing. Then you get a win streak, and get some wins and get out of the hole.   Then the cycle starts all over again. There is no way around it. No amount of always taking a carry, or always taking mid, or always waiting to pick to get what your team needs is going to help you improve your w/l rate. It is rigged, and it is frustrating.  There is also no excuse for the servers for english speaking people to always be flooded with people that don't speak english. This is not racism, this is common sense. You're playing a team based game so you need to be able to communicate with your team. It is ignorant of Valve to allow non-english speakers on the servers in such overwhelming numbers, as that it ruins the play experience for all involved.

There are groups of people that really love this game. After being very excited about this game originally, I discovered it's not what I expected. I felt it was missing some of the MMO charm (such as industry to build your own aircraft, for example).  It's still a good time. I spent most of my time dinking around with the game mechanics and helping run the outfit I was in. You can buy cosmetic items and time boosts from the SOE stores with their station cash currency.  If you love a lot of combat all around you then download this game and try it. You need to join an outfit if you want to make any real difference in the combat zone.

My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through. ' I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigaretter. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

It was fun in the noob servers, visceral awesome crazy chaos, however ranking up ruins it all. The Chivalry community is tiny and elitist and hostile towards new players and foreign points of view. The fight mechanics are exploitable the community overly sensitive and competitive. With guys just wanting to have fun its great, with the try hard fan boy wannabe pro gamer crowd that is the majority of commited players in the servers outside the starting ranks its the opposite. The forums even have moderators slinging nasty little comments at new players that this isn't the game for them, breaking their arms patting themselves on the back for their amazing skills. Telling new players learning the exploits is like growing up, missing the irony of people playing a video game and taking that seriously talking about growing up.   Remeber every fan boy of this game who will tell us we need to learn and play their gamer their way. Games are supposed to be fun, not work, I and most gamers are not interested in treating this game or any other with that level of commitment nor should we.   Don't buy, unless its cheap enough that you don't mind the four to five hours max of fun you'll have. And under no circumstances should you engage this community that has gone beyond toxic to a literal parody of itself.

The game was pretty fun when it started and I had originally given it a good rating, the game is plagued by massive balance changes that alter the gameplay at it's core. These occur every few months and players will find themselves having to re-learn everything outside of the core fps basics. Aircraft control physics feel like the change with every few updates, very unsettling for frequent pilot players, and while the theme of the UI remains the same. Every so often you'll login wondering what the hell you click on to go to point A and then wonder how you ended up at point Z when there was no visual queue indicating you could be going ther at all.  The game is by no means terrible and many people still enjoy it however it is nowhere near the quality it was when it first came out. massive battles that could spontenously occur anywhere have been reducted to predictable skirmishes at predetermined points to cater to a Generation Z player base used to instant gratification and reward for failure.  If you want to play a game were you are rewarded for failure and giving it half of your effort, PlanetSide 2 is the game for you.

I was really in love with this game for quite a while. Unfortunately, things change. My two primary reasons for leaving and giving a negative review:  1) Customer support. I'm not a fan of them. When I accidently got charged $40 for an auto-renewal that I wasn't aware of, I quickly asked them if they could refund me the money and reverse the whole transaction and experience etc (given that I hadn't been logged in previous to the auto-renewal, this should have been easy). They sent me a very lengthy email back rudely stating it wouldn't be reversed. Period. I was wrong. It was autorenewal. It's my fault I wasn't aware of it. Blah blah blah.-Given it was $40, I took this issue to my credit card company. Now I can't log into my account at all. No email sent by SOE notifying me or explaining the reasoning. In total roughly $70 down the drain on a game I can't play.... At least I no longer am supporting those ♥♥♥-holes working there.  2) While they aren't offering high-end items for $, they are offering high-end items only to those that have saved up an insane amount of credits, I'm talking months of work for one item 1k credit item... unless you are paying for the credits or for a monthly subscription that would provide you with an experience boost to get the credits you are needing.

After this mandatory pre-beta Reborn download it's just been downhill, hit rockbottom and kept digging. After every update, it just gets worse.   I'm fine with cinks and bugs, I freely participate in Beta releases like Hots, Reborn, Windows 10 etc. It's not the bugs, it's all these changes, that has made me hesitate to double-click the Dota icon for me. After 700+ hours Dota takes away levels and gives me an icon that changes when I level up. Great but now the one match I'm playing with people with 1000+ hours and it's how Dota always was. Next, a match with people who don't even have a steam profile yet. The experience mmr bracket is ruined by the new levelling system incorporated into this chaos.  The T5I is over and the compendium rewards are STILL buffering. We were supposed to get them easily 4-5 months ago. 'There have been compatibility issues regarding the desert terrain and the axe immortal is still being made', fine you're busy, but then why rush a pre-beta then and release several treasury items when we're still waiting for what we paid for since the beginning of 2015?  I'm not saying it's a horrible game, I'm saying it's not what it was and I don't like the direction it's going into. It changed too much too quickly, it's missing several key factors that is being pushed aside for the illusion of progress.   To those who are thinking of joining the Dota 2 community, Dota is not what it used to be. I do not recommend Dota 2 Reborn at this current time and probably will not in the future.

I love Warhammer, i played the board game where you had to pay hundreds of dollars to play little monsters you had to paint yourself. Great hobby.  I played Warhammer online where you had to buy the game and subscribe 15-20$ / month. I played it for as long it has been active. It is still my favorite game of all times, i miss it.  I played pretty much all Total Wars except Napoleon and Atila. I still play them when i feel like it.  This opus is an insult to both fanbases. I played the greenskin campain and loved it. Greenskin was my army on table, i love them. The game looks great, the concept of total war is amazing and the world of warhammer is just mindblowing but that is where it stops.  Count with me :  100$ For the main title. 10$ For a Race that kicks your ♥♥♥ in the campain wether you bought the DLC or not... in short, for content that is already in the game. 5$ For blood ... in warhammer/total war/21th century war game... seriously... shame on you. 20$ For 1 New Race... 20% (1/5) of the price of the main title for 1 race.  and if they go all in Warhammer, the following races are still missing :  -Bretonia -Skavens -Lizard men -Chaos Dwarfs -Dark elves -High elves -Wood elves -The Ogres  Also note that:   when they say buy the Chaos faction, they are selling 1/3 of the actual Chaos branch. The Beastmen are an other 3rd of it. So they splited the chaos in 2 different DLCs so far, the Deamons of Chaos are still missing, unless you consider the very few units to be 2 factions merged in one.   The undead branch has 2 factions, so we should expect the Tomb Kings.  I hope you are smart enough to understand what I and so many others are saying here. Buy the game, it's fun, warhammer is awesome. But the business model behind it is an aberation and a scam.  Estimated total price without discount : 400$ give or take. Are you that rich ? It is getting ridiculous. Watch piracy come back big time in the next 10 years.

I'm not sure what to say about this game. It's hilarious, and gives you many many hours of entertainment and what seems like a deep and intricate combat system. However, on the one hand, once you play it for a while, you realize how horribly, horribly buggy and easy it is to abuse the combat system. Once you discover how to slow down your attacks as a Vanguard, it's almost impossible for 70% of all players to defeat you.  The game has been out for over two years. It quickly got a lot of hype and attention from big YouTubers, but despite the massive cash-in the devs got they're evidently pretty ♥♥♥♥♥ at their job. The peasants are all identical, the kick animation is clunky and the kick mechanic itself is often downright broken. It's remarkable that Torn Banner got the combat system quite rightly addictive and still not polish their game. There are still places you can clip through, get stuck; maps can break and have had the same glitches since they were introduced. Third person is literally allowed, for some inexplicable reason, granting players objective advantage over others, making this the ultimate way to play - which is a glaring problem, to say the least, when the game is advertised as a FIRST PERSON slasher.  All this total nonsense leads me to believe that the devs really have no ♥♥♥♥ing idea what they're doing. Do they even play their own game, realizing the problems that exist? It's not even debatable that third person is the best way to play. It doesn't matter if you like it or not, if you play in third person and master it then you WILL be better than someone on that same level playing in first person.  The devs just got lucky with a solid combat formula. I'm sad to admit I've nearly spent 300 hours on the game and nearly every match there is a bug or a glitch or a balance problem that ruins it. It's been two years since the game got out of beta. I don't ♥♥♥♥ing understand how they can add more maps and fail to add unique voice commands to those maps, as was included in every vanilla map.  What the hell kind of budget do these people operate with anyway. The instance there comes along a game that is the same but is actually focused on first person I will switch, and I will also uninstall this crap. I cringe seeing it on my games list.   For a slight bit of perspective on how broken this game is at its core, here is a video:         YouTube™ Video:  Chivalry Abuse

Far Cry 3 has many glaring issues. The most immediate is the horrific and broken Uplay DRM that is forced, despite this being the steam version of the game. The only upgrades in this game compared to it's predecessor are the graphics, voice acting, and general production values. The writing is simply laughable, quite possibly one of the worst stories I have experienced, the fact that Jeffrey Yohalem got nominated for a BAFTA for this game goes to show that becoming a writer in the modern video game industry requires only the bare minimum of credentials. I'm not even going to go into the plot because it's basically non existent beyond 'Uh hey he's bad, let's get em'! *takes shrooms*' The only character that has even marginally interesting writing is Vaas, and they hyped him up so much prerelease that practically every single one of his lines can be found in a trailer, and without his VA's fantastic performance it would probably not be half as interesting. Jason Brody & Co. are so obnoxious, that they are for all intents and purposes, a parody of themselves. Jason Brody, whose name itself is cringeworthy, goes from sheltered rich junkie ♥♥♥♥♥boy to a v-neck and tribal tattoo-clad hard 'killer' within the space of one mission and an overall story mode that lasts about two weeks in game time that is divided up into chapters, which we are greeted by with loading screens with forced 'Alice in Wonderland' excerpts that aren't actually relevant to the story beyond 'Woohoo I'm wacky, crazy, and insane Haha!'. The game's theme of insanity is not explored or expounded upon, just stated over and over again, no really, they just keep telling you the webster-merriam definition of the word. The irony is almost next level.    The shooting mechanics are vastly improved in this iteration with a few exceptions. 1. There is virtually no recoil on any of the weapons 2. Most if not all of the gun sounds, are in fact, not gun shots. Which in this day and age for a AAA game with a massive budget, is simply not acceptable, the PKM sound is like a note from a skrillex song.   Despite Far Cry 2's 'Heart of Darkness' derivative story, and cheap voice acting, the choose-able silent protagonists of varying backgrounds including ex-KLA members and IRA insurgents is able to be taken much, much more seriously in it's African setting that is reflective of the varying local wars and conflicts fueled by ethnic and religious tensions, blood minerals, and separatist sentiments that are and have been occuring for the past 50 or so years in Africa.   So basically unless you just really, really like playing as a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ druggie ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ with tribal tats that changes personality traits more often than my insane bipolar grandmother, and having the NPCs color coded for you to Red = Bad and Blue = Good, pick up Far Cry 2 instead, it has many flaws of its own, but they are acceptable given the context that they are symptoms of its age and budget. Far Cry 3 does everything it does in the most pedestrian and shallow approach the devs could have taken from the UI to the story.

Epic title, some great new features added to the series however most of the best features from previous titles have been left out.  This has made what could have been a great game seem half finished.  Probably the biggest dissapointment is that Multiplayer has none of the great features shogun 2 had, very dissapointing for such a general/magic/skills based title.   I was really buying this game expecting to play mostly online and have a general for each faction to upgrade and customize with different weapons, armours, magics and skills.   Pros:  Well optimised and great graphics Quests, touturials, objectives are the best designed from any TW game (until later game and it all breaks) Distinctive factions with their own gameplay mechanics Addition of Magic to generals Almost no bugs  Cons: Unfinished game. You need to pay for the rest in the form of 'DLC' Even though you paid for the game already. No thought given to Multiplayer No small settlement battles No unit formation options No ammo types Limited Unit types for each faction Limited upgrades/armour etc for units Badly balanced later game mechanics (The game balance is great until around turn 50 and then everything goes haywire)  The Verdict: A dissapointment. Buy it on sale.

I'd only recommand this game if you've already seen gameplay and you know it's a game you'd like. Don't buy it only because it's on sale on Steam. I've wanted this game almost a year and, yet, I've been on the brink of abandoning many times in the few 15 hours I've played. The game can be very fun once you get to level 30-40, but you got to be motivated to get that far.  Review:   Chivalry Mediavel Warfare is a very competitive, skill-based game with a medieval atmosphere. The combat are realistic and fast-paced. With 4 classes and over 60 weapons, you're almost sure to find a build that suits your fighting style. The game is based on skill and practice. You unlock weapon by using other weapons of the same category. The only things you can unlock with money is cosmetic, so it's not a Pay-To-Win. It has 5 interesting gamemodes and custom maps and mods.   Pro:  -Based on skill and practice. You can not pay to have upgrades you must practice to get better. -Dragging, Matrixing and other such things are very fun to learn and use in fights, even if they bugs. -Very fun, once you know how to fight. -Lots of different builds possible. -Team Objective, Team Deathmatch, Last Team Standing and Duel are fun and very easy to get better. -Nice graphics.   Con:  -Lots of hackers and team-killers on beginner servers- unintentional for the latter. And when you accuse someone of hacking, other people say you're a newbie and you don't know the game. -Lots of intentional team-killers on normal servers. -There is a huge difference of skills between beginner servers and normal servers. -The community can be very toxic with its hackers, team-killers, ragers and other such people. -If you've got a high ping or more than 10-15% team damage, you're gonna get kick. -It's very long and hard to be good. It took me 10 hours to be half-way decent on beginner servers. It takes hundred of hours to be good on normal server. And all the while you're gonna get destroy by better people and end the game with 2/23/4. -The devs have stopped working on the games. That means all the little annoying bugs aren't going to get fixed. On the other side, positive bugs suchs as dragging aren't gonna get removed either.   Beginner tips:  -First thing you should do after buying the game is the Training Map. Go in Training then Training Map. It shows you have to block, attack, combo, feint and how to play the different classes. It's very useful at the beginning. -Use a shield. Don't hold it in position all the time but use it to block more easily until you get used to the speed of the weapons and dragging. -If you're playing as a Vanguard or a Knight, don't side-swing in team games. You're gonna end up killing more allies than ennemies and get kick. -If you like to do a lot of burst damage and have a good defense, pick Knight. If you like to do a lot of damage and keep your distance use Vanguard. If you like to attack very fast use Man-At-Arm. -Don't play Archer until you're used to blocking with a sword. Archer is the hardest class to master. -Stick to beginner servers until you're level 10 to 15. But don't wait until you're 16 to play on normal server or it'll be twice as hard.

This was an amazing game when I was still enthralled with the side missions like hunting and taking over outposts. The controls, mechanics, and visuals are all very nice. The storyline and characters on the otherhand are lacking. Doing side missions makes you feel powerful and in control but once you start doing story missions you realize how limited everything is. From cheap quick time events to actually seeing enemies spawn from thin air it overall left me very unsatisfied. At the end I almost couldn't believe that that was all I got. Far Cry 3. An action adventure open world FPS stealth game developed by Ubisoft in 2012.  This is one of the best single player games I have ever played. I has a rich storyline, with a lots of characters, heart booming events, and an awesome atmosphere.  Singleplayer, as I said, is the best part on this game. There are alots of exciting missions, side missions, quests, and colletcting items aswell, such as collecting hide of animals to craft holsters, plants to craft medicine, or just find collectable stuff, like Relics, Letters and other stuff. There are also a lots of minigames, like poker, racing, ski jet racing, shooting... If you dont like storylines, and rather explore, or do random stuff, you can still enjoy this game.  Multiplayer isnt really the best. Its still a lot of fun though, although if Ubisoft took care about it a bit more, it would have been a lot better. Its fun to do the missions, but the story of the multiplayer campaign is a bit short. Its still fun to play it, especially at harder difficulty, where its also a bit challenging.  Overall, I rate this game 8 / 10. Its awesome at singleplayer, but a bit boring on multiplayer

Arma 3 is a must-have game for those looking to have a realistic and immersive experience. However, this is not provided by the game itself, but by the communities that make this game bring out it's full potential.  Phantactical, for example, focuses on casual realism and fun. PhanTactical is a community that has come together to play ArmA in a semi-serious environment for over two years. By using a tailored suite of mods that enrich and enhance game play with new features, units, and terrains (ACE, TFAR, Op. Trebuchet, CUP Terrains/Weapons/Vehicles, Etc), An administration team that is open and flexible to always make sure the group and events are running as smoothly as possible.  If you really want to have fun in this game - you should sign up @ www(dot)phantactical(dot)com. We have two sessions per week, every operation is a new experience.  Here are the requirements to join PhanTactical:  Own ArmA 3 Have a Microphone (No exceptions to this rule.) Have a mindset ready for tactical and community based adventures 18+ (No exceptions to this rule.)  We hope to see you around!

Having experience in other Moba's (LoL, HoN, HotS, and the original Dota), and having given Dota 2 a decent shot in learning its mechanics, I will go ahead and say that the game is in many ways broken. To list a few;  - When being killed you lose gold to your enemy, creating a power vacuum between two players that is extremely hard to recover from.  - Some heroes are completely unviable compared to others that are simply broken.  - The ranges of heroes vary from close quarters to extreme distance, making certain heroes without range nor mobility moves struggle heavily early game.  - Every item seems to have an active which makes keeping track of all your 'moves' a chore,more often than not having to juggle an entire second set of moves. Thankfully almost every Hero has a passive ability.. however this ultimately takes away from the uniqueness of a Hero.  - The delay between clicking and the Hero using their auto-attacks when starting the game is quite massive, along with how they seemingly glue themselves to the floor while doing it. This can apply to moves as well.  - Warding seems to be very static and uncreative.  - Having to buy an item that allows you to go back to base or into lane is a poor idea when you consider the first point (death causing loss of gold), on top of the fact that it takes a slot in your inventory.  There are many more issues that I had with the game but these were the main ones that drove me away. Ultimately, teamfights felt detached, farming was bland, the UI hurt my head with all the clutter, and the community was inhospitable at best. I advise anyone looking for a balanced, fun, or fair Moba to stay far away from Dota 2.

TLDR  Pro - Incredibly lore faithful - Fun factions and battles - Beautiful Map  DLC - Questionable, but not overwhelming, DLC model  As somebody who has kept in touch with the Warhammer Fantasy Battle lore off and on since the early 00's I have to say that CA has done a wonderful job staying true to what always drew me to the series. WFB games come and go, some better than others, but it's the story behind them that remains their greatest strength. CA has taken this concept and run with it. The entire game - though another title in the Total War series - drips with Warhammer flavor. From the specific faction mechanics to the unique army compositions I have personally enjoyed every game of TW: W I've played (even the losing ones). Artillery is a special favorite for me, I always find myself laughing when I see a Greenskin take a direct hit from a Dwarf Cannon, or an Empire line break against Goblin Doom-divers.  The terrain is beautiful, how it changes based on which faction controls it is such an interesting touch that makes the world feel more alive than a simple map. The in-battle scenery is eye catching as well. CA has done a wonderful job at capturing the magnitude of the Old World in its varied battle maps.  The only negative I have with the title is the DLC model. I can see the game being fairly expensive a year down the road, I hope (but don't expect) the price of DLCs to reduce over time to allow an easier entry for newer players years down the road. Paying their prices isn't a problem for me, but if there was any negative I had to list - this would be it.

review_text: READ FIRST, NO NEGATIVE REVIEW   I really like this game, played the normal version (Steam) for like 30 hours. But I wanted the DLCs and bought the GOTY in a sale. I don't even use that many mods, because I knew modding Fallout 3 GOTY with Steam Version would be difficult. Just some graphic and UI changes and Ironsights. Not really much more... The thing is, if you want to play vanilla... Give it a try. But if you are going to mod this game, which I recommend for the most games Bethesda made, buy the CD version, since it seems way more stable. Maybe I will give it a try again when I got my new PC, but until that I will play New Vegas again, which runs highly modded on my PC, with no problems. Maybe a crash here and there after some hours, but not less.   After all: I recommend Fallout 3, but I don't reccomend the steam goty :/
Play Super MNC instead.

I dont play (ok, played) this on my PC but on my Tablet.. I thought I write my warning here..  The game is a time waster.. very good one.. and became with the last update even MORE time waster. Let me explain. The game is a resource game.. running in real time. You can play it clicking your ♥♥♥ off, play it idle and do nothing at all beside a few clicks every here and then.. or a mix of both.  I played a mix, as sometimes I want to click a bit and other times I prefer to sleep! :p So for 5 days I wasted my time.. and I felt very sorry for myself during game time.. why am I wasting my life with this? Anyhow.. got myself a little setup and reached Lv400 in 50min on my farm run for hero souls. Got about 350 on average on a run. Skilled mainly chance to spawn a Primal Boss and Hero Souls drop amount plus more gold in IDLE mode. I was happy wasting my time... and the update came.. no question, do you want to upgrade? Just suddenly I got way more Hero Souls.. niiiice, what a lucky run.. when I hit over 1k Souls.. I started to understand, something goes different as usual. Bed time.. started game again next day and screen pops up.. Transcence bla bla.. Help Screen to explain it all.. like a lerner driver gets this instruction: Open Door of the car, start car, drive as it is demanded by law, park and exit car. So.. basicly nada! Next I start my run.. why are my heroes not guilded anymore?? Why does all take soooooooo much longer? To make it short.. that is what r2games sold you. We made a upgrade and BALANCED the game. How unbalanced it was before.. example: My next upgrade for chance to get a primal boss was 72 Hero Souls... after the update +86k Hero souls.. so the developper thought it needed a balance to a skill that was 1 : 1200 out of balance. Yes, but we gave you more Hero Soul income too... true.. went from 400 average to 1500 on a run.. lets say 4 time more... to 1200 more cost.. my same farm run of 50min is now over 3 hours... and instead of beeing able to upgrade my chance for hero boss 3 times on one farm run to 400.. app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: the first fallout game i played, Fallout 3 incredible main story, awsome side quests, and massive nonlieniar atmosphiric open world make this one of the best games i've ever played. After playing both new vegas and fallout 4, i found that in terms of story, atmosphere ,and side quests, fallout 3 is the clear winner dispite in my opinion not being as overall good as fallout 4 (but still 500x better then new vegas, seriously i have no idea what obsidian was thinking when they implemented ceasars legion or thought that the game had an acceptable main quest.) The only true flaw i find in fallout 3 is the actual writing and dialoge that goes with its incredible story, at times its has that nice simple feel to it that might remind you of dialoge beween saturday morning action cartoons (childish, but at the same time awsome,) other times it just is downright childish and rather lazy (seriously, one of the many ways to kill the main villan is to convince him that he is insane, and he just kills himself, yeah its very hard to pass the speech check, but its still rather silly way to destroy a rather awsome villian.) Overall fallout 3 is a gameing masterpeice, combining rpg elements from the first 2 games with (at the time of its relese) modern fps mechanics to bring a new standard to the fallout franchise, a standard that set the foundation for fallout new vegas and Fallout 4.

Due to the state of the game's current performance, I cannot in good conscience recommend it to anyone.   WARNING - Long review below. Here's a quick TL; DR for the more impatient types :  'Despite promises by developers, the game is as poorly optimized as ever. DX12 is not included at launch, and multi-core CPU-support is no better than before. The game also has numerous performance-bugs limiting the experience further. This poor performance renders me unable to recommend the game.'  ---  Since after the release of 'Empire: Total War' in 2009, the  Total War -games have gained a reputation for being poorly optimized, especially on more modern computers. Amongst other things, this has to do with the games running on a seven year-old engine that wasn't at the time built to make full use of technology like multi-core CPUs, despite the games by their very nature being extremely CPU-heavy. Thus, for a great many people, the very first question that needs answering whenever a new  Total War -game is announced or released, is 'how will it run?'.      In the time running up to the game's release, the developers made several announcements promising significant improvements to the engine; improvements that would supposedly lead to superior performance. By far chief among these, were  improved support for multi-core CPUs , and  DX12-support .      A few days before launch, the developers released a statement informing that the game would  not  support DX12 at launch, after all. This will supposedly be patched in at an unknown later date. In addition,   DSOGaming.com   released a performance-analysis reporting that the news of improved multi-core CPU-scaling was blatantly untrue - the game is as poorly optimized as ever, maxing out only one or two cores. This is possibly linked to the removal of DX12-support.       http://www.dsogaming.com/pc-performance-analyses/total-war-warhammer-pc-performance-analysis/       Having tested the game for about a solid hour, I can confirm this. I can also report a number of bugs and glitches that decreases performance further - at least on my system. I also haste to add that my computer is way above the official system-requirements for 'Ultra' game settings. (According to the developers, my computer should easily be able to run a battle with 20 regiments per side on max graphical settings in 60 FPS; this is blatantly and demonstrably untrue.)       The following are my personal experiences with fighting a number of 20 vs. 20-regiment Custom Battles.   At its  very best  - and not taking any of the numerous performance-related bugs and glitches into the equation - the game appears to perform about the same as  Total War: ATTILA ; both for me, and others I've spoken to. This makes sense, seeing as there does not appear to be any immediately significant graphical difference between the two titles, save for minor spit-shines like improved reflective surfaces on metal. For me, personally, this translates to about 30-35 FPS when zoomed close to the ground, assuming the camera isn't moving and the troops on-screen aren't fighting. When multiple regiments are engaged in hand-to-hand combat, the performance will typically drop to about 20 FPS. It can drop down to 15-10 FPS if said regiments are clustered closely together, for some reason.      This is, of course, assuming the game runs flawlessly. It doesn't.      Performance-related bugs include huge stuttering when the camera moves at any significant speed or in any significant distance, FPS taking a dive whenever even a single Spell is cast, and mysterious and seemingly arbitrary permanent frame-drops. And this is occurring  all the time . The FPS-counter races up and down like a rollercoaster.      In one example, I was zoomed in on a mêlée taking place between three or four regiments at the far left of the battlefield. The FPS hovered at around  20 . I then moved the camera to the opposite end of the battlefield and viewed the exact same scene from there, and the FPS dropped to  10-7 . When I then moved the camera back to the original position, the game  stayed at around 8 FPS . Already poor performance made worse with bugs.      ---   Final words .      The general track record and business practices of the developers, combined with the state of the game's performance, renders this game something I am sadly completely unable to recommend. I am going to apply for a refund, and can only suggest that people with similar issues do the same. Voting with your wallet is after all the only real way to enact change.      I did not pre-order the game, and this is the exact reason why. I am going to re-purchase the game whenever DX12-support is patched in, and will update my review accordingly.         My computer .      Two TITAN Zs in SLI. (Latest drivers.)  Intel Core i7-5820k.  ASUS X99-PRO.  32GB RAM.  Game runs from a fast SSD.  Windows 10 Pro 64-BIT.     Disclaimers .      My computer is completely free of viruses; all other games run fine; I have tried verifying the integrity of the game's cache; re-installed the game twice, and made sure all drivers are updated.

This game is nothing other than money grab. Valve is too busy creating cosmetics for easy money to fix bugs that have been in the game for years like creeps following you through fog of war or a more recent game breaking bug that causes the screen to freeze and turn completely white in the middle of the game forcing you to restart Dota with no guarantee that the game was paused. You can also expect to be put in low priority games about once a week because it currently takes around 3 reports in 20 games to send you to low prio. That is 3 people reporting you out of the possible 180. The game is centered around competitive play to the point that there is really no reason to play if you don’t intend on getting better. However the ranking system is currently the simplest and most inadequate of any “competitive” game out there if you win you get +25 MMR if you loss -25 no matter your performance. Go 15/2 as a phoenix that started the game as a support then was forced in to the carry role because you’re the only one that isn’t currently 0/10 clearly you’re not a good player or you could have won that game. The ranking system is so awful that a black market of accounts has popped up so now any scrub with 20 bucks can buy an account in your ranking were he doesn’t belong and give you 0% chance of winning the game. I wouldn’t consider getting in to the game at its current state 12,000,000 players and it’s still a buggy mess with incompetent players that are unavoidable at any skill level.

A persistant Online Game which Pits Hundreds of Players in 3 opposing factions against one another on huge land masses with their assortment of guns, tanks, planes, and troops all at one time. However it suffers from Latency Issues, Load problems, Faction and weapon balance, and most critically - Population Issues. While it is true that Hundreds of other players all connect to the same world you do, the square-footage to player ratio is so small that the game feels largely empty in spite of this fact.  And in the few instances where you actually find yourself fighting a sizable opposing force, the map grid you fight over is often no larger then the average Battlefield or Call of Duty Multiplayer map and usually lasts just as long as one of those maps as well because either you grossly outgun or outnumber them, or they grossly outgun or outnumber you.   If you do get this game you will find yourself dipping Hundreds of hours into it... but not actually fighting, but instead looking For a Fight.

Dota 2 is a very depressing game. Think of it as cocaine. Once you touch this game, it kinda draws you in and keep you playing, which will devour so much of your time, and it is very hard to get out of that.  Why it is depressing? The community is the biggest reason, you will get flamed, cursed and reported for the mistake that you make by other players. As a result, you will develop into a person who becomes very salty(Classic exmaple EG.PPD) and rage easily.  And you get to play with Peruvian!! They are the worse teammates that you can have. They like to play on us server from Peru with more than 100ping, no thought they are bad, Since this is a team game, they are lack of teamwork (AFK farming) and communication ('jajajaja' is what they talk). They give out easily and often result into a rage quit. I really hope Valve could do something about this, maybe regional lock-out so they could not enter us serve.  I do NOT recommend this game right now until any improvement has been made about the community.   I talk from thousand hours of game play and 5.4k mmr.

Picked this up for 5 euro on the Steam sale - Wouldn't advise getting it for much more than that.  The combat is fun and hitting people over the head with a sword is cathartic - It's especially satisfying if you do it right and it all comes out in your favour. There are a lot of FPS games which claim to include close combat, but none feel as visceral or as strong as the central combat of Chivalry. The game has simple Battlefield-esque rules in multiplayer (Or just plain free-for-all) which seems fair enough. The plot also stands up in the sense that it doesn't over-complicate.   The thing is, it looks like a game that was intended to be single player but at some point someone realise that the AI was too bad to roll out with a single player campaign, and it became entirely multiplayer dependant. Which seems great now, but for all I know a few weeks down the line nobody else will be playing or the servers will fill up with people flaming. For now the multi-player stands up, but that doesn't change the fact that when I want to play single player, I end up with a wide open space with the two teams sitting on opposite ends, facing the wall and twitching. There are also more than a few corners in which one can get trapped by jumping at the wrong angle.  Then there's the fact that it's a 15 euro indie title which appears to have paid DLC for different helmets (Which at best you will only see from behind anyway). For a game that's already startlingly incomplete given its lack of decent AI and relatively small variety of maps to choose from. To me, this is Torn Banner getting a bit too big in their pantaloons.They need to make sure everything runs smoothly before they can think about releasing DLC.  So in short it's a really strong, fun game mechanic which doesn't seem to know quite what to do with itself, and it suffers from a sense of feeling a bit small, a bit unimmersive and not nearly as epic as the tralier intended.

NOTE: For review with screenshots, please visit  http://microfloppy.net/2015/06/16/goat-simulator   Have you ever wanted to be a stunt goat? Then Goat Simulator is the game for you.  It really is as silly as it sounds. You are a goat, running around in a world, and you are able to interact with the stuff around you. You knock things over. You scare people. You stick to things with your tongue. You can flip and do somersaults. You can ride a bicycle.  The game is actually an action game, and if you enjoy skateboarding games or games like GTA where you can run around and do tricks, I'm pretty sure you will enjoy Goat Simulator as well.  The graphics are fair, the gameplay at times hilarious. It isn't anything I play at any greater lengths of time, but for winding down for 30 minutes or if I don't have anything better to do, Goat Simulator is a great choice. No brain effort needed at all.   6/10 exploding cars

review_text: This is my favorite game of all time. It has the best story that I've ever experienced in a game, and keeps you busy for hours on end with it's great gameplay, gripping side quests, and addictive loot system that keeps you coming back to play the game over and over again. app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: 1. Game has some issues wiht Win7 x64 OS, though you can work around most of those issues. 2. The quest where you explore the mansion, and assist the man inside against the 'Tribe' people, is bugged for many, including myself, and he won't allow completion of the mission through normal means. 3. I bought this game not too long ago, for 19.99, I also pre-purchased Fallout4, and then they suddenly put Fallout3 GoTY edition on sale for half of what I paid a week or so ago, for 9.99, which obviously aggravates me a bit. 4. If you are just now buying Fallout3, for the 9.99 price, AND if you aren't using Win7, then I would say...why not buy it, for 9.99. Otherwise, I wouldn't recommend.

This has probably been one of the worst games I've ever played in my life. The moment I entered the game, I had to go through a tutorial. I thought to myself, 'Oh! How useful this is!' Then, I learned that there was no bypass/skip option and it tok me a solid one hour and thirty minutes. This annoyed me so much that I took a break and came back the next day. I attempted to try the game with a friend. As we went into a game, our cameras got stuck to the top right hand side of the screen. We could not move it and tried to play in first person. this then led us to learn that we could get one shotted by a single enemy. This led me and my friend to quit after the second game when the same issues occured. I give the game a CLEAN 0.01/10 due to how bad it was.

People have told me that I could never goat. I didn't believe them. I wanted to follow my dream of finally being able to goat. I had cried in bed thinking about how great it would be to goat. They had told me it was too dangerous. Oh boy were they right. As soon as I goated, I had started to mutate into a goat. The mutation was horrible, and very painful. The people who let me down all of my life, are now thinking about how wrong they were. I am a goat now. I am finally free.      But in all seriousness, this game is amazing. 10/10. You're a goat. If you don't want this game, sit down and ask yourself why not. FOLLOW YOUR DREAM! BE A GOAT! I know how you feel. 'MR.MIND! IT'S TOO DANGEROUS. I COULD NEVER GOAT!' WELL STOP RIGHT THERE. Get this game, and you can have a safe, virtual experience AS A GOAT! Go get this game, become a virtual goat. Explode things, chase people down. DO WHAT EVER YOU WANT! Be free.

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: It's good. The main quest and Broken Steel are great. The D.C. wasteland is rather bleak and depressing, visually and interpersonally. The game also lacks several of features which you'd expect and which are in Fallout: New Vegas, most notably the ability to aim down gun sights. The good news is that there's a mod project named 'Tale of Two Wastelands' which converts and imports Fallout 3 into Fallout: New Vegas.  If you can, buy both Fallout 3 and New Vegas: Ultimate Edition and use Tale of Two Wastelands. If you have to pick one, I recommend New Vegas. The Mojave Wasteland feels so much more alive and interesting.

I like that Total War is going branched out to fantasy (i mean you can only do so much with history) but this wasnt what i would go with, WarHammer isnt bad but there were better options, elder scrolls or Lord of the rings for instance, i mean the 3rd age mod is the best total war mod ever made. or they would of just made up there own world. plus i really dont like how powerful lords are, i mean it really conflicts with how total war battles happen to have one completely OP unit that really decides a battle. I hate how dumbed down they made sieges and the whole chaos invasion is boring, i mean it was fun the first 2 times but after that its just the same thing over and over again, chaos invasion locks down whats going to happen in the game to much and really limits the replay value. A lot of these problems stem from it being a WarHammer game and thats why i thing going WarHammer wasnt the best choice. in the end i give it a 6/10, i hope that the go into fantasy more in the future but do it better next time.

A high calliber game which really draws you into it's unbelievably beautiful world. The gameplay is extremely solid to the point of unbreakable if it weren't for some odd key placements that had me reluctant to use certain items. But that is just a nitpick, in a game worth every penny. The story is very well written and has many interesting turning points and characters which you'll remember after playing the game (I'm pointing at you Vaas). You'll wish there was more after searching every nook and crannie for those collectibles (which range from ancient relics to drug reports) and thankfully, blood dragon has more of that high octane gameplay that was beautifully presented here. I know my next game now.

Banal; Trite; An endless barrage of people recommending this game; Visions of wet paint drying; Solicitation of suicide  This collage of miscellanous words and semicolons is the only feasible description one can tag to this utter waste of hdd space. I am convinced that everyone who actually enjoyed this piece of heck is just experiencing the cognitive dissonance caused by a contrast between the amount of money they spent on this game and the expectations they had for it.  If you enjoy this game: you're a casual, you're relatively new to gaming, and you're still self-delusional about that time during childhood that you were tricked to perform gay sexual acts with your 'friend'.  Sure, it's pretty, but so is your fat french ♥♥♥♥♥♥ of a mother. Then why don't I talk to her anymore? Why do I ignore her late-night booty calls? Because she's hecking boring. She's like any other fat ♥♥♥♥♥♥, but because she's french, she's expensive. There's nothing instrisically special about her besides her nationality. She isn't interesting and she's heck for conversation.

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: This is a great game in the original English American version. But If you purchase this game from Germany, Steam will only allow you to download the German version with German audio. This is a complete deal breaker to me. The German translation is very bad quality, especially as things like the voice of the Jamaican or African radio host (i forgot exactly) simply don't translate into German. Many jokes and amazing content of this game makes absolutely no sense when translated.  I already wrote to Steam support several times, but they won't issue a refund or help with downloading the original English language. So for this reason I cannot recommend this game if you live in Germany.

I played this game for about a week, in that time I did a number of side missions, hunted, drove about, and just explored.  Heres what I think about it. Pros: -Amazing scenery -Enjoyable driving -Good voice acting for the most part -GLORIOUS villians -Rememberable characters -Immersion -Good soundtrack.  Cons: -No reason to keep playing after you beat the main storyline -No recoil on guns -Horrid, horrid, HORRID enemy AI, on higher difficulties they will rush with a knife, to the slaughter. -No underwater exploration that is able to be pursued, besides caves. -Diffrent topic.- -Confusing points in the story, no idea what happened with boss fights.

I wish Steam would allow a neutral or 50/50 option, because I neither want to recommend nor condem this game. I'll try not to spoil anything. I spent about 34-35 hours on my play through, so I spent a good amount of time exploring and doing other stuff besides the story, so this review isn't just a quick blaze through of the game.  Also, incoming wall of text, so if you were expecting a light read, then jog on.  It's another painfully average AAA title with tons of repetative side quests like Assassins Creed, except in FPS format. Ubisoft really need to let go of the 'Make everything like Assassins Creed so it sells' mentality. Assassins Creed only worked once, and that was the first game. Anything after that was a sham and a waste of time, but I digress.  'Exploration' pretty much consists of you activating or deactivating a radio towers, I don't really know which one it is. This reveals a little bit of the map around that particular tower. Then you have to clear out all the pirates from the surrounding camps in that area. Once you claim the area, you are given the choice of two side quests from each camp you liberate. 'Wanted Dead' or 'Hunting', they're both the same ♥♥♥♥ in each camp. 'Wanted Dead' entails you having to kill a pirate leader in a near-by camp with a knife. Nothing else, ever for the whole game. Just a knife. 'Hunting' is just killing animals with a bow and arrow. You can get all the upgrades for weapon holdsters, carry packs and whatever in about an hour of play time.  Gunplay feels like a step down from Far Cry 2. All the weapons felt nice to use and control and everything just clicked. But Far Cry 3s gunplay has almost zero recoil and you can just ♥♥♥♥ bullets in the direction of the enemy and they'll all fall over (I played through on hard difficulty). I would have given the gunplay a passing grade if weapon degredation and condition was brought back from FC2. That was so fun. Just having your gun jam or explode on you in a fight or having an RPG rocket just flop out the front of the launcher and spin around wildly in front of you was great and I really missed that mechanic. That and there is a severe lack of weapons in general. 4 per catagory and there's about 5 catagories. Some of the weapons look inaccurate to their real life counterparts. This is a massive boner kill for me, even if the game isn't supposed to be that realistic, the weapons need to look like they do IRL. Especially the AK47, it's HUGE, too long and has all these silly little ornate touches too it and it looks dumb.  The protag is a whiney little girly boy, sure a change from the usual macho meat-head bald super soldier space marines we've seen time and again through the PS3, 360 gen, but he was still boring to listen to, and play as. 'Oh god m-muh morals, muh fambily and muh friends'. The story itself is just through and through stupid.  Some of the supporting cast was better though, although almost ALL of them where some type of massive cliché. Some of the voice acting for some of the characters was really quite good. Sam, Hoyt and Vaas, for example. That brings me onto sound. I don't know what was wrong with the sound in the game, but some of the audio is really great quality, but then sometimes you'll hear villagers or minor NPCs with really wooden, fuzzy and almost unintelligible sound quality to their voices. Might be due to 'console limitations' or something, but it was really horrible in some places and made me think I had an issue with my soundcard at one point.  Graphically? It's alright. I don't play a game just because it looks nice. One thing I will say though, is that the facial rendering for main characters is really good. The environments are ok, but it's that typical 'lol tropical island' ♥♥♥♥♥ again. Tropical island has been done to death when it comes to HYPER GRAFIX games. Take it somewhere else. Oh and the water doesn't look that great.  One of the cooler elements of the game was the wildlife. Being pounced on by a Tiger or a bear while running through the bush is pretty ♥♥♥♥ing neat. Shark attacks sucked though.  Lots of QTEs, games automatically lose points for having QTEs. It's lazy. Stop putting it in games.  Forced scripted vehicle gunning sections. Personally I hate this ♥♥♥♥. You're bolted to a truck while the dumbass AI drives at 5mph and you get shot up because you can't strafe or duck to avoid incoming rounds and the like. LAME. Stop putting it in games.  'Enhanced perception' stims are overpowered as hell, abuse them.  There's a silly little bug or glitch in the game that allows the player to fall about 1-2ft after sliding down a small incline or jumping over a small rock, that'll just outright kill your player because it thinks you fell like 100ft or something.  No South African accents.  Hang gliding and wingsuiting is neat.  Menu and map theme is really ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ annoying.  Too many stupid pop-culture references and 'lol xD meme' type dialouge.  Forcing me to play poker as part of the story. No one should ever be subjected to that ♥♥♥♥♥.  The majority of the 'tatau' skills are worthless and have no use, but you have to take some of them to get the ones you actually need.  Dubstep based soundtrack. I like dubstep, but that crap doesn't belong in video games.  You have to install and use Uplay to play the game, which is total ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t and annoying.  Ending is totally phoned in.  Overall it's not a bad game, but it's not amazing either. It's middle of the road at best. But like all modern AAA games, it's marketed to hell and back and sold on hype, not the game itself.  4/10, no game ever gets 10/10, therefore 4/10 is an average score.  Also this:         YouTube™ Video:  Ace Ventura Jeep - Far Cry 3
