Also, if you want to play this game, heres how my gameplay went;    Download the game after a long time thinking theres no such thing as a good free game Start as VS Own NC more than TR Become TR Too easy to kill people Become NC Feel the hardness to fight anyone else, having to develope creative tactics and aquiring friends along the way.  Still wondering if it was worth it or not, because the balance of weapons is off and messed up Continue fighting and playing hoping that the new developers would actually do something to smoothen out the balance My rating: 8/10 but it would only get the extra 2 if balance of weaponry was made Also, if anyone is going to get this game and they never played it before, watch out for Battle Rank 100s.  And now on to the hard truth. This game can turn really crappy, really fast. In my opinion, the NC should either have its damage fixed, or no one should play that faction at all. Their maxes suck, they have no weaponry compared the never ending rain of the TR and VS. The SMGs are out gunned due to firing rate as well as velocity and bullet drop + recoil. And all of our guns do such a small amount of about +30 damage that the TR and VS guns have already fired off their second shot by the time you first is 1/4s the distance from your target. TR and VS can put so much more damage on you because all they have to do is keep a crosshair on you. You have a maxed our shield? Gone, along with your health, you didn't need it. You have a composite armor tank, buggy, or plane? Pssh, 'Here, lemme jus throw my Vulcan and Gate keeper at it,' 'No! Let me throw my Saron and a version of the TR minigun at it!' I change my review, this game has taken, No, NC has taken a downfall, and it is still my favorite faction. If NC doesn't get fixed, guess the devs just lost a subscriber.

As an FPS gamer i have always looked for one particular experience. Large scale battles with tons of players working together to accomplish an objective. I first looked at Halo, then Call of Duty and then i found Battlefield. I thought that was the largest scale battles i would ever find. Then Sony Online Entertainment released Planetside 2. Having played the first game a tiny bit and not really understanding what was going on i figured i would give this game a try.   I log in and do the tutorial and after learning which way is up i am dropped into the game. I click the instant action button and immediately i am dropped into the largest battle i had ever seen in a video game. I was a soldier in the New Congomerate and i immediately landed in front of a massive wall of Terran Republic tanks exchanging fire with a similarly sized wall of friendly tanks. Needless to say i was quickly shown that using the instant action button is not always the best idea. I respawn at a nearby sunderer and pick up the Engineer class and spent most of the time repairing tanks for our side. After an hour long slugfest it looked pretty grim, Until i saw a large number of friendly aircraft begin to fire upon and decimate the enemy line. We push through the decimated remains of the enemy forces and capture the nearby base. Needless to say after this, i was hooked. I would not hesitate for a second reccomending this game.  Pros: Large Scale Combat Persistant World Teamwork is emphasized.  Cons: Learning Curve is significant if you have not played an FPS game before.   Personal Note:  Instant Action is not refined enough in my opinion, It drops you where there is a large battle taking place between your faction and another. It does not always drop you close to allies and sometimes drops you literally right on top of the enemy. (as amusing as it is to kill an enemy galaxy with a drop pod, not exactly very fun when you get killed seconds later.)  I do not consider this a con as this does not impact my personal game experience enough for me to consider it a downside to the game. Instant action is not the only method of joining a battle, just the one that gets you into the fight the quickest.

Far Cry 3 is all about adventure, carnage, the jungle aspect and getting the best guns for your assault type. There are a lot of areas where FarCry succeeds but many more where it simply falls through the floor.   Far Cry 3 offers a compelling storyline through the singleplayer campaign. It is almost unrivaled and allows you to take hold of a person and watch them grow from a normal friend-loving schoolboy to a psuedo-psycho badass of the jungle.   Multiplayer is completely broken as there a lot of bugs and hiccups along the way. The loadout option is pretty much useless as there is currently one build that destroys anything else that you put against it.   Coop is a very welcomed theme within the Far Cry series, it's just a shame it wasn't implemented into the overall storyline. Or atleast contained within it's own world. Rather than you and a friend playing within the island sandbox, you are forced to go through objective-based and competition-based tasks that follow a very crappy storyline of 4 people just wanting to get rich and get out.   ++ Singleplay, Multiplayer and COOP modes.  + Guns and tools are nice + Great scenery  +++Buy this game for the singleplayer  - Multiple bugs - Uplay requirements/overlay - Game-breaking bugs - Overpowered SMG class - Graphics are similar to FC2 but..worse?   I would only recommend this game for the singleplayer and nothing else. The coop is fun if you're with the right people and playing on INSANE mode.
Really fun game when you find teammates that don't intentionally feed, teammates that speak english, and when the servers stay up long enough for you to actually play the game in the first place.

I like almost everything about the game except for the system is based on Pings, and they need to align quite closely among players to make the game-play fair. There is no system to keep those with insanely high pings out of a local server, and they ruin the game. The Devs acknowledge the need for aligned pings and even publish a guide on how to set/configure. No one does, and games are therefore unfair. If the Devs could find a way to limit server-entry by ping, it would be a superb game. As it is, it is pretty darn good, but so unfair most of the time that I cannot suggest it to newer players. If it is on sale (and sales are pretty common) then go for it! I truly like the game, I just dislike that one key point enough to not be able to suggest it.

My rating on this fantastic shoter: 5/5  Some of the posetives: - Not Pay-to-win - Enormous 'maps'. Actually vast landcape. It requirew more than halph an hour flying to a pilot with a fast fighter, to visit all the 'facilities' on a condinet map. I played for a year in the past before setting up the steam version, and I still have not got familiarised with more than 10% of the map. The facilities do look alike, so you feel comfortable, but the many enviroments around them keep my interest always new. The strategic deplyment of a spone point (sundered) on a good positon at the various terens, is an interesting gaming experience all by itself for example. - Rewarding team-play. - The major problem of the game (not friendly to new players becous of its many options and mechanics), has now been treated with a small 'tutorial' available, and a small condinet accesible only from low-level players. - FANTASTIC, REALISTC, INTERESTING FEELING OF FUTURE WARFARE! STRATEGIC THINKING, GOOD POSITIONING AND COBAT TACTICS DO COUND, ALLOWING EVEN A LOW-LEVEL UNSKILLED UNDERARMED PLAYER TO POSSIBLY 'FARM' VERETANS OR TO REALLY CONTRIBUTE TO THE OUTCOME OF A FACILITY ATTACK. - BIIIIIIG battles with countless ppl simultaneusly online.  Some of the negatives: -Lately it stasted to be a bit 'pay-to-win' becouse of the numerous old and experienced players that in rare occasions can make you feel a bit frastrated. At least for the NewConglomerate faction I play this year, that is usually the outnumbered proudly last-standing fighting force. -No proper joystick support. Fly mechanics are not the usual physics. -Too many players, enemies, vehicles, strategic locations etc, dissorient me when I start fighting in an unfamiliar arrea, so it is sometimes frastrating that i get killed many times without even knowing were the enemy is. But, on the other hand, this gives a real immersing feeling of being involved in a real combat

Much disappointment, such sad. side note what's with holding down the joystick to sprint?

This review was posted by user 'cylian3' on the metacritic user reviews page on july 7, 2014:  'Never In my entire life have I witnessed a worse community revolving around a video-game than the one that is to be found in Dota 2. The players are: Egotistic, ego centric, unsporting, aggressive, hostile, uncaring, mean, mistrusting, immature, callous, apathetic and incredibly pretentious while at every loss prompting everyone inside the current game to 'Report player X' if someone on their team was even remotely new to the game or did any other action not sanctified by them, be it going in what lane you want, not purchasing courier/wards or simply just had an unlucky run/getting cross-classed. Along with being completely miserable to be around, they frequently never speak the language in the region you're playing and nowhere else is this more apparent when russian is spammed into the chat at all times on European zones from 3 different sources at once. And if people do know English, trolling is nothing short but assured from all directions to all teams.  Second biggest problem with this game would be the elitist mindset that orbits anyone that has played this atrocious game for more than a couple of hours. Any behavior that breaks the typical dota 2's hardcore player routine of buying tango, healing salve and iron branches, perhaps with some boots of speed if they're feeling adventurous will result in a wave of F-bombs, intentional feeding, votes of surrender, spam prompts to report player X and disconnecting users as far as the eye can see. I even had cases where players left the game because some guy forgot to buy a courier at the start of the game. And that's me overlooking the fact that killstealing off your TEAMMATES is considered average behavior/a common tactic. In LoL, you can even report people for 'being unskilled'. As in, anyone. Even if they're level 1.To put it bluntly, MOBA's like dota 2 give out a special kind of disgusting behavior that makes me feel physically ill for very good reasons.  Coming close to problem number 2 is the third epic fail problem of this game. The match-making in Dota 2. Broken, poorly thought through and executed horribly. You are prompted to select a variety of regions before initiating the match-making system and the more regions you have selected, the less waiting time..  Which begs the question, what is the point with the regional system if you're just gonna encourage people to sign up for all regions? The end result will be that nobody sticking to their geographical zones and not only causes frustration in the form of people trying to communicate and chat with eachother in the chat as described above but also disallows any kind of vocal / text tactical communication since everyone does not speak the same language. In all honestly, this game is overloaded with issues just like this and I would be able to overlook this particular embarassing design-flop if it wasn't for the actual hard functionality of the MM as well being broken. The scenario on where 4-5 organized people in a group, all sitting in ventrilo/teamspeak while packing thousands of hours in Dota 2 each have a very likely possibility to be 'teamed' up against new players with less than 10 hours with no complaints from the match-making system (even if there is a very large queue) throws out any chance of that. This happens particulary often if you decide to try the game out with a friend or two which leaves me with yet another question: The purpose of match-making was to find equally skilled opponents. So why is this even remotely possible? Team-based games with a mandatory MM are supposed to be fair. Not Tyrannosaurus rex VS a duckling. I'm reluctant to say that Dota 2 even has a match-making at all once you look at all the facts.  Even with all these problems, I could actually see myself overlooking them at a certain time during a year due to the sheer amount of possible combinations in this game with heroes & items and the addictive quality the game has if it wasn't for all the other flaws.  The commitment to play DotA MOBA's however, is the biggest flaw of them all that this game inhibits. It changes whoever plays the game as a person. For the worse. Why? Because the game inhibits 'addictive' qualities similar with that of jamming needles full with endorphin into your spine every half hour. It's painful, it hurts your emotional stability, it hurts you as a person and it hurts the people around you and for what? A small kick of pleasure/self satisfaction as you managed to win a fundamentally unbalanced game with an emphasis on gank above all else due to chance or otherwise pre-meditated 'pubstomping'? Not worth it in so many ways since at the end of the day, Dota 2 will never be fully balanced because Valve will be split between tournament-balances and casual or the 'normal' version of the game while repeatedly adding more and more content in the form of heroes.  I could keep on going with design flop after design flop but at the end of the day, this game is not worth anyone's time or dedication.'  With all this being said, I fully agree with the opinions articulated by this user and do NOT recommend this game as it is equivalent in an electronic sense to how alcohol and drug abuse would destroy psyches, lives, and families.

Warhammer total war - a game about beating hummies and getting crushed by dem fat dwarfs.  WH: TW is as of now a great game, with a medium rig (AMD 290) I manage to run ultra unit size, with everything else on ultra (still 60 fps). The game provides that huge varity in gameplay, but lack diversity in units for each faction (but thats why we got mods). While it´s lacking in diplomacy, as it´s quite hard for the orks to get good friends with anyone, but orks you are pretty limited to fighting and making sure you don´t loose every battle. This does lead to a big list of pros and cons, so I´ll do my best to get around all of them:  + Great preformance, already on launch (theres always someone, but you cant make everyone happy) + Straight forward in gameplay - just kill these guys and then kill some more.  + Easy for new players, no need to have Total war experience. + Mod support on release - made by modders like Magnar and Dresdner.  + Somewhat true to the lore and world of Warhammer. + overall great potentual for 'vs' or 'coop' campaign.   - Unit rooster is severly lacking! (Games workshop added what they had at the time on their webpage, but in-lore theres still tons of different units!  - obvious additions of a million future DLC´s - besides the obvious elephant in the room (Looking at you Chaos DLC) there will clearly be alot more of that to come; blood, factions and units will surely recieve a DLC in the future. - Campaign is as of now, abit short. There only two ways to win the game: short - capture two towns and destroy Chaos or long = dominate everything. - Lacking in replay-ability. Sure, you can play everyone, but with just 5/6 factions, you can only 'win' the game a certain amount of times before you done it all before. The victory conditions are also the same for each faction: same towns and destroy Chaos.   Alot of things will be fixed/added via mod support, but Sega and Games workshop will still delete those mods that will be future DLC´s, but surely we all understand the world of gaming as we live in, as of now not having DLC`s is just weird for every developer out there.   I got the game from a friend and not Sega, so no worries (I´m not paid to promote, sadly...).   All in all, I´ll give it a 5/7, it´s great, but not that great. If you want actual numbers = 7,5 / 10.

Summary:  A solid if somewhat unambitious addition to the TW series geared more towards new players.  Pros:  Well balanced, stable, a few new innovations.  Cons:  Many elements stripped down or removed from previous installments, suffers from TW's perennial issues of neurotic AI and an unbalanced endgame.  I've had a long, tumultuous relationship with the Total War series. From the processor melting release of Medieval II to the glory days of Shogun 2 I've stuck with it. After Rome II I swore I'd never buy one of their products at anything above bargain bin price, but like the siren song of Chaos I've fallen for Creative Assembly's wiles again and shelled out for my release week copy. Well, surprise surprise. I'm disappointed.  On the plus side, CA does seem to be learning from their mistakes. After the hot mess that was Rome II's release the team reigned in their ambitions and settled on a smaller, tighter experience. Siege attacks focus on a single wall 'segment', most unit armor and weapon upgrades have been jettisoned, and diplomacy has been whittled down to its barest essentials just to name a few areas they've put the screws to.  That's not to say there aren't real improvements here. A lot of the changes seem designed to shake up the samey game of 'smash your armored infantry blob into the enemy's face until their morale breaks' so many TW fights fall into. Magic has been added giving generals more offensive heft and lending more nuance to heroic abilities beyond simply spamming your buff buttons the second they recharge. Under the hood physics tweaks have drastically improved cavalry as well. Instead of stopping the moment they so much as tap an enemy horses will now plow into formations, or if the target is unfortunate enough to be loosely packed carve straight through them. Finally agents have been overhauled and can now fight in combat alongside your armies as little mini generals. I feel like CA really hit the mark on this one. They're strong and versatile enough to justify their presence in an army but not so overpowered that you would necessarily choose them over a good combat unit.  The problem is that even all that polish isn't enough to distract me from the essential truth. This is just another Total War game, with all the same issues that have plagued previous installments. Attempts to balance TW's old bugaboo of siege battles did make things more fair, but only barely and at the cost of some of the game's coolest looking set pieces. The AI is back to its old antics, attacking when it has no chance of winning and meandering around when it could. The endgame is similarly uneven. Depending where you are on the map the chaos invasion can be an existential threat or a positive benefit. I've had games where I was gearing up for the final epic confrontation only to find that the Imperials had already killed the chaos anti-christ and were well on their way to building tailoring workshops in hell. I mean it's nice to see that my allies had their ♥♥♥♥ together, but I was under the impression my attention was urgently required.  So all in all? It's progress. CA at least seem to be aware of the series' flaws and taken steps to fix them, even if it was a sort of stumbling half shuffle. If you're new to the Total War series and are looking for something to cut your teeth on Warhammer is a fine enough place to start. Likewise if you're a veteran TW player interested in the warhammer universe the borrowed concepts give a fresh enough buff to keep you interested for at least a playthrough or two. No doubt more DLC is already on the way, and in time Warhammer might be a truly worthwhile addition to the series, but I fear all that will be too little, too late.

review_text: I have played all the Total War games to date, missed most of the expansions though. Since about Rome 1 the total war games have been declining more and more. I thought it could not get worse than Rome 2, then this title came along. I fully supported moving over to Warhammer Fantasy, I didn't want to see Medievel Total War 16.   There is no content, sieges take far too long in about 100 turns I clicked next turn while sieging for about 80 of them. Missions need a complete overhaul and should not have made it in their present state past Beta Being given 4 turns to kill a general that is hunkered down in a walled city with a full stack and you are 2 turns away is pretty ludicrous and it happens far far too often.   There is more to this but I don't want to go into the problems with all the individual factions atm.

Although I'm putting this down as a 'Not Recommended', I'd like to say that I have enjoyed the game, to an extent. It is not all bad, and if it goes on sale for cheap then you could probably pick it up without feeling like you're wasting your money.  Paying full price, however, is definitely a waste. The game has a feeling of being not quite finished, not that there are a lot of bugs, just that it needed some more tweaks and polish before release.   Some units are useless (I'm looking at you, Dwarfen Slayers), hero/lord skill trees are boring, and using Magic feels weak and unsatisfying. I strongly suspect that the developers will, at some point, release an overhaul, brand it as 'Emperor Edition' (as they did with Rome 2) and use it as an excuse to charge a bit extra money.  The DLC is also a naked money grab, adding little to nothing of worth in spite of the price tag.  Warhammer plus Total War was every nerd's wet dream; it should have been a great game. Instead, it is merely an average one.

The game surely has some good graphics and cool features such as decapation and dismembering. But its playability changes from person to person in my opinion. It's about getting gud or quitting if you can enjoy the game from the beginning until you get level 16.   Basically after you get level 16 you are going to encounter a lot of tryhard people who have literally mastered the combat exploits. In time, as i mentioned you are going to have to choose between gitting gud or just simply quiting the game.   And apparently, people seem to quit.  Pros: - Good graphics. - Usually good to waste some time with your friends. - Wide variety of medival weapons and features.  Cons: - Too many bugs and exploits. - Clunky combat mechanics. - Poor hitboxes. - Cancerous community. - Runs poorly.

At the time of writing this review I only have 35 hours on record through Steam but I had originally downloaded this game outside of Steam a couple of years ago.  It's one that I play when the mood takes me but then can put it down and play other games, knowing that I can easily pick it up again.  Although the game has micro-transactions, you really don't need to spend real money on anything if you don't want to. It's one of the few 'free to play' games which I would say aren't 'pay to win'. Real money will get you faster progress but if you get into a fight with someone using the basic guns you start with, you have as good a chance as anyone with coming out on top!  The only thing I don't like about the game is that it can feel a bit clunky. This could be a latency issue considering the whole thing is online, but there have been times when I've been shot through a wall or when behind and I can only assume it is because the game is out of sync with the server.  Overall a great game to play, especially considering that it is free!!!

The basic premise of the story isn't that bad - dudes parachute into trouble and fight their way out - but the whole 'white boy saves the natives' thing was pretty lame. That said, story isn't really the appeal of this game. It's just damn good fun; exploring a beautiful island, racing cars and jetskis, flying hang-gliders and wing-suits, shooting bad guys, and blowing stuff up. One of the few games where I felt compelled to tick off all the achievements, simply because I enjoyed playing it so much I didn't want to stop even after completing all the main content. Highly recommended.

Pros: Lots of choices on how to decorate 1 of 4 classes. Voice commands are hilarious some of the time At times can suck you into the action Time killer Some skill required TKing is punished via a scoreboard Awesome soundtrack Combo swings and avoid getting hit is the name of the game  Cons: Crashes Plenty of players but no middleground on quality, the first 15 ranks are glorious, but once you leave, you'll be stuck with people who literally waste time for fun and not in the fun way. If you want to avoid the trolls and exploiters you can't go back to the noob servers either. Classes are imbalanced Vanguards are bad enough with long swords, why is their midsection unhittable midswing? Considering every hit tends to land where it's aimed, not only is this imbalanced, but the more it happens the more jarring it is. After going through all the effort to make it realistic, it then suffers from LOL, halflife style play where your sword is super heavy, but you can move your hitboxes out of the way via rotation. Team frustration: friendly fire is locked to on. There is no off. Wow pvp style arena points, which causes people to steal your kills and in the process usually screw everyone over Toxic community: Feint? Do well? Tk someone who hit you first? Votekick a tker? It all boils down to how many friends you have: might makes right. Unfortunatly, with a lack of decent servers, this can literally spell the end of fun while you wait for them to go away. Mutes don't carry across games Trying to find a good server at bad times will either end with you in a server with toxic people and no exp or kicked for ping. Why can't we go back to the scrub servers? Why can't we have a couple higher level ranked servers? Server owners are anal, which seems to be the case with every medieval fanatasy fan base. (why are these people into this fandom when they have no honor or history?) if you don't know them you're insta out. FFA servers suffer from friends teaming up. Objectives are either won or you're forced to watch bad players.  You can kick, you can't vote ban. You can avoid kicks. Sometimes TKing is encouraged by your team. (!!!) Your team, with FF on and an imperitive to kill steal, will jump in front of you and prevent you from helping or making you so frustrated you swing through them, losing 10 points.  Broken, inbalanced mechanics that with recent announcements leads one to believe this game has already peaked and won't recieve proper love to fix the problems, so don't expect help.   6 dollars for a single skin? Of course they're not going to list their DLC on steam, lest it see a sale, which even then wouldn't be reasonable until at least 50%. All characters have the same access to the same weapons, the only other ones just being frill skins, once again overpriced.  That being said, the DLC skins are well done, it's just too bad they won't see the light of day on steam or a proper bundle. The best you can get is 1 skin for both sides, but only for the vanguard and knight and all the obvious favoritism on those two alone is reason for pause if you think they'll fix the balance issue.  Games decent but broken and it's peaked.  DLC prices need to come down and skins need to be bundled realistically. Emphasis on realistically.   You CAN have fun with this game, but once you're past rank 15, good luck.  I'd really, really, really, like to recomend this game, just can't.  For how broken it is, the DLC prices that aren't listed on steam are just a slap in the face. Stop making dlc and fix the game.  The sound track dlc is a steal though, Pick that up.   ...this game, unless it's fixed, is not exactly something I'd lead the Steam consoles era off with with, Gabe...

Without the additional content it's fairly bare boned with limited units and army strategy. This kind of '20% of the game upfront, the other 80% in paid installments' is a tragedy. The capitalist in me acknowledges the profit gained, but the love I have for warhammer and story immersion is torn apart when critical pieces are missing. It's like buying a book with random pages missing, only to have to go buy them 3 months later.

A nice rts strategy game that is FTP. It has no feature where you HAVE to buy thing things to continue playing, which is quite common it ftp games, but it has a nice shop (similar to TF2) where you can customize your heroes. Valve has provided a varierty of heroes to try out and lets you see who fits you best. It also doesn't make the game boring. There is some over-powered heroes (in my opinion). Combos between heroes and their abilities also provide enjoyment, expecially in parties.  The thing I don't like about Dota 2 is the hud size and some of the community. What I mean is, 'Report Drow because she noob' or 'Report Sniper because he op.' Some people are rude in chats and abuse the report feature. The hud size kind off effects the gameplay when you are trying to escape.  Something to add aswell; You had to pay to get this game, then it converted in an ftp. Thank you, Valve! Overall, I greatly enjoy this game and you should try it out aswell!

CLICKER HEROES:  I CAN'T BELIEVE THEY STILL MAKE THESE Clicker Heroes is Cookie Clicker clone no. 2646953, in the sense that it's gameplay revolves entirely around clicking on an idle object until another idle object is satisfied that the first idle object has been clicked enough. After a little while of this the game presents you with an idle object that takes arguably longer to click away because the idle object that checks your clicking has sodded of the the Winchester for a couple of pints with the lads. This game is boring. Painfully boring. And I mean literally, my left finger hurts. This game is more likely to progress your arthritis than it is to progress itself. After my 5 minutes of seldomity and boredom, I quit out (via Alt+F4 because it has no pause menu, quit button, etc) and did a little research. It turns out that Clicker Heroes is a flash game released onto various flash game sites until it somehow got ♥♥♥♥ onto greenlight, which then re-♥♥♥♥ it onto my Discover list. It's literally a single .exe created most likely using a .swf to .exe converter, if I had to guess. It's lazy. It's surprisingly glitchy. And it's given me stiff fingers.  Clicker Heroes gets a Medical Bill out of 10.

Good game with worst system rules ever made. The report system is broken and developers knows about it, just not doing anything about it. For example CSGO. If you get reported, you will go to the overwatch when casual players determine if you were behaving bad or cheating. If not, you are without penalty. If they think you were cheating you will get VAC control. If VAC finds anything you will get banned. So basicaly, there is someone in real life that sees the play yoou were reported in. For example, you want to play some hero and even showed and told the team before they made the move, they ignore you and then flame you for picking the hero anyway.. No. So, if you love DotA, you may try go back to old DotA game (W3 version).   And I will not write here about racist Russians, whos picking EU servers and yet not respecting the language. Planetside 2, in all honesty, has a good concept to it; you are on a planet, running around trying to capture specific key points for planetary resources as you play 1 of 3 of the factions that no one really cares about. This would be good, but there are numerous problems. It suffers a ridiculous amount from being pay to win and grinding for things is laughable, as the monetary amounts make Tribes items look like a walk in the park. I tried it for about 20 minutes, and all we did was hold in one position and literally run into an area and try to get 1 tiny piece of the area to actually 'win'.  Gameplay wise, its a basic FPS. There's nothing really spectacular about it that other games haven't done already or do better. The style of combat boils down to whoever can enmass the more overpowered equipment on one team at a time wins, and half the time you will spend more ingame time humping your way across the field to last about 20 seconds in the fighting area. It simply isn't a game that you can jump in and be on a decent even footing. The whole game reminds me of the Sleeper encounter from Everquest.    Its cool for a bit, but its just like many games in this day and age; all fur coat and no knickers.

I love the idea of this game, I love the animations and made some machinima movies out of it, The sound is great, the animations are great. The maps are awesome.  Its just a bit limited. After quite a few hours I have hit a wall of cba.  The ladder system is a mess. 1v1,2v2,3v3,4v4 there is no demarcation, there is no win loss stats to check, there is no monthly reset, the poor multiplayer experience makes me cross ><  After all isnt that the flippen point of warhammer >< multiplayer ><  It is really easy to burn through content in multiplayer and then your left with broken balance issues.   Thank goodness for the mod scene, some amazing mods, I particularly like regiments of renown idea to address some of the obvious balance issues. Why cant this be included in the real game.  multiplayer support is pretty dire, no mods allowed so that really limits the multiplayer experience.  DLC policy is a bit lame / greedy,  I just get the feeling that CA doesnt care about multiplayers much.  So that leaves single player which I am personally not interested in.  The magic system is basic and lame,   the lack of hero equipment is really poor in multiplayer, no mitigation items to counter hero snipe.  Get used to 2 shot hero snipe at the start of multiplayer battles. (dont remember that in any fantasy movies)  It might be worth getting when all the dlc is released and its on sale.

Lets start by saying, the mixed review you see up top, the reason your reading these reviews, is due to Total War Historical fans. I love the Total war series, but Creative Assembly taking things into fantasy was the best move they could have made.  From a very generic view, this game is great! Its is well optimized, it has AMAZING replayability, graphics are very good, the lore/stories are incredible, Warhammer lore is pretty in-depth. Ui and sound are great. If you have played a Total War game before you know Creative Assemblies DLC marketing strat, they release game, then several DLC that seem like big chunks of 'original' game. This strat is my biggest gripe. But that doesnt make the game bad, the marketing could use some tweaking but the game itself is outstanding! And most importantly, its FUN the gameplay is FUN, the story is FUN and the lore is FUN.  Graphics 9/10 Optimization 9/10 Sound 10/10 Replayabilty 100/10 DLC marketing strat 3/10 lol Overall a great game you will enjoy if you like Grand Stratagy and RTS. Overall score 9.5/10

Do you like playing 40 minute-long matches which are decided in the first 5 minutes with no way to concede? Do you prefer mercilessly ambushing vastly outnumbered opponents to fair fights based on ability and tactics? Would you like to participate in a community so toxic that it gives PTSD to hardened Counter Strike veterans? If you've answered 'yes' to any of these questions, then DOTA 2 is the game for you!  To fully enjoy the DOTA 2 experience, remember these tips:  1. When you've been getting your ♥♥♥ handed to you the entire match you should give (read: scream) helpful reminders on how the guy with the better K/D ratio is playing the game wrong.  2. Everyone on your team exists to sacrifice themselves to your benefit. If a support doesn't rush in and commit suicide against an entire enemy team despite giving them gold and experience by doing so, you need to tell them that they are playing the game wrong. You, and you alone, must survive.  3. Don't forget to start every match with 'mid or I feed.'  Do not play this game.

Clicker Heroes Review      Overview   Clicker Heroes has came a long way, and is still my favourite clicker game to date. But sadly I cannot and will not recommend this game to anyone with a brain.  The Big issue with this game now is how pricey the in-game shop is, to buy things in this shop you must aquire something called a 'ruby' and this ruby is expensive but the amount of rubies you need to buy something is also expensive the issue is the devs have introduced something called an auto clicker which is a hack you can buy in-game for an arm and a leg through again rubies now the going rate for this 'auto clicker' is 100 rubies and to buy 100 rubies is 10$ which is a copy of Fallout 3 or the Metro bundle on halloween. You can aquire enough rubies in-game to buy everything fairly spending no money..... If the auto clickers didint go up 50 rubies for each one you buy and the so called auto clicker can only be bound to one thing at a time which means to have it do what they say you would need more than one, which by going up by 50 each time you buy one makes it to where anyone who doesint spend money in this game get's ♥♥♥♥ed after the first 2 ones you buy, and the dlc for the zombie auto clicker skin is also 10$ and only gives you one auto clicker with it, so basicly if you buy the dlc you get a free skin and a auto clicker both very simple things that require no effort to make. But the devs want 10$ for it and not to mention the skin is a poorly made dull zombie hand with no extra added special effects to make it in anyway shape or form worth the money. The devs want to charge crazy amounts of money for hardly any reward and for that this game went from a 8/10 to a 3/10.  I did not go into deep detail because well, this is a clicker game. Grand Theft Auto on a tropical island! I picked this one up for under $10 in a holiday sale after watching a friend play. Not normally my kind of game, the closest I've gotten to is Skyrim or GTA3.  The game is a lot more linier than I expected which is a bit of a let down, once you start a mission you are pretty much stuck until you complete it. I guess this is a lot like GTA3 was, but that game is old now, and these days I expect better. There is also a lack of choises as you progress through the plot, which is something else we're used to with Mass Effect and Skyrim. At times it felt like I was being dragged through the story rather than watching it.  The biggest problem though is Uplay, you have to sign up with it to play and if you're not online you get a lot of nag screens asking you to connect. You would have thought Steam provided all the DRM the game needed without having to deal with Uplay as well.  Over all though this game is great fun for under a tenner and if you can get it on sale it's worth a look.

While Chivalry is a great game that makes first person slasher combat possible, I can't recommend it to anyone. You never know when they'll release the next patch that will make the game unplayable for certain users. I'm talking about players with overkill gaming machines, these are not a hardware issues.   Bottom line: Great game, but Torn Banner Studios have a lost a customer for life with their lack of techinical support in the wake of unplayable updates.   Hopefully a company with more $ and sense can steal their combat system and build a game with a better engine, more variety, and some programming ability.

Why i don't like the game:  First of all and most important, this is not NOT not NOT a team game. Why?   -The game structure and meta is focused on making one player fed and then he carries his team to victory.  -Supports have to stay far away from the other team mate in the lane they share because this way only the other guy will have the full experience from cs(if both stay together, they will have the exp shared between them, so this means that they both can fall behind fast compared to the other team). (and don’t even dream on touching the cs of the guy. As if the toxicity of most players wasn’t enough, you have to only have fun in this game without taking part of the action for the most part of the laning phase. Pffffttttt. Can this be more stupid as it is? Yes. Just continue reading)  -Only one player can buy wards. Yup. The same guy that has to sit on his thumb since the beginning of the game.  • Other gameplay mechanics:  Controlling the currier is frustrating, especially when you want an item and he is going to grab something for another player. You have to wait. And then you have to be positioned in a way that the currier will not get killed by the enemy. As if you can control that (ex: when you are getting killed because of a gank in the same moment that the currier arrives. o.0)  There is a secret store. As if buying wasn’t a frustrating experience for new players. This store has some recipe items for the most OP higher rank items. Good luck understanding that in the tutorial or in the actual custom item build section of the game were they don’t show you the recipes.  You are close to victory and just destroyed the inner turret of mid lane. Then you see 2 melee barracks and2 ranged barracks and 4 other structures. I only ask why? Why so many useless stuff between me and my team mates victory?  River runes. Random spawned runes that give various bonuses. It’s a rush game for them. They cannot actually be contested. It’s” just pick me up” and you will have a stupid game mechanic that sometimes can be OP (if you find the double damage). I think it’s stupid and it doesn’t favor the good players.  Hey look. I’m with low HP and I need some health. Ohhhhhhhhh. I know. I’ll eat a tree. -.-‘  Loosing gold after death. As if cs was an easy task. Let me explain. You are playing a ranged champ. And you see a low hp minion. You think: ok since I am low level I’ll hit it only when he is really low. Yeaaaaahhhhhh. My bullet took 15 years to travel to him, so now I have to try to approach the cs with so much anticipation that even the enemy will know what I’m trying to do, and now they can hit me for free every freaking time. And now another fun game mechanic for noobs: I’m dead and my item is there for grabs (only some higher “ranked” items). Hahahaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa.  Glyph of fortification: omg. Really? Is this a good thing? Protecting structures for a short period of time. This combined with some other stuff makes the game last longer than it should (in conjunction with players being afraid of being killed by the enemy fed player, being afraid of stealing kills, afraid of stealing creep score, of dying and droping items and being flamed at because you are a noob (even if you play the game for like 1000 years). The game is actually boring because it lasts too long. It’s unrewarding from beginning to end and a frustrating experience, and more so for new players that have to learn all this stupid stuff that is totally questionable if it’s good for the game or not. Other moba game players look at this and say: DAMN BITCCCCHHHH. FK THIS CRRRAAAAAP. (vomit)  Speaking of vomit. Rushan drops a cheese. (not a wood(y). But at least I beg some coherence in this crap. Why food when players can eat wood?)   • Some small things I think that ruin the game  Buy teleport scrolls. With what space in the inventory? The same space I need to have my recipe components of the item I want and potions and my wood(y) eating crapp? Ohhhhh. Ok.  Learning the jungle creeps. Some of them are not affected by skills from champs. Can this game be more boring and slower? I can’t even use my skills? Really? Damn.  Learning the champions. Yeah. Good luck on that noob. Learning all of them will take weeks (at least to understand what they do when you face them in the enemy team). There isn’t any good info on how to play them or to make item builds for them (try the in game item build and you will cry) it’s just looking at people doing things and no actual guide on how and why (DOTA players do this on purpose, so they can rub on noobs faces that this game is much complicated that LOL. Yes it is. It’s too much stupid useless stuff on it. It doesn’t make any sense. When they say that more skill is needed for this game it’s a lie. This game is slower. You have time to think, and dream, and take a bath, and kiss your girl, and then you fail the last hit on the cs. But if you get unlucky (vs a more experienced guy) you will die. Yup. Tadaaaaaaaaa. The same as any other game. Pfffttttt. Duhhhh. And face rolling (in the key board) is slower. Even that is boring. Jesus. Being hit by the crowd control skill that lasts for 5 years will make you die (eventually, I hope), and this is why this game is ruthless on mistakes. Ohh wait. One stun that needs no skill to hit (it isn’t a skill shot) and lasts 5 years is another reason why dota players say that this game is ruthless and needs more skill than other mobas. Yup, fk logic.  All “high rank items” are freaking expensive. Why? They know that this game will take too freaking long, and it will be no fun, then they make you suffer to get a full build before the game ends. DOTA2 devs say: suffer biiiitttttccccctcheeeesssssss.  When you win a game, you will earn some random useless (immediately useless. Maybe useful later, I don’t care) stuff that you can blender with some other useless stuff, so you can get one random useless thingy, and there are ways to take advantage of this, like special recipes or whatever (another thing to look at in guides and make you waste more time looking for stuff on the internet and not appreciating a good gaming time). This is a must for me: a big effort (trying to win games) just to get one random stuff that isn’t going to make my game experience better. Essentially, no rewards. Wow, nice.  Denying. Omg. Denying cs. Hahahahaha. The enemy will earn exp because you killed your own minion. Fk logic. This is another reason that the freaking game is so boring and takes too long. And to add pain to injury: suicide. Hahahahahahahahaha. This one just killed me. You can actually deny your death to the enemy team. Ok, listen carefully. I will only play this game if they make one item I just came up with. The item is a strapon, and it’s called U.R.ACuuuUNnnnT. this item could be activated when team members have less than 75% HP, and it will kill then instantly and has no cooldown what so ever. This is actually the only thing that is missing from this game to make it totally fked up. And another: an item that denies the cs denial. And can deny the deny from the deny that was denyed in the first place. How about that for a mind fk.    Overall, the game looks bad in my opinion (it reminds me of Diablo 2 graphics but in hd and polished), its slow, unrewarding, it’s not a team game, lots of toxic players, the game has an individual ranking system (in a fk ing team game!!!! Wut?). It’s bad like the most known mobas.  You want to kill your brain cells. Try this game. It will make you angry and you will lose the perception of what a fun “thing” is in real life. I've enjoyed this game for a long time now. It was the first game I have ever bought on steam and is the main reason I came to steam in the first place, but after playing close to 230 hours of this game I cannot recommend it. Lets break this into Pros and Cons.  Pros: -This game has an amazing combat system unlike any other game. It is increadibly fun to learn and takes time to master. -Large variety of well done maps that really give of a medievaly atmosphere. -The Ingame voices are fun. (Expecially taunting) -There are multiple gamemodes. -It has a good community... sometimes. -There are servers for new players (Rank 15 and under) -Graphics are pretty cool. -Large but limited variety of weapons. -Lots of content on the steam workshop for this game.  Thats about it for the Pros...  Cons: -Very Buggy. Developers put more time into adding cosmetics than fixing very irritating bugs that have been in the game for a very long time. -There are two types of people that play this game, Newcomers, and Veterans, nothing in between, so it eathier going to be too easy or way too hard. -The community is sometimes pretty toxic. This doesn't mean you won't find nice players but a large amount of them are just straight-up ***holes. -Rank 15 and under serves is pretty much a compitition to see who can swing their sword the most and the fastest. -Most high rank players use an exploit called dragging. This takes away from the realisim of the game aswell as makes it impossible for new playes to adapt to the game. The high ranked players also refuse to recognize this as an exploit.  -As soon as you turn to rank 16 you are put with players of upwards to rank 40+ (Balancing is non-existent in this game) This results in a very steep learning curve, which, dont get me wrong, is not a bad thing, but it's just not for some people. -Gamemodes such as Team Objective and Team Deathmatch are usually stacked, meaning that one team usually has the majority of the high ranks and the other team has low ranking players. (Just imagine a group Sumo Wrestlers going against some really nerdy kids) Only if you're lucky you will find a balanced server. -This game is as optimized as a potato. You better have a good computer if you want to play this. -The community is dwindling fairly quickly. When I started playing there was on average around 5000 people playing at a time, now its around 1500 on a good day. -(For me personally) once I unlocked all of the weapons, the game started to go downhill. There was no challange or objective while playing.  Just a Few side notes: -Don't get this game if you have anger management problems... just don't. -Don't get this game if you do not have a very good computer... It will run like absolute cow dung. -Get this game only when it's on sale... whatever you do, do not pay $25 for this. It's really not worth it. -Get this game if you are going to play with frends. If you're going solo, you're gonna have a bad time. -If you do get this game, never play after 11:00pm... Thats when all the super tryhards come out of their caves.  Peronal Note: Don't get me wrong here, I absolutly loved this game. There were lots of good times to be had with friends when I first started. There is just simply too much wrong with this game for it to be enjoyable anymore. But at the end of the day, it's up to you if you want the game. Go on and check out some other reviews and compare them to mine and see if you notice a common theme.  Also if you are thinking about commenting with something along the lines of dragging. Don't, you might get some of your nerd sweat in your keyboard, and we wouldn't want that now would we.

This game is perfection among the small MMOFPS realm's players. It bridges the gap between shooting things and 3,000 player servers, while looking beatiful in the process.  I've played this game since beta. A lot has changed, but on the other hand, a lot hasn't. The large scale combat -- more than 500-person battles -- is the same. What has changed are the people participating in it. A few months after release, you now find small (or large) Clans, aka. 'Outfits,' the concept is the same. You cannot play this game without finding a group of people to play with. It thrives on massive numbers, solo'ing will not get you anywhere. It's not difficult, almost every server has a couple Outfits recruiting.   The gun mechanics are simply amazing, though it does have it's buggy moments. The customization is in-depth and costly, as to get an attachment you're going to have to sit down and play for at least an hour at once. They counter this by making it worthwhile: all of the attachments are good. There is no 'bad' attachment.   Doing all of this and more, the graphics are simply astounding, assuming you have the hardware to run it. I run a 7970 @ 1100/1500 Core/Memory respectively, and an i5 3570k @ 4.4 and still struggle to get 60fps @ 1600x900. This is a very intensive game on both the GPU and the CPU, so you're not going to be getting away with an i3 3220 by any means.   Best of all, it's free to play, so there's no reason not to try it. See you on the battlefield.

This game is good. It can be very, very grindy at times, but overall it is an extremely enjoyable experience that you do not have to pay a cent to really get the atmosphere of a 90+ man TR rush on your last base before the warpgate. Your outfits on NC ally up. KAIN is formed. I was a member of the 301st airborne division. Our job was to scout out what was ahead of us, and ground pound the hell out of everything we saw. Needless to say, we ended up locking that continent within two hours that fateful wednesay. Due to a guy who will know who he is (SAHADES, not his name, but very similiar), we manage to co-ordinate, the Germans, French, English speaking air units to help the convoy of sunderers and Vanguards and Lightning Skyguards littered across the landscape. If you want to judge visuals, then look at my screenshot library. With a powerful PC, this game can look absolutely stunning. The backdrop of the moon with lasers lighting up the sky in front of a moonlit tree gives me shivers down my spine.   The development team is also excellent, and everyone there is very, very willing to listen to complaints and are extremely dedicated (Sony invested a lot of money into this).

Ok so this game get's a lot of hate for having a toxic community and exploiters everywhere.  I haven't played this game much (by my standards) but this has the best medieval combat I've ever seen, and the parry/riposte system can lead to interesting situations, like for instance I was playing as a Man-at-Arms, my main playstyle, and I had made my way to the enemy lines with an enemy knight chasing me, I then took down an archer who was harrasing my team and turned to face my pursuers, which by this time had becoem two knights. I then got into a swordfight with the two fully armed knights, holding my own and slaying one before they got help.  The situations that can happen can make you feel like a legitimate knight, fighting for his life, which is very thrilling.  9/10, for amazing medieval combat.

Warhammer: Total War is pretty cool, I guess.  Set in the grim dark future of the 41st Millennium, mankind has spread throughout the galaxy thanks to the leadership of the Emperor of Mankind and his Space Marines. But Horus, his most favored son, betrayed the Emperor and began a war known as the Horus Heresy. The Emperor defeated Horus, but was injured and force to-   What? Warhammer FANTASY?   Oops.   Set on a fantasy world where war is constant. The Empire, formed by the great Sigmar thousands of years ago, is beset on all sides by legions of the undead, the endless Green tide of Orcs, and the ruinous powers of Chaos. Now with the End Times before them, Emperor Karl Franz must unite the Empire of Man, while the grudge-keeping Dwarves of the eastern mountains must prepare for not only the Green Tide, but threats from the north as well.   Warhammer: Total War is another game in the long running Total War series, but stands out as one of the first licensed total war games. Warhammer and Total War together kind of feels like a match made in heaven, but you can still pretend it's historical if you're a purist if you sniff as much glue as I do.   You can play as a number of factions such as.  The Empire: Humans who make up for their short comings by shooting you in the face.  Orcs: Green brutes who overwhelm their enemies with numbers and giant monsters.  Vampire Count: Powerful vampires and necromancers who command thousands of spooky skeletons and goofy looking undead monsters who all conveniently forgot how to use a bow.  And who could forget best girl: The Dwarves, short angry men with amazing beards who will never forget that you didn't hold the elevator for them. NEVER. FORGET.   There are also two DLC factions that cost money because you and I are both chumps as well as a free DLC faction that nobody cares about because they aren't playable in campaign.   Warriors of Chaos: Larger, angrier, spikier humans who take candy from babies and then eat said baby.   Beastmen: Large goat men who's panties are constantly in a bunch and are capable of hiding thousands of goat men behind a single tree.   And Bretonnians: Losers.    Each campaign has it's own play style and require their own set of strategies to overcome your foe. Or you can just spam handgun units and pretend you're playing Empire: Total War again, I'm not going to judge.  Okay, I'll judge a little.   There are two modes of play, a turn based campaign mode where you build your empire, your armies, and set off to conquer foreign lands in the name of whatever lord you decided you wanted a hug pillow of. And the real time strategy element where you command said armies into battle and watch them slap each other with comically oversized axes and swords.   They're both very competent, but that's expected from the series at this point. There's enough detail in building up your provinces and managing both money and your armies to give the campaign mode a lot of weight, and the free-flowing nature of campaigns themselves means you can write your own narrative for whatever war you fight. Combat is also pretty competent, but also kind of predictable. The Enemy calvary will always flank and the infantry will always try to rush the high ground if they can. Calvary flanking is of course, expected, but sometimes I just kind of put my army into the corner of the map where they can't go around and they still try to sneak around the sides. Bless their little hearts.   There are a few things about the game that really bumbles my jumbles, though. The battles are over a little too quickly, town development is too simple, sieges are underwhelming, castles walls act like frigging gatling guns, diplomacy barely works, and I sometimes feel that the A.I is cheating me by churning out units that they shouldn't be able to get. And the Vampire Count's corruption expands so slowly I may as well play an actual game of Warhammer in the meantime.   There was also a gripe about certain races only being able to occupy certain areas, but that is actually dealt with in a mod. Still, it's not in the base game, so I still have to wag a finger at it and call it a jerk.   I also don't agree with Creative Assembly's (or Sega's) DLC plan for the game. It almost feels like you bought the basic package for one of those toy-based video games like Skylanders or Disney's whatjamacallit. The base game is fine on itself, but I feel like other people would feel cheated since there are a few things that should be in the game that was clearly taken out for DLC purposes.   But should you play Battlewrench: Absolute Fight?   Well I certainly like it over a few other Total War games. The game is competent for a Warhammer game and there's enough variety in the factions to keep you coming back for some time. I would like to see more custom options for the campaign mode and maybe a little more customization for armies themselves like maybe an army painter or a general/hero customize option. Also, are we ever getting avatar warfare from Shogun 2 back? It wasn't perfect, but it was a neat little metagame for multiplayer.   I would say pick it up, but maybe not at full price, considering they're DLC policy they apparently seem to live by.   Warhams: Total war gets 9 disgruntled dwarves out of 4 gods of Chaos.   Warhammer Fantasy doesn't really exist anymore. Now we have golden space marines with giant hammers.   The Curator:  http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Dickbuttexperience#curation

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: Fallout 3 was born out of Interplay's sordid history. Black Isle had already created it's own version of Fallout 3 that was never sold. Instead Interplay sold off the rights of Fallout to Bethesda who made this version on Oblivion's engine.  As much as I rag on Fallout 3 I have to acknowledge that Bethesda really went above and beyond with how well they did their homework. Most of the subtle 1950's satire was replicated extremely well with this game. Adding to that they decided to set it in D.C. to have creative control which was an excellent idea in my opinion. It allowed for unique locations like Little Lamplight, the Dunwich building and the Oasis.   However where my complaints start mostly have to do with the plot and the gameplay. For starters the main quest is moralistic garbage, painting the protagonist with the broadest brush possible as either the savior of humanity or the antichrist. The gameplay was also very video-gamey. With enemies taking a full 10 bullets to the face and still not dying.  There are mods that fix most of my complaints besides the plot. Even still when New Vegas came out 2 years later I found it fixed all the problems I saw with F3. Regardless, Fallout 3 is still a very enjoyable experience. Just not a perfect one.  http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=11214131

I tried to like this game, I really did, I saw youtube videos about this game, and thought it looked very good, but never bothered to get it cause I'm stingy, so when my friend offered me a free copy I said yes. Now I feel bad for him cause he has wasted a copy on me, I actually hate this game, the hit detection is boasted about in videos yet in practice it plainly sucks, I'll be right in someones face using one of the longer weapons in the game, when i go to swing at them I don't seem to hit them, hit detection is laughably horrid in this game.  The graphics are decent, the maps are good, the game modes are great! However these are let down by awful animations and the lack of entertainment value, combat is dumb, no strategy is required, all you have to do is hit first (if you can even hit at all), only 2 of the 4 classes are useful, controls are horrible and for some reason the mouse on the menu has input lag which really pisses me off, yet somehow the camera in game has no input lag what so ever. Also someone please direct me to the brainless idiot who decided that it's a good idea to let both team change their armour to the colour black, when you see a guy in black you don't know if they are friend or foe until you hover your cursor over them and check the colour of their name at the bottom, and sometimes you aren't in the position to be able to, so you won't know if they are an enemy until it's too late.  To top it all off, I get mad at this game cause of how laughable it is and how hard it trys to be a good game then ends up falling on its face, this game has a great feeling to it, until you start playing, then you just want to quit after a few minutes.  I tried to give this game a chance, I gave it 5-6 hours to try and give me a reason to stay, but It failed and I've simply uninstalled it, and I'll never play it again.   I give this game 2/10 simply because it fails to impress, with the only good features being the well designed maps and the variety of game modes. Thank god I didn't have to pay for this pile of crap.

It's a fun game - except for 'dragging.'  Dragging is a technique described by the developers themselves wherein a player moves his mouse to delay (or accelerate) the hitbox of the weapon contacting the hitbox of the target.  Once you run into this mechanic being abused by higher level players  with scripts and/or ridiculous mouse sensitivity settings ...  It's just no fun anymore.  Nice try, Torn Banner Studios, but  this single issue ruins an otherwise great game.

I would like to start this review by saying everyone is entitled to an opinion. You are allowed to like or not like something or you can feel a certain way about the game or anything for that matter. I would also like to say that anyone is allowed to write a review no matter what kind of game you like action fps, strategy, or whatever. I am not a MOBA guy but like everyone else I have the right of press. Now if you don't like that to bad cry me a river.   What should I say about dota? Basically it’s boring. I’m sorry valve for this. I am a big fan but this is just not fun at all! It’s boring nothing new here nothing original. The only thing good to come out of this is the different characters. I found some amusing with little bits of laugh and nothing really special though. A lot are also rip offs of LOL (league of legends). I haven't played much LOL but I do have done my homework on it and know LOL came first before DOTA 2. I'm not a MOBA guy because I find them boring and I think it’s more fun to be in the action with lots of different cool things happening.   This I do not recommend even to the hardcore valve players because valve has mostly been doing fps and not really a whole lot else. The game is also very unoriginal. There are so many games like this and it's all the same thing destroy this then this and that it gets old. It did add some interesting twist but nothing amazing. Now you could say this is the same deal with first person shooters. It is a lot. Lots of fps now days are shoot this guy then capture this flag blah blah blah, but if you pick the right fps you can get fun gameplay, story narrative, maps, good multiplayer with fun twist. Also too many mircotransactions in DOTA 2.   It’s not exactly pay to win but it's really annoying have BUY THIS BUY THAT shoved in my face. Also graphics are not good. I do understand the graphic limitations of the source engine but really valve, Half-life 2 A GAME FROM 2004 LOOKS SO MUCH BETTER! Titanfall runs on a slightly modified version of source and looks better.   Also the game has lots of bugs. Lots of different things like clipping through objects random death. Also the learning curve is very very very hard! You will die a lot and it will take a lot of hours (more than mine) to get even just okay.   The bots are also very very hard and O.P. The game is also very unbalanced. I keep getting stuck with a bunch of bad players against good ones. Also the servers are screwed up. (IM NOT A RACIST) When you join a US server I want US players because of the LANGUAGE BARRIER (Told you I'm not racist!) I love Russians I think they are funny but when we need to communicate but when I can't understand them that sucks.   Also almost everyone you meet is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ bag. Everyone’s like GO (insert Harmful suggestion here) yourself. I'm gunna (insert Harmful suggestion here) your (insert Harmful suggestion here) you can't (insert Harmful suggestion here) for weeks. Yeah not the best of people.  Also a quick personal story involving DOTA 2. They are one of the most toxic communities I have ever met. When I made a post saying I wasn't a fan of the game and asked other people how they felt about it I was immediately struck with horrific comments. Such as, kill yourself, your'e ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, you should have been aborted, you must have been dropped on your head as a baby, and many more things that are very illegal to say to other people.  The short is boring unoriginal and it’s not fun with your friends unless you are constantly cracking jokes which is hard during a mind numbingly boring game. So don’t waste your time with this and just do something else like half-life or another valve game.It’s not good (the trailer is also misleading).

Baring the initial release bug which made the game hang up at the splash screen (6 hours for a fix, quick turn around and lots of engagement from CA devs on the subreddit), the game is working great! This has to be the most optimised Total War game to date and also the most diverse in both units and factions. Additionally, the Vampiric and Chaotic corruptions along with Empire confederation (Dwarf/Greenskin can also) have added a new strategic level to the campgain map.  Some systems like 'food' have been completely removed which in my opinion, opens the game up for a lot more fun. There is very little need to 'balance' your provinces like previous games. At most, I found myself building only max tier 3 buildings in small settlements as they cannot buil tier 4 and 5 (where the really cool stuff is!) which is fine.  So far, battles seems to be too fast, but I suspect this will either be patched soon OR a mod will be released to fix this issue.   As a long time Total War fan and fan of Warhammer, this game hits all the spots and I can certainly recomend it if you like these genres!

This game ♥♥♥♥ing sucks. The only reason you should get this is if you want anxiety problems and severe anger issues. My winrate may be around 50/50, but in a ratio of decent matches and good matches to a 'normal' match (which is not good) is probably 10/90. I have never been in a game where: -Everyone speaks english on the us servers -Someone willingly supports and buy wards, courier, and doesnt take all the kills on purpose -Someone abuses their mic with loud and ♥♥♥♥♥♥ music Also someone disconnects every other game and usually dont come back.  AND dont even get me started on ranked. You expect it to be better, like getting a phone upgrade. NO. The enemy team picks axe and meepo, and you lost 8/10 starting matches. My starting MMR was 1200, and even after like 50 more ranked matches it hasnt moved. 1200s. There is no cooperation in this 'teamwork' game, and people rarely communicate. After a while I installed League of Legends, and it was really easy compared to Dota. Turns out it was, and everyone who has played both MOBAs agrees that Dota is more difficult and complicated. I still play both but the only reason YOU should get this game is if you want to get a head start for League. Not saying that it is better; both games and pros and plenty of cons, but Dota has more cons in the community, not the game. Everyone is a ♥♥♥♥ (including me) and probably the harshest group of people ever. Imagine Call of Duty with only 10 year olds, but with less racism and they cant speak english. Overall, this game gave me cancer, and you shouldnt play any MOBAs. Just get some indie games or any other Valve games, but after you read this you'll probably end up watching somone else play games on Youtube.

I would like to congratulate CA on its impressive work on this piece of art.  Putting past titles aside, This game is close to a masterpiece.  Epic battles, Dragons, Giants, Cannons and Pikemen this game is just amazing, The graphics are an absolute wonder as well as the scale of said battles.  When playing as the Empire you can feel the 'realistic' side of warfare, With swords, crossbows, cannons and cavalry, While on the other hand playing as the Vampires or Orcs is completely a different story.  Quest battles are amazing too, Gets you in-depth of the story of each leader, But putting that aside its battles are great.  I've only played a little, But i've plunged myself into every content just out of curiosity, still haven't played that much of the campaign, but i know it holds so much content.  A word of advice, If you have really poor graphics card, Hold off buying this, Save your money for a better card, Afterwards buy it to experience the full thrust of this game.

This game seems as if it would be fun for its 'so bad it's good' nature, and there are perhaps moments of enjoyment which can be brought forth from experiencing the zaniness within. However, the central gimmick this game relies on, being a purposefully broken, buggy game, falls short of being anything more than a mere novelty worthy of no more than a brief period of attention.  The ultimate problem comes not with the joke becoming old fast, however, though that is still a problem. The real problem is the lack of truly having anything to do. In this game, you can wander around and headbutt things and lick things and maybe use an item or two found around the world you wander through. Every once in a while you may discover some new ability, but the abilities don't refresh any replay value the game could've had since the abilities are typically something like becoming stronger, a feat which is entertaining for approximately two seconds.  Besides lacking in meaningful character advancement, the other central problem is the size of the worlds you occupy. I've not played the DLC (and I'd rather not bother), but the overall size of the base game is quite minuscule, as if even the developers were unsure of how they could keep a game like this interesting enough for so long without adding some new tacky, inane gimmick in their DLC. It's small even for ten dollars (thankfully I paid far less), so I don't recommend, if you dare bother, picking this up for that price.  This game is a clear case of 'it's not so bad it's good, it's just bad.' People lapped it up easily due to the 'so bad it's good' label anyway, what with this game becoming easy fodder for people on YouTube to flail about like goons while they giggle and chort over the most mundane occurences within the game. This game, more than anything, readily showcases a major problem within video games, the dumbing down of content and willingness to accept ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. This game is not the worst I've played, since I will give it some slack for at least trying to some extent, but I still would strongly consider this a candidate as one of the worst video games ever.

Left my positive review up for a long time, in honour of all the fun this game once gave me - but I recently uninstalled it, because ♥♥♥♥ it. High-level play is simply not fun - it's based around mechanics exploits. Some will argue whether they are 'exploits' and that's fine - but the fact remains they are NO FUN. Even when the servers seem well-balanced, 99% of team objective games involve one side completely stomping the other. It's vaguely kind of enjoyable when you are the stomper the first few times, but eventually anyone who actually enjoys gaming will long for the rare *close* matches, whether they win or lose them. Once in a blue moon, you really do get a magnificent match - two skilled teams grinding away at each other, neither one utterly dominated by spinners and clanfolk, slowly giving and losing ground, until it comes down to a frantic 1-minute count on the final objective -- and when that happens, it honestly doesn't matter who wins, the game is so much fun for everyone. But those games have gotten rarer and rarer and rarer as the community has gotten worse and worse and worse (and 'better' - in the sense of racking up cheap kills that preclude any of the interesting mid-battle duels that used to happen), and now it's just not worth it anymore.

app_name: Fallout 3 - Game of the Year Edition
review_text: My stats are slightly confusing as they don't seem to count timing correctly. I must have played about 50-60 hours by now or so which is fair enough to make a review. As reference I finished the game once with a few side quests (about 30-40 hours, and made another build to do a casual powerrun which finished the game in 10-11 hours. Faster is possible obviously but you'd miss the entire idea behind the Fallout games if you did.  Compared to New Vegas, Fallout 3 is a lot more straightforward as less speech options really determine how the game flows, however at the same time more survival/radiation build. You get less traces on your map, less evident companions, you're more left to yourself basically. Which is nice too, it's just different from New Vegas.  Of course you'll always have Three Dog and a friendly reminder that not everyone wants to set the world on fire which is conforting in its own right.  All in all, a very decent RPG game that I can fully advice to anyone. BTW, if you only have a dualcore but you have windows 7, the game will run just fine ;)

Fun game, nice concept, but there is a reason the population died out; it's pretty much pay2win Starter vehicles are absolutely useless and take a LOT of certs to upgrade. Almost everything is class-specific and character-specific, even a simple thing like C4 has to be unlocked (and upgraded!) seperately on Heavy and Light assault classes.. and C4 basically doesnt even put a dent in a tank..  Planes are useless without upgraded weapons, and so are the tanks. There's also an exoskeleton called the 'MAX' which, again, is rediculously sh*t without upgrades, but crazy OP with a bunch of different weapons and a mechanic to keep it alive.. it can either be a 1 man army or a useless slowpoke depending on how much time/money you're willing to invest into it  5/10 fun game but extremely pay2win/grindy  oh, and there is absolutely no lore/story you get to learn about. you just get dropped on a massive world with 4 continents with no real clue what each faction is after/why they are fighting or anything like that.
Just play it. It's awesome, especially if you like a perfect mix of stealth and action. It helps that the story, characters and the setting are amazing!

Planetside 2 fulfills all the 'standard' FPS requirements of modern gaming. There's guns, there's violence, and finally, there's shenanigans. If you don't know what I mean by that, then you've never found a creative or humiliating way to kill someone in a game (of which Planetside 2 has plenty.) It goes above and beyond by having a balanced class structure, with all six classes having a distinct role in combat. With that said, and the aforementioned insane amount of weapons, attachments, and not to mention cosmetic items, you can play this game pretty much however you want. Want to spear the assault and go in guns blazing? Check. Want to be that sneaky, shady guy in the corner, promoting open-mindedness one bullet at a time? Check. Or maybe you want to be some form of support, either by repairing things or patching up people? Yup, it's got those too. The vehicles are very well implemented, too, allowing you to rule the skies in either fighter aircraft, gunships, or a large troop transporter. Add in tanks, buggies, ATV's, and a combat bus (No, I'm not making that up) and you make for an insanity-fest just waiting to happen. Oh, and the absolutely massive battles don't help this. Sometimes, you're in three man skirmishes, and other times... you just run face-first into an armored column of no less than thirty tanks. It's big, it's scary, and damn if it isn't fun. Even better, it's FREE! (As in, no money, no problems.)
Flying Earthshaker

Try this game if you are tired of limitations of session-based instanced game environments.   This game does not force you to do anything. It is persistent, it does not depend on you. It's not created just for you and a small number of players. Its a living large organism.  There is no 'match' going on, no particular battle with clear start and clear end that you must attend. This is war, Edge of Tomorrow style. Battles sparkle and die out across vast landmasses. In this war you can be whoever you want to be, without comitting to any particular fight or role.  You can be a relentless heavy or light assault throwing your body at the enemy. You can be an army engineer providing support for the troops and observing the battlefield from entrenchments. You can be a frantic medic rushing from body to body, trying to keep the fight going.  You can be an introvert sniper lurking in the hills. You can be a tanker. You can be a pilot.  The list goes on.
